original: yongs su gyur pa'i snga rol du dge slong tsam bsdus pa mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //üîΩde dang ldan pa'i ltar mkhan po med pa nyid la yang ngo zhes bya ba la /üîΩde dang ldan pa'i zhes bya ba ni mkhan po dang ldan pa la de'i sdom pa skye ba ltar mkhan po med pa nyid la yang sdom pa skye ba yin no //
analyzed: yongs su gyur pa'i snga rol du dge slong tsam bsdus pa mi rigs pa'i phyir ro // de dang ldan pa'i ltar mkhan po med pa nyid la yang ngo zhes bya ba la / de dang ldan pa'i zhes bya ba ni mkhan po dang ldan pa la de'i sdom pa skye ba ltar mkhan po med pa nyid la yang sdom pa skye ba yin no //
translated: Because it is illogical that the mere monk is included prior to the transformation.üîΩAlso, in the absence of a preceptor, one possesses that.üîΩIn the absence of a preceptor, one possesses that means that just as the vow arises in one who possesses a preceptor, so too the vow arises in one who lacks a preceptor.

original: de bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa nyid yin yang ngo zhes bya ba ni mkhan po de bsnyen par rdzogs pa nyid yin na yang mkhan po dang ldan pa'i sdom pa skye ba nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa nyid yin yang ngo zhes bya ba ni mkhan po de bsnyen par rdzogs pa nyid yin na yang mkhan po dang ldan pa'i sdom pa skye ba nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Also, in the absence of full ordination, one possesses that means that even if the preceptor lacks full ordination, the vow arises in one who possesses a preceptor.

original: de dge slong nyid ma yin par shes na ni mi skye'o zhes bya ba ni yang dag par len par byed pa bos mkhan po de bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa nyid dam nyams pa nyid yin pas dge slong nyid ma yin par shes nas ni mkhan po dang
analyzed: de dge slong nyid ma yin par shes na ni mi skye'o zhes bya ba ni yang dag par len par byed pa bos mkhan po de bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa nyid dam nyams pa nyid yin pas dge slong nyid ma yin par shes nas ni mkhan po dang
translated: If one knows that he is not a fully ordained monk, then the vows do not arise.

original: ldan pa'i sdom pa mi skye ba kho na'o //
analyzed: ldan pa'i sdom pa mi skye ba kho na'o //
translated: If one knows that the preceptor who is the one who gives the vows is not a fully ordained monk because he is not fully ordained or has been expelled, then the vows that are possessed by the preceptor do not arise.

original: 'dir gzhung ni bsnyen par rdzogs par 'tshal ba mkhan po rku thabs su gnas pas bsnyen par rdzogs par bgyid na bsnyen par rdzogs zhes bgyi'am /üîΩbsnyen par ma rdzogs zhes bgyi /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni bsnyen par rdzogs par 'tshal ba mkhan po rku thabs su gnas pas bsnyen par rdzogs par bgyid na bsnyen par rdzogs zhes bgyi'am / bsnyen par ma rdzogs zhes bgyi /
translated: Here, the text says: If one who wishes to be fully ordained is made fully ordained by a preceptor who is a thief, should it be said that he is fully ordained or not?

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Buddha said:

original: gal te bdag gi mkhan po rku thabs su gnas pa yin no zhes shes na ni bsnyen par ma rdzogs par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: gal te bdag gi mkhan po rku thabs su gnas pa yin no zhes shes na ni bsnyen par ma rdzogs par shes par bya'o //
translated: If he knows that his preceptor is a thief, then he should be understood as not fully ordained.

original: gal te mi shes na ni bsnyen par rdzogs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gal te mi shes na ni bsnyen par rdzogs zhes bya'o //
translated: If he does not know, then it should be said that he is fully ordained.

original: sngon ltung ba byung ba'am de bzhin no zhes gsungs pa la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: sngon ltung ba byung ba'am de bzhin no zhes gsungs pa la sogs pa yin no //

analyzed: dang por yengs pa khyim pa'i mkhan pos shes par bya'o //
translated: First, the householder preceptor should know that he is distracted.

original: 'o na mkhan po med pa nyid la yang sdom pa skye na /
analyzed: 'o na mkhan po med pa nyid la yang sdom pa skye na /
translated: If one generates the vow without a preceptor,

original: de bas na ji ltar shes bzhin du 'di la dge slong ma yin pa nyid du mi 'gyur ba gang gi phyir mi ldan pa shes pa'i bsam pa gyur pa dang tshul khrims la ma gus pa'i bsam par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas na ji ltar shes bzhin du 'di la dge slong ma yin pa nyid du mi 'gyur ba gang gi phyir mi ldan pa shes pa'i bsam pa gyur pa dang tshul khrims la ma gus pa'i bsam par 'gyur ro //
translated: then how could one not be a non-bhik·π£u, since one would not have the thought of knowing that one does not possess the vow and the thought of disrespecting ethics?

original: tshul khrims la don du mi gnyer bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de'i phyir 'di skye'o zhe na /üîΩde ma yin te /
analyzed: tshul khrims la don du mi gnyer bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de'i phyir 'di skye'o zhe na / de ma yin te /
translated: If one does not strive for ethics, then the vow would not arise.üîΩThat is not so, because if one knows that the preceptor is not a preceptor, then there is no contradiction in the vow arising in this case.

original: mkhan po nyid ma yin pa ji srid du shes na de'i phyir 'dir skye ba la 'gal ba med pa gang zhig mkhan po nyid bsnyen par rdzogs pa ma yin pa la sdom pa skye bar brjod pa de ni dge 'dun gyi dbang du mdzad na /
analyzed: mkhan po nyid ma yin pa ji srid du shes na de'i phyir 'dir skye ba la 'gal ba med pa gang zhig mkhan po nyid bsnyen par rdzogs pa ma yin pa la sdom pa skye bar brjod pa de ni dge 'dun gyi dbang du mdzad na /
translated: The statement that the vow arises in one who knows that the preceptor is not a preceptor and is not fully ordained is made from the perspective of the sa·πÖgha.

original: dge 'dun gyis bsnyen par rdzogs pa nyid ma yin pa shes bzhin @51b pa la skye ba yin gyi /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyis bsnyen par rdzogs pa nyid ma yin pa shes bzhin @51b pa la skye ba yin gyi /
translated: The vow arises in one who knows that the sa·πÖgha is not fully ordained.

original: bsnyen par rdzogs par lta bas ni ma yin zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bsnyen par rdzogs par lta bas ni ma yin zhes bya ba'o //
translated: But it is not seen that one becomes fully ordained by seeing the preceptor.

original: de'i phyir spong ba la yang mi skya'o zhes bya ba la sdom pa'i sgo nyid kyi phyir mkhan po la de'i phyir dbul zhing phyir spong bar byed na de la yang sdom pa mi skye'o //üîΩ'dir gzhung ni bsnyen par rdzogs par bgyid pa ni slar mkhan po spong bar bgyid na bsnyen par rdzogs zhes bgyi'am /
analyzed: de'i phyir spong ba la yang mi skya'o zhes bya ba la sdom pa'i sgo nyid kyi phyir mkhan po la de'i phyir dbul zhing phyir spong bar byed na de la yang sdom pa mi skye'o // 'dir gzhung ni bsnyen par rdzogs par bgyid pa ni slar mkhan po spong bar bgyid na bsnyen par rdzogs zhes bgyi'am /
translated: Therefore, one does not generate the vows by renouncing the preceptor, because the vows arise from the very door of the preceptor.üîΩHere the text states:

original: bsnyen par ma rdzogs zhes bgyi /
analyzed: bsnyen par ma rdzogs zhes bgyi /
translated: If one who is being fully ordained renounces the preceptor, is he called fully ordained or not fully ordained?

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /

original: bsnyen par ma rdzogs zhes brjod par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: bsnyen par ma rdzogs zhes brjod par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //

original: de gnyis kyi ming ma brjod na /üîΩyang mi skye'o zhes bya ba ni zhing dang mkhan po 'di dag la yang dag par len par byed pa 'am /
analyzed: de gnyis kyi ming ma brjod na / yang mi skye'o zhes bya ba ni zhing dang mkhan po 'di dag la yang dag par len par byed pa 'am /

analyzed: las byed pa dag gis mtshan ma brjod na sdom pa skye bar 'gyur ba ma yin no //

original: dge 'dun gyi na yang de'i skye gnas kyis mi skye'o zhes bya ba ni yang dag par len par byed pa'am las byed pa dag las gang yang rung bas dge 'dun gyi mtshan ma brjod na yang de'i skye gnas kyis zhes bya ba dge 'dun gyi skye gnas
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi na yang de'i skye gnas kyis mi skye'o zhes bya ba ni yang dag par len par byed pa'am las byed pa dag las gang yang rung bas dge 'dun gyi mtshan ma brjod na yang de'i skye gnas kyis zhes bya ba dge 'dun gyi skye gnas
translated: The basis of the Sa·πÖgha is the Sa·πÖgha itself.

original: de'i rigs kyi sdom pa la skye ba yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i rigs kyi sdom pa la skye ba yod pa ma yin no //
translated: The vow of that type does not arise through that basis.üîΩHere the text says:

analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni yang dag par len par byed pa'i phyir ni gang zag gsum ni bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa yin te /

original: las byed pa po'i phyir ni gzhung 'di yin te /
analyzed: las byed pa po'i phyir ni gzhung 'di yin te /

original: mkhan po dang bsnyen par rdzogs par 'tshal ba dang dge 'dun dang gsum gyi ming brjod par mi bgyid na bsnyen par rdzogs zhes bgyi 'am bsnyen par ma rdzogs zhes bgyi /
analyzed: mkhan po dang bsnyen par rdzogs par 'tshal ba dang dge 'dun dang gsum gyi ming brjod par mi bgyid na bsnyen par rdzogs zhes bgyi 'am bsnyen par ma rdzogs zhes bgyi /

original: bka' stsal pa ;
analyzed: bka' stsal pa ;
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: bsnyen par ma rdzogs zhes bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no /
analyzed: bsnyen par ma rdzogs zhes bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no /
translated: ‚ÄúIt should be called not full ordination.‚Äù

original: so sor nye bar gnas pa ma yin pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: so sor nye bar gnas pa ma yin pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: This is not a case of individual possession.

analyzed: 'di ni dge 'dun gyi so sor nye bar gnas pa ste / rjes su bzung ba po ma yin pa nyid kyis gang zhig dge 'dun gyi 'di mtshan nas ma brjod pa'o //

analyzed: gang zhig las byed pa pos yang dag par blangs pa de'i yul nyid khas blangs pas de mi byed pa'o //

original: gang zhig dge 'dun dang dge 'dun du byed pa po'i khas blangs pas de mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: gang zhig dge 'dun dang dge 'dun du byed pa po'i khas blangs pas de mi byed pa'o //

original: gang zhig mkhan po @52a * //
analyzed: gang zhig mkhan po @52a * //

analyzed: la las byed pa pos ming ma brjod pa de yang dge 'dun du byed pa po nyid la khas blang par bya ba ste /

analyzed: gang gi phyir las gang la der dge 'dun byed pa po nyid du rig par bya ste /
translated: Because the Sa·πÖgha is known as the one who makes the Sa·πÖgha in that rite.

original: de las gzhan pa'i las de byad pa'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i las de byad pa'o //
translated: The rite of accepting the novice monk vows is different from that.

original: mkhan pa la yang dag par len pa pos ming brjod pa gang yin pa de las gang la byed pa mkhan po dang bcas pa de la de'i yul nyid kyis so sor nye bar gnas pa'o //
analyzed: mkhan pa la yang dag par len pa pos ming brjod pa gang yin pa de las gang la byed pa mkhan po dang bcas pa de la de'i yul nyid kyis so sor nye bar gnas pa'o //
translated: The rite of accepting the novice monk vows in which the name of the preceptor is mentioned is the rite in which the preceptor is the one who makes the Sa·πÖgha.

original: de bas na 'di rnams kyi mtshan nas ma brjod par sdom pa mi skye'o //
analyzed: de bas na 'di rnams kyi mtshan nas ma brjod par sdom pa mi skye'o //
translated: Therefore, the vows are not produced without mentioning the names of these.üîΩThey are not produced in the banner of the householder and tƒ´rthikas.

original: khyim pa dang mu stegs can gyi rgyal mtshan la yang mi skye'o zhes bya ba ni rgyal mtshan can dang so sor yongs su rdzogs pa ste /
analyzed: khyim pa dang mu stegs can gyi rgyal mtshan la yang mi skye'o zhes bya ba ni rgyal mtshan can dang so sor yongs su rdzogs pa ste /
translated: The banner is the complete individual.

original: khyim pa'i rgyal mtshan can dang mu stegs kyi rgyal mtshan can la zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: khyim pa'i rgyal mtshan can dang mu stegs kyi rgyal mtshan can la zhes bya ba'o //

original: 'dir ni 'bru mang po can gyi bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: 'dir ni 'bru mang po can gyi bsdu ba'o //

original: khyim pa'i rgyal mtshan gang la yod pa dang mu stegs kyi rgyal mtshan gang la yod pa der ni khyim pa'i rgyal mtshan can dang mu stegs can gyi rgyal mtshan can zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: khyim pa'i rgyal mtshan gang la yod pa dang mu stegs kyi rgyal mtshan gang la yod pa der ni khyim pa'i rgyal mtshan can dang mu stegs can gyi rgyal mtshan can zhes bya ba'o //
translated: One who has the householder‚Äôs banner and one who has the heretic‚Äôs banner.

original: rgyal mtshan 'di gang 'dzin pa dag la sdom pa mi skye ste /
analyzed: rgyal mtshan 'di gang 'dzin pa dag la sdom pa mi skye ste /

original: 'dir rgyal mtshan ni cha byad do //
analyzed: 'dir rgyal mtshan ni cha byad do //
translated: Here, the banner is the costume.

original: sgren mo dang 'khrugs pa dang mtshan dug ma la yang mi skye'o zhes bya ba la sdom pa mi skye'o zhes bya ba dang rjes su 'brel lo //
analyzed: sgren mo dang 'khrugs pa dang mtshan dug ma la yang mi skye'o zhes bya ba la sdom pa mi skye'o zhes bya ba dang rjes su 'brel lo //
translated: It also does not arise in one who is naked, or in one who is disturbed, or in one who is hermaphroditic.üîΩThe vow does not arise in one who is naked, or in one who is disturbed, or in one who is hermaphroditic.

original: yang dag par blangs pa las sgren mor gyur ba mu stegs can gyi rgyal mtshan zhes bya ba 'di nyid kyis bsdus pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yang dag par blangs pa las sgren mor gyur ba mu stegs can gyi rgyal mtshan zhes bya ba 'di nyid kyis bsdus pa'i phyir /
translated: It is included in the heretic‚Äôs banner, which is one who has become naked through taking a vow.

original: sgren mo'i tshig ni don gzhan can rab tu dor nas sems rab tu bzung ba nyid gnas skabs de la de'i phyir sdom pa mi skye'o //
analyzed: sgren mo'i tshig ni don gzhan can rab tu dor nas sems rab tu bzung ba nyid gnas skabs de la de'i phyir sdom pa mi skye'o //
translated: The vow does not arise in that situation because the mind is completely focused on the meaning of the words, not on the naked body.

original: 'khrugs pa nyid kyis de la brtan pa nyid med pa de la yang sdom pa mi skye'o ;
analyzed: 'khrugs pa nyid kyis de la brtan pa nyid med pa de la yang sdom pa mi skye'o ;
translated: The vow also does not arise in one who is unstable due to agitation.

original: /'dir mtshan dug ma'i gzhung ni /
analyzed: /'dir mtshan dug ma'i gzhung ni /
translated: Here is the text of the Vinaya:

original: re zhig mtshan dug ma zhig btsun pa rnams kyis bsnyen par rdzogs par bgyid na bsnyen par rdzogs zhes bgyi'am bsnyen par ma rdzogs zhes bgyi /
analyzed: re zhig mtshan dug ma zhig btsun pa rnams kyis bsnyen par rdzogs par bgyid na bsnyen par rdzogs zhes bgyi'am bsnyen par ma rdzogs zhes bgyi /
translated: ‚ÄúIf bhik·π£us give full ordination to someone with a poisoned body, should that be called full ordination or not?‚Äù

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Buddha said:

original: bsnyen par rdzogs zhes bya ste /
analyzed: bsnyen par rdzogs zhes bya ste /

original: bsnyen par rdzogs par byed pa rnams 'gal tshabs can du 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: bsnyen par rdzogs par byed pa rnams 'gal tshabs can du 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Those who give full ordination are guilty of a grave offense.‚Äù

original: mtshan dug ma ni sngar gang dang mnyam par sbyor bas skyes pa 'chi ba'o //
analyzed: mtshan dug ma ni sngar gang dang mnyam par sbyor bas skyes pa 'chi ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúPoisoned body‚Äù means the body of a man who died while having sexual intercourse with a woman.

original: rgyu las bzlog pa'i chad pa khas mi len pa gnas nas phyung ba la yang mi skye'o zhes bya ba ni lta ba dang bcas pa dri ba dang bral ba zhes bya ba'i @52b bsam pa can la sdom pa skye'o //
analyzed: rgyu las bzlog pa'i chad pa khas mi len pa gnas nas phyung ba la yang mi skye'o zhes bya ba ni lta ba dang bcas pa dri ba dang bral ba zhes bya ba'i @52b bsam pa can la sdom pa skye'o //
translated: And if one does not accept the opposite of the cause, the downfall, then the vow does not arise even in one who is expelled.

original: de bas na ltung ba ma mthong ba la sogs pa'i rgyu gang gis gnas nas dbyung ba'i las byas pa rgyu de las bzlog pa la sogs pa de khas mi len pa la yang sdom pa mi skye'o //
analyzed: de bas na ltung ba ma mthong ba la sogs pa'i rgyu gang gis gnas nas dbyung ba'i las byas pa rgyu de las bzlog pa la sogs pa de khas mi len pa la yang sdom pa mi skye'o //
translated: Thus, if one does not accept the opposite of the cause, the downfall, by which the act of expulsion was performed, then the vow does not arise.

original: 'dir gnas nas phyung ba smos pa ni dpe tsam du zad kyi /
analyzed: 'dir gnas nas phyung ba smos pa ni dpe tsam du zad kyi /
translated: Here, the mention of expulsion is merely an example.

original: smad pa thams cad la yang cho ga 'di yin te /
analyzed: smad pa thams cad la yang cho ga 'di yin te /
translated: This procedure applies to all condemnations.

original: 'thab mo byed pa la sogs pa'i bsam pa can la yang mi bzlog pa'i bsam pa can nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: 'thab mo byed pa la sogs pa'i bsam pa can la yang mi bzlog pa'i bsam pa can nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Even if one has the intention to fight, etc., the vow does not arise if one does not have the intention to refrain from that.

original: tshig snga ma med pa nyid la ni nyes byas tsam du zad do //
analyzed: tshig snga ma med pa nyid la ni nyes byas tsam du zad do //
translated: If one does not have the previous words, it is merely a minor offense.

original: dge bsnyen nyid med par dge tshul nyid du khas len pa dang dge tshul nyid med par dge slong nyid khas len par byed na nyes byas tsam du 'gyur gyi sdom pa mi skye bar ni mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge bsnyen nyid med par dge tshul nyid du khas len pa dang dge tshul nyid med par dge slong nyid khas len par byed na nyes byas tsam du 'gyur gyi sdom pa mi skye bar ni mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If one accepts novice monk vows without the vows of a layperson and accepts full ordination without novice monk vows, one commits a fault of wrong conduct, but the vows are still obtained.

original: 'dir gzhung ni /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni /
translated: Here is the text:

original: khyim pa rab tu ma byung ba zhig bsnyen par rdzogs par bgyid na /
analyzed: khyim pa rab tu ma byung ba zhig bsnyen par rdzogs par bgyid na /
translated: If a layperson who has not gone forth is fully ordained,

original: bsnyen par rdzogs zhes bgyi'am bsnyen par ma rdzogs zhes bgyi /
analyzed: bsnyen par rdzogs zhes bgyi'am bsnyen par ma rdzogs zhes bgyi /
translated: is it called full ordination or not?

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Buddha said:

original: nye ba 'khor bsnyen par rdzogs zhes bya ste /
analyzed: nye ba 'khor bsnyen par rdzogs zhes bya ste /
translated: Upali, it is called full ordination,

original: bsnyen par rdzogs par byed pa po rnams la ni nyes byas kyi ltung bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //

analyzed: mkhan por ma gsol ba la yang ngo //

original: bar chad ma dris par yang ngo zhes bya ba ni 'dir gnyis ka la yang nyes byas yin te /üîΩsdom pa mi skye ba ni ma yin zhes bya ba dang rjes su 'brel lo //

original: de med par khas len pa la sbyin na yang ngo zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de med par khas len pa la sbyin na yang ngo zhes bya ba la /

analyzed: yang dag par len pa pos bdag bar chad yod do zhes bya ba khas blangs na sdom pa 'bogs pa la nyes byas tsam yin gyi mi skye ba ni ma yin no //

original: 'dir gzhung ni gleng gzhi rnams las /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni gleng gzhi rnams las /
translated: Here is the text from the K·π£udraka Collection:

analyzed: btsun pa re zhig bar chad kyi chos rnams dang ldan no zhes mchi ba zhig bsnyen par rdzogs par bgyid na bsnyen par rdzogs zhes bgyi 'am ma rdzogs zhes bgyi /

analyzed: bsnyen par rdzogs par byed pa po rnams la 'gal tshabs can du 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //

analyzed: de bas na gang du bar chod mngon par 'dod pas rnam par gnas te /

original: rnam pa gang zhig la bdag ni bsnyen par rdzogs pa'o //üîΩskyes pa 'dra ba'i bud med nyid dang / bud med 'dra ba'i skyes pa nyid mtshan gyi rnam pa gzhan ma yin @53a * //
analyzed: rnam pa gang zhig la bdag ni bsnyen par rdzogs pa'o // skyes pa 'dra ba'i bud med nyid dang / bud med 'dra ba'i skyes pa nyid mtshan gyi rnam pa gzhan ma yin @53a * //
translated: ‚ÄúWhat is the form of the person in whom I will receive full ordination?‚ÄùüîΩThe non-arising of the vows in a woman who is like a man, or in a man who is like a woman, that is, in one whose sex is not distinct, is taught here by the word ‚Äúalso.‚Äù

original: pa la yang zhes bya ba 'dir sdom pa mi skye ba ste zhes bya ba de la 'di rab tu bstan te mtshan rnam pa gzhan nyid kyi phyir 'dir skye bar mi 'gyur ro //

original: de yang 'dir mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de yang 'dir mi 'gyur te /

original: sdig sdig lta bu'i mtshan nyid can dang gling gzhan nas skyes pa'i tshul byad mi 'dra ba gnyis kyang ngo zhes bya ba ni 'di dag la yang lag rdum la sogs pas 'phangs pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //

translated: The two, one with the characteristic of a sinner and the other born in another continent with a different appearance, are also called human.

analyzed: sdig sdig lta bu'i mtshan nyid can gyi gzhung ni /

translated: The text on one born in another continent also says, ‚ÄúVenerable, if the monks of Jambudvƒ´pa fully ordain one from Videha in the east, is it a full ordination?

analyzed: ji srid du nye ba 'khor bsnyen par rdzogs zhes bya ste /

original: bsnyen par rdzogs par byed pa po rnams ni 'gal tshabs can du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du rgyas par 'khor lo bzhin du sbyar ba gsum pa yin no //

translated: In this way, the three wheels are applied in detail.üîΩThe shape, size, and condition of the human abodes are clearly evident in the continents.

translated: They have one nail, their hands are crippled and bent, they are paralyzed on one side, they are hunchbacked, they are crooked, they are bent and crooked, they have six nails, they are stuck together, they are missing,üîΩtheir eyelashes are turned inward, they are like a rabbit, they are like an owl, they are inverted, they are matted, they are long, they are hairy, they are round, they are squinting, they are infected, they are pockmarked,

analyzed: khyod nad pa yin nam zhes bya ba 'dis 'phangs pa nyid ces bya ba'i don to //

translated: The hair is matted: the hair is matted like a madman‚Äôs.üîΩThe body is bent, crooked, and twisted: the three terms refer to the three types of hunchback.

analyzed: nang du sgur ba dang phyir dgye ba dang / mdun rgyab tu sgur ba zhes bya ba ni de gzhan du gsungs te /

analyzed: zhar ba sor gdub skur mi'u thung // zhes smos ste /

analyzed: / sor mo drug pa nyid dang / sor mo 'byar ba nyid dang / sor mo med par gyur pa nyid tsam sor mo'i gdengs ka'i lag pa can te /

analyzed: mig bar 'dzings pa ni gang gi sna gong gtan med la mig g-yas g-yon 'brel ba'o //

analyzed: mig zlum po zhes bya ba ni gang gi mig dag gi 'bras bu zlum po de'i mig dag go //

analyzed: de la mig po che dang / zhes bya ba ni gang gi mig ha cang che ba'o //

analyzed: rna ba ser ba dang dkar ba dang dmar ba dang sbubs can zhes bya ba ni yang rna ba zhes bya ba'i sgra so sor sbyar te /

analyzed: rna ba ser ba dang / rna ba dkar ba dang / rna ba dmar ba dang / rna ba sbubs can no //
translated: ‚ÄúYellow ears‚Äù means ears that are yellow; ‚Äúwhite ears‚Äù means ears that are white; ‚Äúred ears‚Äù means ears that are red; and ‚Äúfolded ears‚Äù means ears that are folded.üîΩThe terms ‚Äúdog‚Äôs worry,‚Äù ‚Äúdog‚Äôs throw,‚Äù and ‚Äúdog‚Äôs great‚Äù are to be understood as ‚Äúworry of a dog,‚Äù etc.

original: khyi rdo g-ya' ba dang 'phungs pa dang / che ba zhes bya ba yang khyi g-ya' ba dang / khyi rdo 'phungs pa dang / khyi rdo che ba'o //
analyzed: khyi rdo g-ya' ba dang 'phungs pa dang / che ba zhes bya ba yang khyi g-ya' ba dang / khyi rdo 'phungs pa dang / khyi rdo che ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúDog‚Äôs worry‚Äù means a worry that is like a dog‚Äôs; ‚Äúdog‚Äôs throw‚Äù means a throw that is like a dog‚Äôs; and ‚Äúdog‚Äôs great‚Äù means a great thing that is like a dog‚Äôs.

original: rlig pa'i nang du mtshan nub pa dang zhes bya ba ni gang gi rlig pa gnyis kyis pho mtshan gang g-yogs pa'o //
analyzed: rlig pa'i nang du mtshan nub pa dang zhes bya ba ni gang gi rlig pa gnyis kyis pho mtshan gang g-yogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe male organ is retracted into the body‚Äù means that the male organ is covered by two testicles.

original: glen pa dang lce med pa dang rkang lag gcig pa dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: glen pa dang lce med pa dang rkang lag gcig pa dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: ‚ÄúThe idiot,‚Äù ‚Äúthe mute,‚Äù and ‚Äúthe one-legged‚Äù are to be understood as ‚Äúan idiot,‚Äù etc.

original: glen pa zhes bya ba'i sgra ni bsnyen @54b par rdzogs par mi shes zhes bya ba 'di bsdus pa nyid do //
analyzed: glen pa zhes bya ba'i sgra ni bsnyen @54b par rdzogs par mi shes zhes bya ba 'di bsdus pa nyid do //
translated: The term ‚Äúidiot‚Äù is to be understood as ‚Äúone who does not know how to receive the full ordination.‚Äù

original: lce med pa zhes bya ba ni lce gtan med pa'o //
analyzed: lce med pa zhes bya ba ni lce gtan med pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe mute‚Äù means one who is completely mute.

original: lkugs pa'i tshig gis ni lce yod du zin kyang smra bar mi nus pa ni lkugs pa ste /
analyzed: lkugs pa'i tshig gis ni lce yod du zin kyang smra bar mi nus pa ni lkugs pa ste /

original: gzhan ni lce med pa zhes bya ba brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan ni lce med pa zhes bya ba brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The other is called tongueless.

original: rkang lag gcig pa dang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rkang lag gcig pa dang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One-legged means

original: rkang lag gi sgra dag gis so sor 'brel ba ste lag pa gcig pa dang / rkang ba gcig pa dang lag pa med pa dang rkang pa med pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rkang lag gi sgra dag gis so sor 'brel ba ste lag pa gcig pa dang / rkang ba gcig pa dang lag pa med pa dang rkang pa med pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: that the words leg and arm are connected individually, meaning one-armed, one-legged, no arms, and no legs.

original: skra sngo zhes bya ba ni yung ba'i kha dog las gzhan pa'i kha dog la bya ste /
analyzed: skra sngo zhes bya ba ni yung ba'i kha dog las gzhan pa'i kha dog la bya ste /
translated: Blue-haired means a color other than the color of indigo.

original: de bas na yung ba'i tshig gis sngon po la brjod pa nyid do //
analyzed: de bas na yung ba'i tshig gis sngon po la brjod pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, the word indigo refers to blue.

original: mog glang po che'i lta bu dang / rta'i lta bu dang / khye'i lta bu dang / ba glang gi lta bu dang / lug gi lta bu dang / ri dags kyi lta bu dang / nya'i lta bu dang / sbrul gyi lta bu dang /
analyzed: mog glang po che'i lta bu dang / rta'i lta bu dang / khye'i lta bu dang / ba glang gi lta bu dang / lug gi lta bu dang / ri dags kyi lta bu dang / nya'i lta bu dang / sbrul gyi lta bu dang /
translated: Elephant-eyed, horse-eyed, child-eyed, bull-eyed, sheep-eyed, deer-eyed, fish-eyed, and snake-eyed.

original: ring ba dang mang ba zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ring ba dang mang ba zhes bya ba la /
translated: Long and many.

original: mgo'i sgra ni so sor sbyar te /
analyzed: mgo'i sgra ni so sor sbyar te /
translated: The word ‚Äúhead‚Äù is to be supplied in each case.

original: mgo glang po che'i lta bu dang / mgo rta'i lta bu dang / mgo khyi'i lta bu dang / mgo ba glang gi lta bu dang / mgo lug gi lta bu dang / mgo ri dags kyi lta bu dang / mgo nya'i lta bu dang /
analyzed: mgo glang po che'i lta bu dang / mgo rta'i lta bu dang / mgo khyi'i lta bu dang / mgo ba glang gi lta bu dang / mgo lug gi lta bu dang / mgo ri dags kyi lta bu dang / mgo nya'i lta bu dang /
translated: They are: those with an elephant head, those with a horse head, those with a dog head, those with a bull head, those with a sheep head, those with a deer head, those with a fish head,

original: mgo sbrul gyi lta bu dang / mgo ring ba dang / mgo mang po zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mgo sbrul gyi lta bu dang / mgo ring ba dang / mgo mang po zhes bya ba'o //
translated: those with a snake head, those with a long head, and those with many heads.

original: thams cad sngo ba dang / thams cad ser ba dang / thams cad dmar ba dang / thams cad dkar ba zhes bya ba la gang zhig 'di yang 'don pa de rnams la yang lus kyi kha dog bzhi rnams kyis de ltar brjod pa nyid do //
analyzed: thams cad sngo ba dang / thams cad ser ba dang / thams cad dmar ba dang / thams cad dkar ba zhes bya ba la gang zhig 'di yang 'don pa de rnams la yang lus kyi kha dog bzhi rnams kyis de ltar brjod pa nyid do //
translated: They are: those who are all blue, those who are all yellow, those who are all red, and those who are all white. Those who recite this also have bodies with these four colors.

original: mgul ta la lta bu dang / skrangs pa dang / skrangs pas dub pa dang / spyod lam gyis dub pa zhes bya ba'o //üîΩrkun pos ni phung krol pa'o zhes bya ba ni 'phangs pa nyid do zhes bya ba dang rjes su 'brel to //
analyzed: mgul ta la lta bu dang / skrangs pa dang / skrangs pas dub pa dang / spyod lam gyis dub pa zhes bya ba'o //üîΩrkun pos ni phung krol pa'o zhes bya ba ni 'phangs pa nyid do zhes bya ba dang rjes su 'brel to //
translated: They are: those with a goiter, those with a boil, those with a chronic boil, and those who are exhausted from activity.üîΩThey are: those who are ruined by thieves, those who are ruined by debt, those who are ruined by punishment, and those who are ruined by fear.

original: sdig pa la 'jug pa mnyam pa nyid kyi thun mong gis so //
analyzed: sdig pa la 'jug pa mnyam pa nyid kyi thun mong gis so //
translated: The commonality of the equality of engagement in evil.

original: 'o na so so nyid du 'gyur bar smos pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na so so nyid du 'gyur bar smos pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: But isn't it said that they are each individually?

original: de'i phyir phung krol bar gyur pa yang rkun po ni snying rje dang bcas shing gzhan la 'phrog pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir phung krol bar gyur pa yang rkun po ni snying rje dang bcas shing gzhan la 'phrog pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, the one who is in trouble is the thief who is compassionate and robs others,

original: thams cad kyi thams cad du gang gi phyir phal cher srog gcod pa la 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad kyi thams cad du gang gi phyir phal cher srog gcod pa la 'jug pa'o //
translated: because he is mostly engaged in killing.

original: phung krol ba ni rkun po ma yin par gyur pa snying rje med pa gsad bya gsod par byed pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: phung krol ba ni rkun po ma yin par gyur pa snying rje med pa gsad bya gsod par byed pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The one who is in trouble is not the thief who is without compassion, the killer of the one to be killed, and so on.

original: de bas na 'di la so sor nyid du'o //üîΩrgyal po pha ma'i bsam pa can nyid kyis gnang ba ni pha ma dang 'dra ba'o zhes bya ba ni pha ma'i bsam pa can @55a * //
analyzed: de bas na 'di la so sor nyid du'o // rgyal po pha ma'i bsam pa can nyid kyis gnang ba ni pha ma dang 'dra ba'o zhes bya ba ni pha ma'i bsam pa can @55a * //
translated: Therefore, it is each individually in this case.

original: nyid kyi rgyal pas gnas ba ni pha ma dag nyid kyis gnang bar blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: nyid kyi rgyal pas gnas ba ni pha ma dag nyid kyis gnang bar blta bar bya ste /
translated: The one who is permitted by the king who has the intention of his parents is like his parents. The one who is permitted by the king who has the intention of his parents should be seen as permitted by his parents themselves.

original: rgyal pos gnang bas rab tu dbyung ba la skyon med do zhes bya bar dgongs pa'o //üîΩyongs su 'dzin par byed pa gnyis kyang gnang ba dang bsrel ba dang zhu ba dag la pha ma nyid dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba ni skyed par byed pa nyid med pa la yang pha mas yongs su bzung bas gnas pa dag gis gnang ba la zhag bdun
analyzed: rgyal pos gnang bas rab tu dbyung ba la skyon med do zhes bya bar dgongs pa'o // yongs su 'dzin par byed pa gnyis kyang gnang ba dang bsrel ba dang zhu ba dag la pha ma nyid dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba ni skyed par byed pa nyid med pa la yang pha mas yongs su bzung bas gnas pa dag gis gnang ba la zhag bdun
translated: The king's permission is sufficient.üîΩThe two who are held by others are like parents in that they must be asked for permission and ransomed.üîΩThose who are held by others are those who live with the permission of their parents, even though they are not their progenitors.üîΩThey must be asked for permission for seven days to join the order and they must be ransomed from the sa·πÖgha.

original: bzung ba dang / dge 'dun la zhu ba byed pa la pha ma nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: bzung ba dang / dge 'dun la zhu ba byed pa la pha ma nyid yin gyi /
translated: They are like parents.

original: skyed par byed pa dag kho nas yongs su 'dzin pa po nyid kyis gnas pa dag la ni ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to /
analyzed: skyed par byed pa dag kho nas yongs su 'dzin pa po nyid kyis gnas pa dag la ni ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to /
translated: This means that those who live with their progenitors are not held by them.

original: 'dir gzhung ni /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni /
translated: The text says:

original: btsun pa bu bcos ma zhig re zhig bsnyen par rdzogs par bgyid na su'i drung du bzod pa gsol bar bgyi /
analyzed: btsun pa bu bcos ma zhig re zhig bsnyen par rdzogs par bgyid na su'i drung du bzod pa gsol bar bgyi /
translated: ‚ÄúLord, if a stepchild is fully ordained, to whom should she request patience?‚Äù

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: He replied:

original: bu nyid dang 'dra bas gang gis khas blangs pa de la'o //
analyzed: bu nyid dang 'dra bas gang gis khas blangs pa de la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúShe should request patience from whoever accepted her as a child.‚Äù

original: de bzhin du bu mo bcos ma yang bu mo nyid dang 'dra bar gang gis khas blangs pa de la'o zhes bya ba gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du bu mo bcos ma yang bu mo nyid dang 'dra bar gang gis khas blangs pa de la'o zhes bya ba gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Likewise, a counterfeit daughter is like a daughter for whoever accepts her as such.üîΩThe two types of nonhuman reincarnating beings are not,

original: mi ma yin pa'i 'gro ba pa gnyis ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni pha ma gnyis zhes bya ba dang rjes su 'brel to //
analyzed: mi ma yin pa'i 'gro ba pa gnyis ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni pha ma gnyis zhes bya ba dang rjes su 'brel to //
translated: because they are not related to the terms ‚Äúmother‚Äù and ‚Äúfather.‚Äù

original: 'dir gzhung ni /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni /
translated: Here is the text:

original: btsun pa re zhig gang gi pha ma dag dus byas par gyur tam /
analyzed: btsun pa re zhig gang gi pha ma dag dus byas par gyur tam /
translated: ‚ÄúReverend, if the parents of a monk die,

original: dud 'gro'i skyes gnas su song ba lags na de'i skra breg pa'i phyir dge 'dun thams cad la zhu bar bgyi'am /
analyzed: dud 'gro'i skyes gnas su song ba lags na de'i skra breg pa'i phyir dge 'dun thams cad la zhu bar bgyi'am /
translated: or if they become nonhuman, should he ask the whole sa·πÉgha for permission to cut his hair?‚Äù

original: nye ba 'khor 'di ni ma yin no zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: nye ba 'khor 'di ni ma yin no zhes gsungs so //
translated: UpƒÅli, this is not the case.‚Äù

original: de gnyis las mtshams med par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni pha ma mi'i 'gro ba ni ma yin pa skyed par byed pa dag gis ni 'di mtshams med pa mi skyed pa'o //
analyzed: de gnyis las mtshams med par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni pha ma mi'i 'gro ba ni ma yin pa skyed par byed pa dag gis ni 'di mtshams med pa mi skyed pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThey do not commit a heinous act‚Äù means that they do not commit a heinous act by killing their parents who are not human or who have not generated an uninterrupted sin.

original: de ni skyed par byed pa gnyis las te mtshan gyur pa gnyis las kyang ngo zhes bya ba ni ma skyes pa nyid du gyur tam /
analyzed: de ni skyed par byed pa gnyis las te mtshan gyur pa gnyis las kyang ngo zhes bya ba ni ma skyes pa nyid du gyur tam /
translated: It is from two causes, from two causes of generation, and also from two causes of change of sex.

original: pha bud med nyid du gyur na yang mtshams med pa 'byung bar 'gyur ba kho na yin no //
analyzed: pha bud med nyid du gyur na yang mtshams med pa 'byung bar 'gyur ba kho na yin no //
translated: Even if the mother has not been born, or if the father has become a woman, the heinous act occurs.

original: ma bsad ba la sogs pa de byas pa nyid gtso bor zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ma bsad ba la sogs pa de byas pa nyid gtso bor zhes bya ba la /
translated: The act itself is primary in killing one‚Äôs mother, etc.

original: de byas pa nyid ni mtshams med pa byas pa nyid de gang zhig ma gsod pa la sogs pa rnams la rab tu dbyung ba'i phyir bkag pa gang yin pa de byas pa nyid de mtshams med pa de byas pa nyid du rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: de byas pa nyid ni mtshams med pa byas pa nyid de gang zhig ma gsod pa la sogs pa rnams la rab tu dbyung ba'i phyir bkag pa gang yin pa de byas pa nyid de mtshams med pa de byas pa nyid du rtogs par bya'o //
translated: The act itself is the act of committing a heinous act. The act itself is the act of committing a heinous act, which is the act of killing one‚Äôs mother, etc., that is prohibited in order to be ordained.

original: de'i phyir mtshams med pa byed pa po ni rab tu 'byung bar mi bya zhes bya ba thams cad du yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir mtshams med pa byed pa po ni rab tu 'byung bar mi bya zhes bya ba thams cad du yin te /
translated: Therefore, one who commits a heinous act should not be ordained.

original: ma bsad pa rab tu 'byung bar mi bya'o @55b zhes bya ba de lta bu'i gtso bo can de ma yin no //
analyzed: ma bsad pa rab tu 'byung bar mi bya'o @55b zhes bya ba de lta bu'i gtso bo can de ma yin no //
translated: The act itself is primary, not the act of killing one‚Äôs mother, etc.

original: de ltar na yang dud 'gro'i skye gnas su gtogs pa'i ma gsod par byed pa la rab tu dbyung ba bkag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na yang dud 'gro'i skye gnas su gtogs pa'i ma gsod par byed pa la rab tu dbyung ba bkag par 'gyur ro //
translated: But if that is so, then it would be prohibited to go forth if one has killed a mother who is an animal.

original: skyes pas dge slong ma la ji zhig byas na dge slong ma sun phyung bar 'gyur zhing bud med kyis kyang dge slong la ji zhig byas na sun phyung bar 'gyur ci'i phyir de gnyis su bstan zhe na /
analyzed: skyes pas dge slong ma la ji zhig byas na dge slong ma sun phyung bar 'gyur zhing bud med kyis kyang dge slong la ji zhig byas na sun phyung bar 'gyur ci'i phyir de gnyis su bstan zhe na /
translated: What is done by a man to a nun that is called defiling a nun? What is done by a woman to a monk that is called defiling a monk? Why are those two taught?

original: de'i phyir pham par gyur pa ma byung ba nyid la mi tshangs par spyod pas nyams su myong ba dag sun phyung ba nyid yin no zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir pham par gyur pa ma byung ba nyid la mi tshangs par spyod pas nyams su myong ba dag sun phyung ba nyid yin no zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore it is said: ‚ÄúDefiling a nun is experiencing sexual intercourse with a nun who has not already had a root downfall.‚Äù

original: 'dir gzhung ni btsun ba ji tsam gyis na dge slong ma sun phyung ba zhes bgyi /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni btsun ba ji tsam gyis na dge slong ma sun phyung ba zhes bgyi /
translated: Here the text is: ‚ÄúVenerable, by how much is a nun defiled?‚Äù

original: nye ba 'khor gang gis mi tshangs par spyad pas dge slong ma sun phyung bar gyur na'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: nye ba 'khor gang gis mi tshangs par spyad pas dge slong ma sun phyung bar gyur na'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúUpƒÅli, if a nun is defiled by sexual intercourse.‚Äù

original: ci sems gang yang rung ba'i sems dag la 'di 'byung bar 'gyur ram zhe na /
analyzed: ci sems gang yang rung ba'i sems dag la 'di 'byung bar 'gyur ram zhe na /
translated: Does this occur in any mind whatsoever?

original: de'i phyir nyams su myong ba dag la zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir nyams su myong ba dag la zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore he says, ‚Äúin the case of experience.‚Äù

original: bgrod par bya ba yang sun phyung bar 'gyur la bgrod pa po la yang sun phyung bar 'gyur ba zhes bya ba 'di bstan pa'i don du 'dir gnyis pa'i tshig go //üîΩbrjod pa dang bcas pa'i zlas nyams su myong bas sun phyung ba nyid mi 'gyur ba zhes bya ba 'di la 'dir zlas nyams su myong ba yan lag ma yin pa nyid de gang gi phyir gzhan gyi nyes pas gzhan la mi gos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bgrod par bya ba yang sun phyung bar 'gyur la bgrod pa po la yang sun phyung bar 'gyur ba zhes bya ba 'di bstan pa'i don du 'dir gnyis pa'i tshig go // brjod pa dang bcas pa'i zlas nyams su myong bas sun phyung ba nyid mi 'gyur ba zhes bya ba 'di la 'dir zlas nyams su myong ba yan lag ma yin pa nyid de gang gi phyir gzhan gyi nyes pas gzhan la mi gos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The point of this statement is to show that the goer is refuted and the path is refuted.üîΩThe word ‚Äúexperience‚Äù is not a part of the statement, because one is not defiled by the faults of another.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba sun phyung ba la yang sun 'byin pa nyid mi 'gyur bar thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba sun phyung ba la yang sun 'byin pa nyid mi 'gyur bar thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: And it is not the case that one who is free from attachment is refuted by the refutation of the other.

original: 'dun pa zhes bya ba'i tshig gang yin pa de ni 'dir lung ste /
analyzed: 'dun pa zhes bya ba'i tshig gang yin pa de ni 'dir lung ste /
translated: The word ‚Äúdesire‚Äù is a scriptural reference.

original: rang gi 'dod pas zhes bya ba 'di'i don to //
analyzed: rang gi 'dod pas zhes bya ba 'di'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning of ‚Äúby one‚Äôs own desire.‚Äù

original: ci pham par gyur pa byung ba'i yul la yang dge slong dang dge slong ma nyid yod dam gnas skabs de dang ldan pa 'di dag la yang sun 'byin par bgyid na sun phyung ba nyid du 'gyur ram zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: ci pham par gyur pa byung ba'i yul la yang dge slong dang dge slong ma nyid yod dam gnas skabs de dang ldan pa 'di dag la yang sun 'byin par bgyid na sun phyung ba nyid du 'gyur ram zhe na ma yin te /
translated: If a monk or nun is in a place where a defeated person is present, or if they are in a situation where they have been defeated, does that defeat them? No, it does not.

original: de'i phyir pham par gyur pa ma byung ba nyid la zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir pham par gyur pa ma byung ba nyid la zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, the text says, ‚Äúif a defeat has not occurred.‚Äù

original: 'dir gzhung ni /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni /
translated: Here is the text:

original: btsun pa re zhig gang zag brgyad kyis dge slong ma gcig la dngos po brgyad po re res sun 'byin par bgyid na dge slong ma de sun phyung ba zhes bgyi'am /
analyzed: btsun pa re zhig gang zag brgyad kyis dge slong ma gcig la dngos po brgyad po re res sun 'byin par bgyid na dge slong ma de sun phyung ba zhes bgyi'am /
translated: ‚ÄúLord, if eight people each defeat a nun with one of the eight things, is that nun defeated?‚Äù

original: nye ba 'khor sun phyung ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nye ba 'khor sun phyung ba zhes bya'o //
translated: ‚ÄúUpƒÅli, she is defeated.‚Äù

original: gang zag de rnams las du zhig gis dge slong ma sun phyung ba zhes bgyi /üîΩbka' stsal pa /üîΩnye ba 'khor @56a * //
analyzed: gang zag de rnams las du zhig gis dge slong ma sun phyung ba zhes bgyi / bka' stsal pa / nye ba 'khor @56a * //
translated: ‚ÄúHow many of those people are defeated?‚ÄùüîΩ‚ÄúLord, none of them.‚Äù

original: 'ga' yang ma yin no zhes bya ba gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'ga' yang ma yin no zhes bya ba gsungs pa yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúUpƒÅli, none of them.‚Äù

original: de ni reg pa dang lus bkan pa dag gis dge slong ma la pham par mi 'gyur ba zhes bya ba 'di ni sun phyung ba nyid du rnam par gzhag par mi snang ngo //
analyzed: de ni reg pa dang lus bkan pa dag gis dge slong ma la pham par mi 'gyur ba zhes bya ba 'di ni sun phyung ba nyid du rnam par gzhag par mi snang ngo //
translated: It does not appear that the Buddha established the defeat of a nun through contact and the bending of the body.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: de la yang skye ba don gzhan gyis reg pa dang / lus bkan pa la khas mi len pa dang / nom pa dang nyug pa la yang dag par zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: de la yang skye ba don gzhan gyis reg pa dang / lus bkan pa la khas mi len pa dang / nom pa dang nyug pa la yang dag par zhugs pa'o //
translated: In that case, it is when another man is born, she does not consent to contact and the bending of the body, and she engages in fondling and rubbing.

original: reg nas kyang khas ma blangs pa la des reg pa la'o //
analyzed: reg nas kyang khas ma blangs pa la des reg pa la'o //
translated: Even though she has contact, she does not consent to it.

original: skyes pa'i lus la rang gis reg cing skyes pa dang nye bar gyur pa la'o //
analyzed: skyes pa'i lus la rang gis reg cing skyes pa dang nye bar gyur pa la'o //
translated: She touches the body of a man, and she is close to a man.üîΩA woman who has relinquished her training and become a man is suitable to go forth and be fully ordained.

original: bud med bslab pa phul nas skyes pa nyid du gyur pa ni rab tu dbyung ba dang bsnyen par rdzogs par rung ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni bud med bslab pa phul nas nyams par gyur pa mtshan gyur nas skyes pa nyid du gyur pa ni rab
analyzed: bud med bslab pa phul nas skyes pa nyid du gyur pa ni rab tu dbyung ba dang bsnyen par rdzogs par rung ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni bud med bslab pa phul nas nyams par gyur pa mtshan gyur nas skyes pa nyid du gyur pa ni rab
translated: A woman who has relinquished her training and become degenerate, who has changed sex and become a man, is suitable to go forth and be fully ordained.

original: tu dbyung ba dang bsnyen par rdzogs par byar rung ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: tu dbyung ba dang bsnyen par rdzogs par byar rung ba nyid yin no //
translated: It is suitable to be fully ordained.

original: bud med ma yin pa nyid kyis gnas skabs dang 'dra bar mi rung ba nyid do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bud med ma yin pa nyid kyis gnas skabs dang 'dra bar mi rung ba nyid do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is not suitable to be fully ordained because of not being a woman.

original: pham par gyur pa thun mong ma yin pa lhag par spyad pa can yang ngo zhes bya ba ni skyes pa nyid du khas blangs pa la rab tu 'byung ba dang bsnyen par rdzogs par byar rung ba nyid yin te /
analyzed: pham par gyur pa thun mong ma yin pa lhag par spyad pa can yang ngo zhes bya ba ni skyes pa nyid du khas blangs pa la rab tu 'byung ba dang bsnyen par rdzogs par byar rung ba nyid yin te /
translated: One who has committed a defeating offense that is not common and has engaged in it is also suitable to go forth and be fully ordained after accepting being a man.

original: bud med bslab pa phul nas zhes bya ba dang rjes su 'brel to //üîΩbud med bsnyen par rdzogs par bya ba la gnyug mar gnas pa rnams yan lag yin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bud med bslab pa phul nas zhes bya ba dang rjes su 'brel to // bud med bsnyen par rdzogs par bya ba la gnyug mar gnas pa rnams yan lag yin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: This is connected with ‚Äúafter a woman has relinquished her training.‚ÄùüîΩThe natural state of women is suitable to be fully ordained.

original: 'dir gzhung ni gso sbyong gi gzhi las /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni gso sbyong gi gzhi las /
translated: Here is the text from the chapter on the purification of offenses:

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: It says:

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong ma rnams kyi dge slong rnams dang nye bar dge slong ma'i dngos po yongs su btsal bar bya'o zhes gang gsungs pa la dge slong de rnams gang dag lags /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong ma rnams kyi dge slong rnams dang nye bar dge slong ma'i dngos po yongs su btsal bar bya'o zhes gang gsungs pa la dge slong de rnams gang dag lags /
translated: In this case, who are the bhik·π£us?

original: nye ba 'khor gnyug mar gnas pa dang ring du gnas pa dag go zhes gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: nye ba 'khor gnyug mar gnas pa dang ring du gnas pa dag go zhes gsungs pa yin te /
translated: They are the resident and visiting monks.

original: de'i gnas la brten pa'i gnas la gnas pa'i dge slong gi dge 'dun la nye bar brten pas dge slong ma rnams kyi gnas so //
analyzed: de'i gnas la brten pa'i gnas la gnas pa'i dge slong gi dge 'dun la nye bar brten pas dge slong ma rnams kyi gnas so //
translated: The bhik·π£u·πáƒ´s‚Äô residence is a residence that is near the sa·πÉgha of bhik·π£us who are residents and visitors.

original: de nas dus dus su gdams ngag dang rjes su bstan pa slong ba ste /
analyzed: de nas dus dus su gdams ngag dang rjes su bstan pa slong ba ste /
translated: From time to time, they should request instruction and counsel.üîΩIt is not proper for them to transgress this rule.‚Äù

original: gnas pa las 'da' ba ni rigs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba 'dis shes pa'o //
analyzed: gnas pa las 'da' ba ni rigs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba 'dis shes pa'o //
translated: This is understood.

original: gnyug mar gnas pa nyid ni 'dir yun ring por gnas pa nyid kyis khyad par du gyur pa la ring du gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: gnyug mar gnas pa nyid ni 'dir yun ring por gnas pa nyid kyis khyad par du gyur pa la ring du gnas pa yin no //
translated: Here, the residents are distinguished by the fact that they have been living there for a long time.

original: skye ba'i tshe nyid @56b na phul lam nyams na mi skye'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: skye ba'i tshe nyid @56b na phul lam nyams na mi skye'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: When a bhik·π£u·πáƒ´ is born, if she is the best, or if she is weak, she is not born.

original: skye ba'i dngos po ni skye ba nyid de skye bzhin pa nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: skye ba'i dngos po ni skye ba nyid de skye bzhin pa nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The thing that is arising is just arising; the meaning is that it is in the process of arising.

original: sdom pa len pa'i tshe na sdom pa de skye ba'i tshe nyid gang yin pa'i skye bzhin pa nyid kyi de'i gnas skabs de la phul bas yongs su btang ba la sogs pas phul lam nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sdom pa len pa'i tshe na sdom pa de skye ba'i tshe nyid gang yin pa'i skye bzhin pa nyid kyi de'i gnas skabs de la phul bas yongs su btang ba la sogs pas phul lam nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: When one takes the vow, the vow arises. At the very moment of its arising, it is in the process of arising. By giving it up, by renouncing it, etc., at that time, it is lost.

original: gang zhig sdom pa skye bzhin pa de ni rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: gang zhig sdom pa skye bzhin pa de ni rtogs pa ste /
translated: That which is in the process of arising is the vow.

original: rtogs pa la ni slar log pa rgal ba la sogs pa la mthong ba ma yin no //
analyzed: rtogs pa la ni slar log pa rgal ba la sogs pa la mthong ba ma yin no //
translated: It is not the case that one who has crossed over, etc., turns back on the path that has been traversed.

original: de bas na sdom pa skye bzhin pa la slar log pas gnas pa ma yin no zhes bya ba gang zhig gis 'dod pa de bzlog pa'i don du mdo 'di'o //
analyzed: de bas na sdom pa skye bzhin pa la slar log pas gnas pa ma yin no zhes bya ba gang zhig gis 'dod pa de bzlog pa'i don du mdo 'di'o //
translated: Therefore, this sutra is for the purpose of countering the assertion that the vow is lost by turning back on the path of the vow that is in the process of arising.

original: 'dir gzhung ni sil bu rnams las /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni sil bu rnams las /
translated: Here, the treatise is as follows:

original: nye ba 'khor re zhig bsnyen par rdzogs nas khyim pa nyid yin no snyam du so sor shes na yang bsnyen par rdzogs pa ma yin zhes bya ba na bsnyen par rdzogs par byed ba'i tshe na lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes gsungs pa yin no //üîΩrab tu byung ba'i gzhi zhu ba phal che ba'i skabs so //
analyzed: nye ba 'khor re zhig bsnyen par rdzogs nas khyim pa nyid yin no snyam du so sor shes na yang bsnyen par rdzogs pa ma yin zhes bya ba na bsnyen par rdzogs par byed ba'i tshe na lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes gsungs pa yin no // rab tu byung ba'i gzhi zhu ba phal che ba'i skabs so //
translated: Upali, if one thinks I am a householder and understands that he is not fully ordained, then he is not fully ordained, let alone when he is being fully ordained.

original: 'dul ba'i 'grel pa rang gis rnam par bshad pa zhes bya ba las rab tu byung ba'i gzhi rdzogs so /
analyzed: 'dul ba'i 'grel pa rang gis rnam par bshad pa zhes bya ba las rab tu byung ba'i gzhi rdzogs so /
translated: This concludes the section on the basis of going forth in the Vinaya Commentary called My Own Explanation.üîΩThis concludes the basis of going forth.

original: // / rang bzhin nyams pas byas pa nyid ni phul ba nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: // / rang bzhin nyams pas byas pa nyid ni phul ba nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: As for that which is done by one whose nature is impaired is not actually given,

original: rang bzhin nyams pas byas pa ni rang bzhin nyams pas byas pa nyid do //
analyzed: rang bzhin nyams pas byas pa ni rang bzhin nyams pas byas pa nyid do //
translated: that which is done by one whose nature is impaired is the nature of being impaired.

original: phul ba las gang zhig rang bzhin nyams pas byas pa nyid de ni phul ba nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: phul ba las gang zhig rang bzhin nyams pas byas pa nyid de ni phul ba nyid ma yin no //
translated: That which is done by one whose nature is impaired is not actually given.

original: rang bzhin nyams pa ni tha snyad las nyams pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin nyams pa ni tha snyad las nyams pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Impaired nature is called degenerated from convention.

original: rang bzhin nyams pa nyid ni rnam pa gsum gyis skyes pa yin te /
analyzed: rang bzhin nyams pa nyid ni rnam pa gsum gyis skyes pa yin te /
translated: The degeneration of the nature is threefold:

original: smyos pa dang / sems rnam par g-yeng ba dang / sdug bsngal gyis mngon par gdungs pas so //
analyzed: smyos pa dang / sems rnam par g-yeng ba dang / sdug bsngal gyis mngon par gdungs pas so //
translated: by madness, by distraction, and by being overwhelmed by suffering.

original: de la ma yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin nyams pa'i gang zag la phul ba nyid gang zhig byed pa 'di nyid de ni phul ba nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: de la ma yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin nyams pa'i gang zag la phul ba nyid gang zhig byed pa 'di nyid de ni phul ba nyid ma yin no //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúit is not so‚Äù means that the gift is not a gift if it is given to a person whose nature is degenerate.

original: 'di ni tha snyad du rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni tha snyad du rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: This is not a proper convention.

original: gang zhig 'dir lkugs pa la ma yin no zhes bya bas ni de la yang gang zhig phul ba nyid de ni phul ba nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: gang zhig 'dir lkugs pa la ma yin no zhes bya bas ni de la yang gang zhig phul ba nyid de ni phul ba nyid ma yin no //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúit is not so in the case of a mute‚Äù means that the gift is not a gift if it is given to a mute.

original: rnam pa thams cad du smra bar mi nus pa de ni /üîΩ'dir lkugs par 'dod de /üîΩde la gang zhig rab tu rig pa de ni rab tu rig pas 'di zhugs pa ma yin no //üîΩmi ma yin pa'i 'gro ba la ma yin no zhes bya ba ni lha dang sprul pa la sogs pa la'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du smra bar mi nus pa de ni / 'dir lkugs par 'dod de / de la gang zhig rab tu rig pa de ni rab tu rig pas 'di zhugs pa ma yin no // mi ma yin pa'i 'gro ba la ma yin no zhes bya ba ni lha dang sprul pa la sogs pa la'o //
translated: A mute is one who is incapable of speech in any form.

original: ma go @57a * //
analyzed: ma go @57a * //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúit is not so in the case of one who is not human‚Äù means that the gift is not a gift if it is given to a god, a spirit, or the like.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúit is not so in the case of one who does not understand‚Äù means that the gift is not a gift if it is given to one who does not understand the nature of the gift, the giver, and the recipient.

original: ba nyid la ma yin no zhes bya ba ni glen pa dang 'on pa dang snyoms par zhugs pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa de rnams kyang bsdus te /
analyzed: ba nyid la ma yin no zhes bya ba ni glen pa dang 'on pa dang snyoms par zhugs pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa de rnams kyang bsdus te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúnot in the presence of a fool‚Äù includes the deaf, those in meditative absorption, and so on.

original: glen pa dang 'on pa dang bsdus pa nyid kyi phyir 'di rgyu gzhan mthong ba yin te /
analyzed: glen pa dang 'on pa dang bsdus pa nyid kyi phyir 'di rgyu gzhan mthong ba yin te /
translated: Because they are fools, deaf, or in meditative absorption, they do not see the other causes.

original: de bas rnam pa thams cad du go ba dang nyan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba grangs ji lta ba bzhin du 'dir mi nus pa ni glen pa dang 'on pa dag la 'dod pa rnam par gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: de bas rnam pa thams cad du go ba dang nyan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba grangs ji lta ba bzhin du 'dir mi nus pa ni glen pa dang 'on pa dag la 'dod pa rnam par gnas pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, the phrase ‚Äúin every way‚Äù means that the gift is not given to the deaf and the blind, because they cannot understand and hear the gift as it is being given.

original: gang dang nye bar phul ba de la go ba nyid la zhes bya ba 'di 'dir shugs kyis rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: gang dang nye bar phul ba de la go ba nyid la zhes bya ba 'di 'dir shugs kyis rtogs pa yin no //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúto whom it is offered‚Äù is understood here by implication.

original: dben par ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di dben pa'i 'du shes kyis sam dben pa ma yin pa'i 'du shes kyis dbul ba nyid byas na yang de phul ba nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: dben par ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di dben pa'i 'du shes kyis sam dben pa ma yin pa'i 'du shes kyis dbul ba nyid byas na yang de phul ba nyid ma yin no //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúnot in private‚Äù means that if the gift is given with the perception of privacy or the perception that it is not private, then it is not a true gift.

original: de bas na ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid la 'dir dben pa'i 'du shes kyis lkugs pa'i yul la zhugs pa bzhin du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bas na ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid la 'dir dben pa'i 'du shes kyis lkugs pa'i yul la zhugs pa bzhin du 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, in this case, the idea of solitude is like the domain of the mute, since it is associated with dependence.

original: thams cad du byed pa'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad du byed pa'i rim pa'o //
translated: The order of all the stages of activity is everywhere.

original: dben par 'du shes pas ma yin no zhes bya ba ni mi dben par dben pa'i 'du shes kyis phul ba nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: dben par 'du shes pas ma yin no zhes bya ba ni mi dben par dben pa'i 'du shes kyis phul ba nyid ma yin no //
translated: It is not by the idea of solitude, that is, it is not by the idea of solitude in the non-solitary.

original: 'dir phul ba nyid ni rgyu cis mi 'dod ce na /
analyzed: 'dir phul ba nyid ni rgyu cis mi 'dod ce na /
translated: Why is it not accepted that it is the gift?

original: gang gi phyir ma nyams pa'i 'du shes kyis tha snyad gyi yul thams cad du byed pa'i rim pa thams cad byed pa gang yin pa de ni phul ba nyid do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir ma nyams pa'i 'du shes kyis tha snyad gyi yul thams cad du byed pa'i rim pa thams cad byed pa gang yin pa de ni phul ba nyid do //
translated: Because it is the order of all the stages of activity in all the domains of conventional usage by the idea of non-deficiency.

original: gnyid log pa na bla bar 'gyur ba nyid kyis 'du shes ma nyams pa nyid la kun nas spyod pa nyid la gnas skabs de dang ldan pas phul ba nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: gnyid log pa na bla bar 'gyur ba nyid kyis 'du shes ma nyams pa nyid la kun nas spyod pa nyid la gnas skabs de dang ldan pas phul ba nyid ma yin te /
translated: It is not the gift, because it is not associated with that state, since the idea of non-deficiency is not completely engaged in sleep, because of the very fact of sleepiness.

original: rang bzhin nyams pa dang lkugs pa dang ma go ba nyid dang dben par thams cad du byed pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin nyams pa dang lkugs pa dang ma go ba nyid dang dben par thams cad du byed pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because of the absence of activity in all cases, due to the loss of the nature of a human being, due to muteness, due to non-understanding, and due to solitude.

original: gang gi phyir thams cad du byed pa ma yin pa la 'di ltar bdag ni tha snyad la gnas zhes bya ba'i bsam pa rdzogs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir thams cad du byed pa ma yin pa la 'di ltar bdag ni tha snyad la gnas zhes bya ba'i bsam pa rdzogs pa ma yin no //
translated: Since there is no activity in all cases, the thought ‚ÄúI abide in convention‚Äù is not fulfilled.

original: mi ma yin pa'i 'gro ba pa la tha snyad du bya ba med pa'i phyir dang dben pa'i 'du shes kyis thams cad du byed pa rtsom pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi ma yin pa'i 'gro ba pa la tha snyad du bya ba med pa'i phyir dang dben pa'i 'du shes kyis thams cad du byed pa rtsom pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no conventional activity in the case of non-human beings, and because there is no undertaking of activity in all cases due to the perception of solitude.

original: thams cad du byed pa rtsom pa nyid med pa bdag 'di ltar tha snyad la gnas zhes bya ba bsam pa rdzogs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: thams cad du byed pa rtsom pa nyid med pa bdag 'di ltar tha snyad la gnas zhes bya ba bsam pa rdzogs pa ma yin no //
translated: Since there is no undertaking of activity in all cases, the thought ‚ÄúI abide in convention‚Äù is not fulfilled.

original: de bas na ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid rang gi 'dod pas rab tu grol zhing sems rab tu bzung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas na ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid rang gi 'dod pas rab tu grol zhing sems rab tu bzung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, one who is dependent is liberated by one‚Äôs own desire and the mind is well-taken.

original: de bas na 'dir phul ba nyid 'dod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na 'dir phul ba nyid 'dod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, here there is no desire for perfection.

original: bslab pa'am / sangs rgyas sam chos sam dge 'dun nam mdo sde'am 'dul ba'am ma @57b mo'am /üîΩslob dpon nam mkhan po 'bul lo //
analyzed: bslab pa'am / sangs rgyas sam chos sam dge 'dun nam mdo sde'am 'dul ba'am ma @57b mo'am / slob dpon nam mkhan po 'bul lo //
translated: I offer the training, the Buddha, the Dharma, the Sa·πÖgha, the s≈´tra collection, the vinaya, the mƒÅt·πõkƒÅ,üîΩthe master, or the preceptor.

original: bdag khyim pa'am /üîΩdge tshul lam /üîΩza ma'am / ma ning ngam /üîΩdge slong ma sun phyung ba'am /
analyzed: bdag khyim pa'am / dge tshul lam / za ma'am / ma ning ngam / dge slong ma sun phyung ba'am /
translated: I offer myself as a layperson,üîΩa novice monk,üîΩa celibate, a neuter,

original: rku thabs su gnas pa'am /
analyzed: rku thabs su gnas pa'am /
translated: one who has caused a schism in the Sa·πÖgha of nuns,üîΩone who has stolen through robbery,

original: tha dad par gnas pa'am /
analyzed: tha dad par gnas pa'am /
translated: one who lives separately,

original: gnas par mi bya ba'am /
analyzed: gnas par mi bya ba'am /
translated: one who is not to be lived with,

original: mu stegs can nam /
analyzed: mu stegs can nam /
translated: a heretic,

original: mu stegs can zhugs pa'am /üîΩma bsad pa'am /üîΩpha bsad pa'am /
analyzed: mu stegs can zhugs pa'am / ma bsad pa'am / pha bsad pa'am /
translated: one who has entered the heretic path,üîΩone who has killed his mother,

original: dgra bcom pa bsad pa'am /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa bsad pa'am /
translated: one who has killed his father,üîΩone who has killed an arhat,

original: dge 'dun gyi dbyen byas pa'am /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi dbyen byas pa'am /
translated: one who has caused a schism in the Sa·πÖgha,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la ngan sems kyis khrag phyung bar gzung du gsol //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la ngan sems kyis khrag phyung bar gzung du gsol //
translated: one who has maliciously drawn blood from a TathƒÅgata.üîΩI am satisfied with living or enjoying together with you, my fellow celibates.

original: bdag tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa khyed cag dang lhan cig gnas pa'am longs spyod pas chog go zhes bya ba lta bu ni 'bul ba'i tshig dag yin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bdag tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa khyed cag dang lhan cig gnas pa'am longs spyod pas chog go zhes bya ba lta bu ni 'bul ba'i tshig dag yin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: These are the words of offering.

original: lta bu zhes bya ba'i sgra ni rnam pa gsum bstan pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: lta bu zhes bya ba'i sgra ni rnam pa gsum bstan pa'i phyir te /
translated: The word ‚Äúsuch‚Äù indicates three things:

original: rnam pa de lta bu dang cho ga de lta bu dang / rigs de lta bu rnams ni 'bul ba'i tshig rnams rtsom pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa de lta bu dang cho ga de lta bu dang / rigs de lta bu rnams ni 'bul ba'i tshig rnams rtsom pa'o //
translated: such a form, such a rite, and such a lineage.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúone who has relinquished the training‚Äù is explained in the sutra as follows:

original: slar mdo 'di la de ltar na bslab pa 'bul ba ni tshig tu smra ba de kho na las bslab pa 'bul bar ma zad kyi /
analyzed: slar mdo 'di la de ltar na bslab pa 'bul ba ni tshig tu smra ba de kho na las bslab pa 'bul bar ma zad kyi /
translated: ‚ÄúOne who has relinquished the training is not only one who has relinquished the training verbally.

original: tshig tu ma smras par rnam pa gang yang rung bas gtong ba'i mtshan ma las kyang phul bar 'gyur te /üîΩdes na lus kyi rnam par rig byed las kyang 'dir phul bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: tshig tu ma smras par rnam pa gang yang rung bas gtong ba'i mtshan ma las kyang phul bar 'gyur te / des na lus kyi rnam par rig byed las kyang 'dir phul bar 'gyur la /
translated: One who has relinquished the training is also one who has relinquished the training non-verbally, by any indication of relinquishment.üîΩTherefore, one who has relinquished the training is also one who has relinquished the training through physical and verbal indications.

original: ngag gi rnam par rig byed las kyang zhes bya ba rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: ngag gi rnam par rig byed las kyang zhes bya ba rtogs par bya'o //
translated: One who has relinquished the training is also one who has relinquished the training through mental indications.‚Äù

original: 'dir slar rigs pa ni 'pho ba bstan pas 'dir dgos pa yin gyi tshig gi khyad par gyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dir slar rigs pa ni 'pho ba bstan pas 'dir dgos pa yin gyi tshig gi khyad par gyis ni ma yin no //
translated: The point of this passage is to show that the training can be relinquished by means of a transition to a different class, not by means of a verbal act.

original: don gzhan ston pa'i sgra las don gzhan khong du chud pa zhes bya ba 'grub pa yin no //
analyzed: don gzhan ston pa'i sgra las don gzhan khong du chud pa zhes bya ba 'grub pa yin no //
translated: It is established that one can understand a meaning from a word that expresses a different meaning.

original: de bzhin du 'pho ba la dgos pas /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'pho ba la dgos pas /
translated: So too, it is necessary to transfer the training to others.

original: sbubs zhes bya ba ni gang la pho'i dbang po gzhug par bya ba'i skabs kyi tshad de lta bu sbubs kyi rgyun ma chad par bsten par 'gyur ba'i ma ning la bu ga lus las bcad pa la yang ngo zhes sbom po'i dbang du byas pa'o //

original: // / dge slong gi dngos por mi shes pa ni rang bzhin gyis nyams pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyis nyams pa zhes bya ba'i sgra de'i don rgyas par gyur pas tha snyad nyams pa zhes bya ba'i sgra rang bzhin nyams pa smyon pa la
analyzed: // / dge slong gi dngos por mi shes pa ni rang bzhin gyis nyams pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyis nyams pa zhes bya ba'i sgra de'i don rgyas par gyur pas tha snyad nyams pa zhes bya ba'i sgra rang bzhin nyams pa smyon pa la
translated: One who does not know the state of a fully ordained monk is naturally degenerate. The term naturally degenerate is an elaboration of the term degenerate. The term degenerate in conventional usage is expressed as the nature of a madman and so on.

original: sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis brjod pa la ltung ba ma blangs pas yongs sum bcad pa la ngo @63b po 'di yin no zhes bya ba rab tu bstan pa'i don du mdo 'di yin no //
analyzed: sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis brjod pa la ltung ba ma blangs pas yongs sum bcad pa la ngo @63b po 'di yin no zhes bya ba rab tu bstan pa'i don du mdo 'di yin no //
translated: This sutra is for the purpose of teaching that one who has not taken a downfall is completely cut off, saying this is the nature of one who has not taken a downfall.

original: 'dir gzhung ni /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni /
translated: Here is the text:

analyzed: gal te dge slong gi dngos por yang dag par shes na ni gzhi ji lta ba bzhin du ltung bar 'gyur ro //

original: gal te dge slong gi dngos por mi shes pa smyon pa la ni ltung bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te dge slong gi dngos por mi shes pa smyon pa la ni ltung bar mi 'gyur te /

analyzed: sems 'khrugs pa dang tshor bas nyen pa yang de bzhin no zhes gsungs pa yin no //

original: nyams pa nyid ni gnyis te /
analyzed: nyams pa nyid ni gnyis te /
translated: There are two kinds of degeneration:üîΩinternal and external.

original: nang dang phyi rol lo zhes bya ba ni 'dir nang gi rim pa rtogs pa nyams pa nyid la don dang ldan pa nyid de /
analyzed: nang dang phyi rol lo zhes bya ba ni 'dir nang gi rim pa rtogs pa nyams pa nyid la don dang ldan pa nyid de /

original: de bas na nang gi rim pa nas brtsams te /
analyzed: de bas na nang gi rim pa nas brtsams te /
translated: therefore, beginning from the internal stages,üîΩup to the external degeneration, that is the external degeneration here.

original: ji srid du phyi rol nyams pa'i bar de ni 'dir phyi rol nyams pa nyid yin gyi phyi rol nyams pa 'ba' zhig ni nyams pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: ji srid du phyi rol nyams pa'i bar de ni 'dir phyi rol nyams pa nyid yin gyi phyi rol nyams pa 'ba' zhig ni nyams pa nyid ma yin no //

analyzed: bstan pa'i phyir gzhan la khas blangs pa na bslab pa 'khrugs pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni dge slob ma gang gi ming de ni bslab par 'dod pa'o //

analyzed: de ltar na dge slob ma la gnas pa'i cho ga 'dir rtogs par bya'o //

original: dge slob ma gang zhig bsten pa'i phyir gzhan skyes pa 'dod pa bsten nus pa la 'di ltar zhes bya bar khas len par byed pa de la dge slob ma de'i bslab pa'i gzhi rnams 'khrugs pa nyid de med pa zhes bya ba'i don to //

translated: If a probationary nun, for the sake of training, consents to the statement, ‚ÄúI will rely on another man who is able to support me,‚Äù then the bases of her training are disturbed, which means that they are lost.

original: 'dir gzhung ni /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni /
translated: Here is the story.

original: dgon pa ba sdig can gyis dge slob ma la khyod bsnyen par ma rdzogs kyis mi tshangs par spyod kyang ltung bar mi 'gyur ro zhes co 'dri ste des de bsten pa dang bsten pa de la 'gyod pa skyes so //

translated: A sinful hermit said to a probationary nun, ‚ÄúYou are not fully ordained, so even if you have sexual intercourse, you will not commit a transgression.‚Äù He seduced her, and she had regrets about that reliance.

original: des de mi 'dod bzhin du brtsal ba dang / de bdag dge slob mar ma rung bar ma gyur tam snyam du 'gyod pa skyes so ;
analyzed: des de mi 'dod bzhin du brtsal ba dang / de bdag dge slob mar ma rung bar ma gyur tam snyam du 'gyod pa skyes so ;

original: / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: bslab pa 'khrugs pas yang dpog par bya ste /
analyzed: bslab pa 'khrugs pas yang dpog par bya ste /

analyzed: de la de yang sbyin par bya ba nyid do zhes bya ba la /

analyzed: 'dir nyams pa nyid slar sbyin pa zhes bya ba'i don to //

analyzed: de ni dge slong gi sbom po'o zhes bya ba la /

original: 'dir yang gzhung ni /

analyzed: des de bsten pa dang bsten pa de la 'gyod pa skyes so //

original: mi'i bdag po nyid med par pham par sbyor ba ma yin no //

translated: But it is not the case that the master himself is not defeated.

analyzed: bza' btung gi phyir byin pa la ni bsam pa dang 'brel pa med pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba la /

translated: In the wilderness, when one gives one‚Äôs share of water to animals, one does not do so with a conceptualized intention. This is the reason.

original: gang gi phyir bza' btung gi don du dud 'gro khyu la sogs pa de la ni chu la sogs pa gang zhig ster ba'i sbyin par byed pa 'di bdag gi'o snyam pa'i bsam pas 'brel pa gang yin pa dang ltos pa gang yin pa de med pa nyid
analyzed: gang gi phyir bza' btung gi don du dud 'gro khyu la sogs pa de la ni chu la sogs pa gang zhig ster ba'i sbyin par byed pa 'di bdag gi'o snyam pa'i bsam pas 'brel pa gang yin pa dang ltos pa gang yin pa de med pa nyid

original: /'dir gzhung ni /
analyzed: /'dir gzhung ni /

translated: At that time, the value of the water that is the share of the animals is considered by them.
