analyzed: nags mes btang ba la sogs dag gis gzung ba'i phyir ri dgas dang bya dang sdig sbrul lings btab pa rnams la ni lings pa ma yin pa bdag po nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba la / rngon pa la sogs pa rnams kyis ri dgas la sogs pa rnams la ngas mes btang ba la sogs pa'i thabs rnams kyis bzung ba'i phyir mngon par brtson pa rnams la gang zhig de rnams kyi nang mngon par mi brtson pa de la mngon par brtson pa nyid
translated: With respect to the deer, birds, and snakes that are caught by hunters, etc. with traps, etc., there is no stealing, because they are not the property of anyone.üîΩBecause the deer, etc. are caught by hunters, etc. with traps, etc., those who are diligent with respect to them are not the owners of them.

original: ni bdag po nyid du der gyur te mngon par mi brtson pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ni bdag po nyid du der gyur te mngon par mi brtson pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Those who are not diligent with respect to them are the owners of them, because they are not diligent with respect to them.

original: rku sems kyis 'dzin pa la rkun ma'i dngos po zhas bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rku sems kyis 'dzin pa la rkun ma'i dngos po zhas bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúthe state of a thief‚Äù is the seizing of the property of another with a thieving mind.

original: ri dgas la sogs pa smos pa ni 'dir dpe yin te /üîΩmi dang phyugs dag la @68a * //
analyzed: ri dgas la sogs pa smos pa ni 'dir dpe yin te / mi dang phyugs dag la @68a * //
translated: The mention of deer, etc. is an example here.

original: yang cho ga 'di sbyar ba'o //
analyzed: yang cho ga 'di sbyar ba'o //
translated: The same procedure applies to humans and cattle.

original: bdag dang bdag gi dag la yang yod pa nyid kyi phyir bdag po skyes pa la bdag po dang bcas par sbyar ba'o //
analyzed: bdag dang bdag gi dag la yang yod pa nyid kyi phyir bdag po skyes pa la bdag po dang bcas par sbyar ba'o //
translated: Since there is also a master and a self in relation to oneself, the term ‚Äúwith a master‚Äù is applied to a male.üîΩWhen there is no distinction, it is established on the basis of the object.

original: bye brag ma phyed pa la ni gzhi las rnam par gzhag go zhes bya ba ni bdag po dang bcas pa zhig gam 'on te ma yin zhes bye brag ma phyed pa gang zhig de yod mod ces bya ba gang du gter ram /
analyzed: bye brag ma phyed pa la ni gzhi las rnam par gzhag go zhes bya ba ni bdag po dang bcas pa zhig gam 'on te ma yin zhes bye brag ma phyed pa gang zhig de yod mod ces bya ba gang du gter ram /
translated: When there is no distinction as to whether or not there is a master, if someone says, ‚ÄúThere is an object there,‚Äù

original: rdzas gzhan 'dzin pa dngos po de la ni 'du shes las rnam par gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: rdzas gzhan 'dzin pa dngos po de la ni 'du shes las rnam par gzhag pa'o //
translated: it is established on the basis of the perception of that object, whether it is a treasure or another substance.

original: gal te rdzas de bdag po dang bcas pa yin na bdag po dang bcas pa'i skyon no //
analyzed: gal te rdzas de bdag po dang bcas pa yin na bdag po dang bcas pa'i skyon no //
translated: If that object has a master, there is the fault of having a master.

original: gal te min na bdag po ma yin pa la sogs pa ldang ba'i skyon no //
analyzed: gal te min na bdag po ma yin pa la sogs pa ldang ba'i skyon no //
translated: If it does not, there is the fault of rising up against one who is not a master, and so on.

original: rin thang ni brkus pa'i gnas dang dus kyis so zhes bya ba ni rin thang gi rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya ba 'jug go //
analyzed: rin thang ni brkus pa'i gnas dang dus kyis so zhes bya ba ni rin thang gi rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya ba 'jug go //
translated: The value is determined by the place and time of the theft.

original: brkus pa'i gnas dang dus gang yin pa des rin thang gi rnam par gzhag pa gang du byed pa dang / gang gi tshe na der de'i tshe rin thang des ber ltung byed ces bya ba'i don de rnam par gzhag go zhes bya ba 'jug go //
analyzed: brkus pa'i gnas dang dus gang yin pa des rin thang gi rnam par gzhag pa gang du byed pa dang / gang gi tshe na der de'i tshe rin thang des ber ltung byed ces bya ba'i don de rnam par gzhag go zhes bya ba 'jug go //
translated: The meaning of this is that the value is determined by the place and time of the theft, and when that is determined, the offense is determined by that value.

original: ma bsams pa la ltung ba med do zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ma bsams pa la ltung ba med do zhes bya ba la /
translated: There is no offense if one does not intend to steal.

original: rdzas gang zhig rku ba nyid kyis mngon par mi 'dod pa de lta bu 'am 'on te che ge mo'i yin na yang bdag gis rku'o snyam ste /
analyzed: rdzas gang zhig rku ba nyid kyis mngon par mi 'dod pa de lta bu 'am 'on te che ge mo'i yin na yang bdag gis rku'o snyam ste /
translated: If one does not intend to steal a substance that is not one‚Äôs own, or if one thinks, ‚ÄúI will steal this belonging to such and such a person,‚Äù

original: 'khrul pas brkus par gyur pa de las ltung bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'khrul pas brkus par gyur pa de las ltung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: and one steals through error, there is no offense.

original: de ltar na yang nye ba 'khor gyis zhus pa las /
analyzed: de ltar na yang nye ba 'khor gyis zhus pa las /
translated: However, the Catuhpratisara·πáas≈´tra declares:

original: btsun pa re zhig dge slong gis rku sems kyis chos gos kyi gdang bu ba rkus pa la gal te der chos gos dag kyang zhar la mchis na ltung ba cir 'gyur chos gos kyi gdang bu'i rin thang brtsi bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin te ;
analyzed: btsun pa re zhig dge slong gis rku sems kyis chos gos kyi gdang bu ba rkus pa la gal te der chos gos dag kyang zhar la mchis na ltung ba cir 'gyur chos gos kyi gdang bu'i rin thang brtsi bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin te ;
translated: ‚ÄúVenerable, if a monk with a mind to steal steals a robe rack, if robes are also attached to it, what is the offense?‚Äù ‚ÄúThe value of the robe rack should be assessed.‚Äù

original: de la chos gos rnams ni mngon par 'dod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de la chos gos rnams ni mngon par 'dod pa ma yin te /
translated: In that case, the robes are not the intended object.

original: de bas na de la brten pa'i grangs gsungs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na de la brten pa'i grangs gsungs pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the number of robes based on that is not stated.

original: rang dang brnya ba dang yid gcugs pa'i sems dag gis gzhan la go bar bya ste /
analyzed: rang dang brnya ba dang yid gcugs pa'i sems dag gis gzhan la go bar bya ste /
translated: One should understand that from one‚Äôs own mind, the mind of another, or the mind of a friend.

original: blangs na ltung ba med do zhes bya ba ni rku sems med na ltung ba med do zhes bya ba dang 'brel lo //
analyzed: blangs na ltung ba med do zhes bya ba ni rku sems med na ltung ba med do zhes bya ba dang 'brel lo //
translated: ‚ÄúIf one takes it, there is no offense‚Äù is connected to ‚Äúif there is no mind to steal, there is no offense.‚Äù

original: rang gi sems dang brnya ba'i sems dang yid gcugs pa'i sems ni rang dang brnya ba dang yid gcug pa'i sems so //
analyzed: rang gi sems dang brnya ba'i sems dang yid gcugs pa'i sems ni rang dang brnya ba dang yid gcug pa'i sems so //
translated: One‚Äôs own mind, the mind of another, and the mind of a friend is one‚Äôs own mind, the mind of another, and the mind of a friend.

analyzed: de rnams kyis bzung ba la rku sems med pas ltung ba med do //
translated: Since there is no mind to steal in those who take it, there is no offense.

original: de ltar yang dge slong gis rang gi ltung bzed dang chos gos kyang @68b rku sems kyis len na nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar yang dge slong gis rang gi ltung bzed dang chos gos kyang @68b rku sems kyis len na nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro //

analyzed: de ltar na yang gzhan la go bar bya'o zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //

translated: From here on, the following is stated: ‚ÄúWith a compassionate mind, one should confess the offense.‚Äù Up to ‚ÄúIf one steals less than five mƒÅ·π£as of silver, whatever is not completed is all part of the main rite.‚Äù

original: de bas na 'dir ji tsam du dngos gzhi'i cho ga la brten pa'i rnam 'gyur du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na 'dir ji tsam du dngos gzhi'i cho ga la brten pa'i rnam 'gyur du gyur pa'o //
translated: Therefore, here it is a transformation based on the main rite to whatever extent.

original: de las gzhan pa'i dngos gzhi'i cho ga brten pa de la rjes su sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i dngos gzhi'i cho ga brten pa de la rjes su sbyor ba'o //
translated: That which is based on the main rite other than that is subsequent application.

original: dper na rku ba dang rkur bcug pa dang mngags pa dang ma byin pa dang / rku sems kyi mi'i rgyud kyis yongs su bzung bar 'du shes pa dang zhes bya ba 'di rnams dngos gzhi'i cho ga la gtogs pa'i yan lag rnams mdo 'di bla rjes su sbyar ba'o //
analyzed: dper na rku ba dang rkur bcug pa dang mngags pa dang ma byin pa dang / rku sems kyi mi'i rgyud kyis yongs su bzung bar 'du shes pa dang zhes bya ba 'di rnams dngos gzhi'i cho ga la gtogs pa'i yan lag rnams mdo 'di bla rjes su sbyar ba'o //
translated: For example, stealing, causing stealing, sending, not giving, and the perception of being possessed by the continuum of a person with a mind to steal‚Äîthese are subsequent application to the branches belonging to the main rite in this s≈´tra.

original: de bas na khyad par 'di dang ldan pa'i cho ga 'di la sbom po 'di rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na khyad par 'di dang ldan pa'i cho ga 'di la sbom po 'di rig par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, this should be known as the gross violation with this distinction in this rite.

original: gzhan du yang de dang rjes su 'brang bas rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan du yang de dang rjes su 'brang bas rtogs par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that the same is true of other forms of stealing.üîΩIf one steals from a nonhuman being, but has the perception of a human being, or if one steals from a human being, but has the perception of a nonhuman being, then one commits an offense of wrong conduct, because of the inferiority of the object.

original: mi ma yin pa'i 'gro ba dang 'brel pa la de'i 'du shes dang mi'i 'gro ba la brten pa'i 'du shes kyis ma chog pa brkus pa la sgom po'i ltung ba byung la dman pa nyid kyi phyir nyes byas so //
analyzed: mi ma yin pa'i 'gro ba dang 'brel pa la de'i 'du shes dang mi'i 'gro ba la brten pa'i 'du shes kyis ma chog pa brkus pa la sgom po'i ltung ba byung la dman pa nyid kyi phyir nyes byas so //
translated: If one steals from a human being, but has the perception of a nonhuman being, or if one steals from a nonhuman being, but has the perception of a human being, then one commits an offense of wrong conduct, because of the inferiority of the perception.

original: gang de'i bdag po nyid yongs su bzung ba dang ma chog pa dang mi'i 'gro ba pa yongs su 'dzin pa nyid kyi phyir 'du shes la nyes byas nyid do //üîΩrku ba'i sems med na thams cad du ltung ba med do //
analyzed: gang de'i bdag po nyid yongs su bzung ba dang ma chog pa dang mi'i 'gro ba pa yongs su 'dzin pa nyid kyi phyir 'du shes la nyes byas nyid do // rku ba'i sems med na thams cad du ltung ba med do //
translated: If one steals from a human being, but has the perception of a human being, or if one steals from a nonhuman being, but has the perception of a nonhuman being, then one commits an offense of wrong conduct, because of the inferiority of the object and the inferiority of the perception.

original: gang gi phyir 'dir rku ba'i sems ni ltung ba byas pa ste /üîΩyan lag gzhan rnams la ni de'i khyad par du byas pa nyid do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'dir rku ba'i sems ni ltung ba byas pa ste / yan lag gzhan rnams la ni de'i khyad par du byas pa nyid do //
translated: If one steals from a human being, but has the perception of a human being, or if one steals from a nonhuman being, but has the perception of a nonhuman being, then one commits an offense of wrong conduct, because of the inferiority of the object and the inferiority of the perception.üîΩIf one steals from a human being, but has the perception of a human being, or if one steals from a nonhuman being, but has the perception of a nonhuman being, then one commits an offense of wrong conduct, because of the inferiority of the object and the inferiority of the perception.

analyzed: bdag po med pa'i gter ro zhes bya ba ni @69b ma byas pa la 'dir bdag po nyid ci 'dra ba ste /
translated: If one steals from a human being, but has the perception of a human being, or if one steals from a nonhuman being, but has the perception of a nonhuman being, then one commits an offense of wrong conduct, because of the inferiority of the object and the inferiority of the perception.üîΩIf one steals from a human being, but has the perception of a human being, or if one steals from a nonhuman being, but has the perception of a nonhuman being, then one commits an offense of wrong conduct, because of the inferiority of the object and the inferiority of the perception.üîΩIf one steals from a human being, but has the perception of a human being, or if one steals from a nonhuman being, but has the perception of a nonhuman being, then one commits an offense of wrong conduct, because of the inferiority of the object and the inferiority of the perception.üîΩIf one steals from a human being, but has the perception of a human being, or if one

original: gang zhig don rtogs pa'i bdag pos yin gyi don ma rtogs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang zhig don rtogs pa'i bdag pos yin gyi don ma rtogs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The master who understands the meaning, not one who does not understand the meaning.

original: yul gyi bdag po 'am de'i rigs dang ldan pas ma rtogs par gyur pa la gang dang bcas pas de'i rig chad pa de rgyal pos ma shes pa dang ma byas pa la sbom po'i ltung ba'o //
analyzed: yul gyi bdag po 'am de'i rigs dang ldan pas ma rtogs par gyur pa la gang dang bcas pas de'i rig chad pa de rgyal pos ma shes pa dang ma byas pa la sbom po'i ltung ba'o //
translated: The master of the object, or one who is of his class, is not understood by one who has not understood. The one who is together with that, whose knowledge is cut off, is the king who does not know and does not do the heavy downfall.

original: 'dir don ma rtogs pa'i bdag po rgyal po yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dir don ma rtogs pa'i bdag po rgyal po yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Here, the master who does not understand the meaning is not the king.

original: de bas na ci'i phyir pham pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de bas na ci'i phyir pham pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, why is it not a defeat?

original: bdag tu byas pa nyid kyi chang pas yongs su ma rdzogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag tu byas pa nyid kyi chang pas yongs su ma rdzogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the incompleteness of the master who is made into the self.

original: de ltar na gzhung ni /üîΩdes nad g-yog la smras pa /
analyzed: de ltar na gzhung ni / des nad g-yog la smras pa /
translated: Thus, the text says:

original: khur ba sna gsum dang thug pa sta gon gyis shig dang dge 'dun la yang dbul rang yang bza' btung bya'o zhes zer nas des de dag la zong phog go //
analyzed: khur ba sna gsum dang thug pa sta gon gyis shig dang dge 'dun la yang dbul rang yang bza' btung bya'o zhes zer nas des de dag la zong phog go //
translated: He said to the nurse, Prepare three kinds of pastries and soup. I will offer them to the Sa·πÖgha and also eat and drink myself. He gave them the goods.

original: de dag 'di snyam du bdag cag la khur ba sna gsum pa dang thug pas ci bya /
analyzed: de dag 'di snyam du bdag cag la khur ba sna gsum pa dang thug pas ci bya /
translated: They thought, What will we do with three kinds of pastries and soup?

original: 'di la khur ba sna gsum dang thug pa zhes byin la zong bdag cag gis bgo bar bya'o snyam nas de dag gis de la khur ba sna gsum pa dang thug pa zhig byin te zong bgos so //
analyzed: 'di la khur ba sna gsum dang thug pa zhes byin la zong bdag cag gis bgo bar bya'o snyam nas de dag gis de la khur ba sna gsum pa dang thug pa zhig byin te zong bgos so //
translated: Thinking, We will give him three loads and a meal and we will divide the goods, they gave him three loads and a meal and divided the goods.

original: de la 'gyod pa skyes nas bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de la 'gyod pa skyes nas bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: When he felt regret, the Bhagavan said,

original: pham par 'gyur ba'i ltung ba ni med de /
analyzed: pham par 'gyur ba'i ltung ba ni med de /
translated: There is no defeat,

original: nyes pa sbom po'i ltung bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: nyes pa sbom po'i ltung bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin te /
translated: but there is a grave offense.

original: gang dag la phul ba de dag la der bdag gir bya ba skyes par ma gyur pas de'i phyir pham par 'gyur ba'i rgyu med pas snang ngo //
analyzed: gang dag la phul ba de dag la der bdag gir bya ba skyes par ma gyur pas de'i phyir pham par 'gyur ba'i rgyu med pas snang ngo //
translated: Since the goods were not given to those to whom they were offered, ownership did not arise in them. Therefore, it appears that there is no cause for defeat.

original: 'o na ma chad pa la bdag tu bya ba med pa la ji ltar skyed pa ste /
analyzed: 'o na ma chad pa la bdag tu bya ba med pa la ji ltar skyed pa ste /
translated: But if ownership does not arise in the owner, how can it arise in that?

original: der gtogs pa nyid kyis rdzas de la gnas pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: der gtogs pa nyid kyis rdzas de la gnas pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because it is included there, it arises in that substance.

original: ji ste don ma rtogs pa'i bdag pos kyang gang zhig bdag po med pa nyid ni dper na sus kyang bdag tu ma byas pa'i dgon pa la gnas pa'i gter la ji ltar sgrub ce na /üîΩbyang gi sgra mi snyan pa rnams kyi rdzas rkus pa bzhin du de la ma byin par len pa med de /
analyzed: ji ste don ma rtogs pa'i bdag pos kyang gang zhig bdag po med pa nyid ni dper na sus kyang bdag tu ma byas pa'i dgon pa la gnas pa'i gter la ji ltar sgrub ce na / byang gi sgra mi snyan pa rnams kyi rdzas rkus pa bzhin du de la ma byin par len pa med de /
translated: But if the owner does not understand the meaning, how can one who has no owner, like a treasure in an uninhabited place, which no one has taken possession of, be established as the object of the action?

original: bdag tu ma byas pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag tu ma byas pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: There is no taking what is not given to him, as in the case of the property of the Uttarakurus, because he has no owner.

original: ji ste rku sems skyed par byed na nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ste rku sems skyed par byed na nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro //
translated: But if he generates the thought of stealing, he incurs a serious offense.

original: 'dir dngos gzhi'i cho ga la gtogs pa'i yan lag rnams la mi'i 'gro ba pa yongs su gzung bar bya ba 'dis spang ba'i don du sbyar ba'o //üîΩde'i 'du shes kyis zhes bya ba la de la bdag po med pa'i gter gyi 'du shes kyis zhes bya @70a * //
analyzed: 'dir dngos gzhi'i cho ga la gtogs pa'i yan lag rnams la mi'i 'gro ba pa yongs su gzung bar bya ba 'dis spang ba'i don du sbyar ba'o // de'i 'du shes kyis zhes bya ba la de la bdag po med pa'i gter gyi 'du shes kyis zhes bya @70a * //
translated: Here, the human realm is to be understood as the basis for the application of the rules of training that are included in the basic portion of the scriptures.

original: ba'i don to //
analyzed: ba'i don to //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúby the perception of that‚Äù means by the perception of a treasure that has no owner.

original: bye brag 'di dang ldan pa rnams la 'di ni sbom po ste /
analyzed: bye brag 'di dang ldan pa rnams la 'di ni sbom po ste /
translated: This is a serious offense for those who possess this distinction.

original: bdag po med pa'i gter la bdag po dang bcas pa'i 'du shes kyis mir gyur ba'i bdag pos sam gzhan gyis kyang sbom po nyid do //
analyzed: bdag po med pa'i gter la bdag po dang bcas pa'i 'du shes kyis mir gyur ba'i bdag pos sam gzhan gyis kyang sbom po nyid do //
translated: If one has the perception that a treasure belongs to someone, and a human owner or another person takes it, it is a serious offense.

original: 'dir las 'di la shin tu mchog nyid kyi phyir ma sha ka lnga la sogs pa ma tshang ba nyid kyi phyir gter la bdag po nyid med pa'i 'du shes kyi dang / bdag po dang bcas pa nyid kyi 'du shes la yang bdag po mi ma yin pa'am /
analyzed: 'dir las 'di la shin tu mchog nyid kyi phyir ma sha ka lnga la sogs pa ma tshang ba nyid kyi phyir gter la bdag po nyid med pa'i 'du shes kyi dang / bdag po dang bcas pa nyid kyi 'du shes la yang bdag po mi ma yin pa'am /
translated: Here, because this action is extremely grave, and because five mƒÅ·π£as and so on are not complete, if one has the perception that the treasure has no owner, and the perception that it belongs to someone, then even if the owner is a non-human or a human owner, it is a serious offense.

original: mi'i bdag pos kyang sbom po byas pa las dman pa'i phyir nyes byas so //
analyzed: mi'i bdag pos kyang sbom po byas pa las dman pa'i phyir nyes byas so //
translated: Because it is inferior to the serious offense, it is a minor offense.

original: rang gi'o zhes bya ba ni rang gi rdzas ma sha ka lnga la sogs pa rku sems kyis der 'du shes pas rku'am rkur bcug pa dang / mngags pas dang ltung ba sbom por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rang gi'o zhes bya ba ni rang gi rdzas ma sha ka lnga la sogs pa rku sems kyis der 'du shes pas rku'am rkur bcug pa dang / mngags pas dang ltung ba sbom por 'gyur ro //
translated: One's own means that if one steals one's own property, such as five mƒÅ·π£as and so on, with the intention to steal, perceiving it as belonging to oneself, or if one causes another to steal it, or if one is ordered to steal it, it is a serious offense.

original: der 'du shes pa zhes bya ba'i tshig de skabs 'dir ni rang gi 'du shes pa zhes bya bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: der 'du shes pa zhes bya ba'i tshig de skabs 'dir ni rang gi 'du shes pa zhes bya bar rig par bya'o //
translated: The term perceiving it as that in this context should be understood as perceiving it as one's own.

original: de ltar yang gzhung ni /
analyzed: de ltar yang gzhung ni /
translated: Thus, the treatise Attainment of Knowledge declares:

original: de'i phyir dge slong gis rang gi lhung bzed dang chos gos kyang rku sems kyis blang bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir dge slong gis rang gi lhung bzed dang chos gos kyang rku sems kyis blang bar mi bya'o //
translated: Therefore, a monk should not take his own begging bowl and robes with a thieving mind.

original: gal te dge slong gis rang gi lhung bzed dang chos gos kyang rku sems kyis len na nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te dge slong gis rang gi lhung bzed dang chos gos kyang rku sems kyis len na nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: If a monk takes his own begging bowl and robes with a thieving mind, he commits a serious offense.

original: rang gi la gzhan gyis yongs su bzung bar 'du shes pa yang sbom po kho na ste /
analyzed: rang gi la gzhan gyis yongs su bzung bar 'du shes pa yang sbom po kho na ste /
translated: If he perceives what is his own as belonging to another, he commits only a serious offense.

original: 'di las 'di la rku sems shin tu lci ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di las 'di la rku sems shin tu lci ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the thought of theft is very heavy in this case.

original: de ltar yang gzhung ni /
analyzed: de ltar yang gzhung ni /
translated: Thus, the treatise Attainment of Knowledge declares:

original: dge slong dag ma pham pa mi gti mug can 'di ni rang gi chos gos rnyang rnying dag gis nyes pa sbom po'i ltung ba 'byung ngo zhes gsungs pa yin no /
analyzed: dge slong dag ma pham pa mi gti mug can 'di ni rang gi chos gos rnyang rnying dag gis nyes pa sbom po'i ltung ba 'byung ngo zhes gsungs pa yin no /
translated: Monks, this deluded Ajnatakaundinya commits a serious offense with his own old worn out robes.

original: rang gi la gzhan gyis yongs su bzung bar 'du shes pa la sbom po kho na ste /
analyzed: rang gi la gzhan gyis yongs su bzung bar 'du shes pa la sbom po kho na ste /
translated: If he perceives what is his own as belonging to another, he commits only a serious offense.

original: rang gi la gzhan gyir 'du shes pa dang yongs su ma bzung ba la ma bzung bar 'du shes par ces pa ni ltung ba la 'dra ba'i phyir ro //üîΩde bzhin du yongs su ma bzung ba la yongs su ma bzung bar 'du shes pa'am /
analyzed: rang gi la gzhan gyir 'du shes pa dang yongs su ma bzung ba la ma bzung bar 'du shes par ces pa ni ltung ba la 'dra ba'i phyir ro // de bzhin du yongs su ma bzung ba la yongs su ma bzung bar 'du shes pa'am /
translated: The thought that what is not one‚Äôs own is one‚Äôs own, and the thought that what is not appropriated is appropriated, are similar to downfalls.

original: yongs su bzung ba dang bcas par 'du shes pa la yang sbom po kho na'o //
analyzed: yongs su bzung ba dang bcas par 'du shes pa la yang sbom po kho na'o //
translated: Similarly, the thought that what is not appropriated is not appropriated, or the thought that what is appropriated is appropriated, is also a grave offense.

original: 'gro ba gzhan gyir ro zhes bya ba ni mi'i 'gro ba las gzhan pa'i 'gro ba gang la yod pa gang yin pa de ni 'gro ba gzhan te rang gi zhes bya ba 'jug go //
analyzed: 'gro ba gzhan gyir ro zhes bya ba ni mi'i 'gro ba las gzhan pa'i 'gro ba gang la yod pa gang yin pa de ni 'gro ba gzhan te rang gi zhes bya ba 'jug go //
translated: ‚ÄúIn another realm‚Äù means that which exists in a realm other than the human realm. ‚ÄúAnother realm‚Äù means one‚Äôs own.

original: 'gro ba gzhan la gnas pa mi'i 'gro ba bar @70b yongs su 'dzin pa la 'di dang bral ba'i dngos gzhi'i yan lag yod du zin kyang sbom po ste /
analyzed: 'gro ba gzhan la gnas pa mi'i 'gro ba bar @70b yongs su 'dzin pa la 'di dang bral ba'i dngos gzhi'i yan lag yod du zin kyang sbom po ste /
translated: In the case of one who is in another realm, even if there is the actual basis of taking the human realm as one‚Äôs own, it is a grave offense.üîΩBecause it is included there.

original: der 'du zhes pas so zhes bya ba 'di la 'dir 'gro ba gzhan du shes pas so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: der 'du zhes pas so zhes bya ba 'di la 'dir 'gro ba gzhan du shes pas so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Here, the meaning is that it is known in another realm.

original: 'dir gzhung ni /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni /
translated: Here is the text:

original: de 'di snyam du gal te bya'i rku'i mi'i ni ma yin no snyam na zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de 'di snyam du gal te bya'i rku'i mi'i ni ma yin no snyam na zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
translated: If he thinks, ‚ÄúIt is not a human male,‚Äù and so on,

original: mi ma yin pa'i 'gro ba pa dang 'brel pa'i 'du shes kyis ni 'gro ba gzhan dang 'brel pa la sbom po kho na ste /
analyzed: mi ma yin pa'i 'gro ba pa dang 'brel pa'i 'du shes kyis ni 'gro ba gzhan dang 'brel pa la sbom po kho na ste /
translated: If he has the perception that the being is not human, then it is only a serious offense if the being is connected with another realm of rebirth.

original: shin tu mchog nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: shin tu mchog nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because it is extremely grave.üîΩIf he causes separation from what is not appropriated as his own, such as a treasure, a lost article, or what has been abandoned, it is also a serious offense.

original: bdag gir ma byas par sba ba dang chud gzan pa dang zin pa btang ba la sogs pas bral bar byed na yang ngo zhes bya ba ni bdag gir ma byas par sba ba la sogs pa gang zhig bral bar byed na yang der sbom po'o //
analyzed: bdag gir ma byas par sba ba dang chud gzan pa dang zin pa btang ba la sogs pas bral bar byed na yang ngo zhes bya ba ni bdag gir ma byas par sba ba la sogs pa gang zhig bral bar byed na yang der sbom po'o //
translated: What is not appropriated as his own is a treasure and so on. If he causes separation from that, it is a serious offense.

original: sba ba zhes bya ba ni 'dir 'dam rdzab tu gzhug pa la sogs par bstan to //
analyzed: sba ba zhes bya ba ni 'dir 'dam rdzab tu gzhug pa la sogs par bstan to //
translated: Here, ‚Äúa treasure‚Äù is taught as being buried in a pit and so on.

original: chud gzan pa zhes bya ba ni bsreg pa dang gcad pa dang bral ba'i bdag nyid kyis chud zos pa'o //
analyzed: chud gzan pa zhes bya ba ni bsreg pa dang gcad pa dang bral ba'i bdag nyid kyis chud zos pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúA lost article‚Äù is what has been lost. ‚ÄúWhat has been abandoned‚Äù is what has been given up by the owner.

original: zin pa btang ba zhes bya ba ni ri dgas dang nya dag la sogs pa rlubs dang rdos la sogs pas zin pa dag de'i yang 'dra ba nyid kyi phyir 'di lta bu'i rigs can gzhan la dpe nyid rnam par gnas zhes bya ba bye brag med par
analyzed: zin pa btang ba zhes bya ba ni ri dgas dang nya dag la sogs pa rlubs dang rdos la sogs pas zin pa dag de'i yang 'dra ba nyid kyi phyir 'di lta bu'i rigs can gzhan la dpe nyid rnam par gnas zhes bya ba bye brag med par
translated: The term seized refers to deer, fish, etc. that are seized by traps, snares, etc. because they are similar to those, this type of example is established without distinction, as it were, for other cases.

original: nye bar 'brel pa'o //
analyzed: nye bar 'brel pa'o //
translated: It is connected to the term etc.

original: 'dir rnam pa gzhan yang bcing ba dang bral pa dang skrod pa dang gsod pa la sogs pa yod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dir rnam pa gzhan yang bcing ba dang bral pa dang skrod pa dang gsod pa la sogs pa yod pa yin te /
translated: Here, there are also other cases of bondage, liberation, expulsion, killing, etc.

original: de rnams la khongs su bsdu ba'i phyir sogs pa'i sgra'o //
analyzed: de rnams la khongs su bsdu ba'i phyir sogs pa'i sgra'o //
translated: The term etc. includes those.

original: rku'am rkur bcug pa dag la rku sems kyis zhes bya ba 'dir dngos gzhi'i cho ga la gtogs pa 'ba' zhig gi yan lag 'di med pa'o //
analyzed: rku'am rkur bcug pa dag la rku sems kyis zhes bya ba 'dir dngos gzhi'i cho ga la gtogs pa 'ba' zhig gi yan lag 'di med pa'o //
translated: In the phrase with a mind to steal, having stolen or having caused to steal, this branch is not included in the rite of the actual basis alone.

original: de bas na mngags pas kyang ma byin pa'o ;
analyzed: de bas na mngags pas kyang ma byin pa'o ;
translated: Therefore, not given also includes what is sent by a messenger.

original: / ma sha ka lnga la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: / ma sha ka lnga la sogs pa'o //

original: nyug par mi byed pa de srid du nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyug par mi byed pa de srid du nyes byas su 'gyur ro //

original: nom par byed /üîΩnyug par byed /
analyzed: nom par byed / nyug par byed /

original: me tog rnams 'thog par byed /
analyzed: me tog rnams 'thog par byed /

original: gang gi phyir gal te rku ba'i sems yang dag par ma skyes pa 'dir 'jug pa yin na bying ba nyid 'pho ba ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir gal te rku ba'i sems yang dag par ma skyes pa 'dir 'jug pa yin na bying ba nyid 'pho ba ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because if the thought of stealing does not arise, then it is not a case of moving it.

original: rku sems yang dag par skyes pa nyid kyis rnam pa 'di lta bu rnams la 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: rku sems yang dag par skyes pa nyid kyis rnam pa 'di lta bu rnams la 'jug pa'o //
translated: But if the thought of stealing does arise, then it is a case of moving it.

original: de bas na 'dir rku ba ni bskur ba'i don yin gyi /
analyzed: de bas na 'dir rku ba ni bskur ba'i don yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, here stealing means moving it.

original: kun nas chad pa'i don du ni ma yin zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: kun nas chad pa'i don du ni ma yin zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It does not mean cutting it off.

original: 'dir gzhung ni /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni /
translated: Here is the text:

original: dge slong gis zong spying ba'i phyir khri las ldang bar byed ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dge slong gis zong spying ba'i phyir khri las ldang bar byed ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: A monk should rise from his seat in order to move the goods.

original: bshal ba la ni nges kyi gzhi'i mtshams las ngos cig shos 'das na'o zhes bya ba ni brku bar bya ba'i rdzas la phyogs kyi cha gang zhig gis bshal ba'i phyogs kyi cha de la ngos gang zhig tha ma'i ngos tsam du gyur pa cha med pa'i cha
analyzed: bshal ba la ni nges kyi gzhi'i mtshams las ngos cig shos 'das na'o zhes bya ba ni brku bar bya ba'i rdzas la phyogs kyi cha gang zhig gis bshal ba'i phyogs kyi cha de la ngos gang zhig tha ma'i ngos tsam du gyur pa cha med pa'i cha
translated: As for the washing, it is definite that if one side of the boundary of the basis is crossed, then one side of the part of the substance to be stolen becomes the mere last side of the part, which is a partless part.

original: de'i rten gang yin pa la sogs pa de'i gnas kyi bdag nyid can gyi cha de'i mtshams gang zhig cha de las rdzas bskur bar bya ba de 'das pa gang zhig cha gang yang rung bas ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i rten gang yin pa la sogs pa de'i gnas kyi bdag nyid can gyi cha de'i mtshams gang zhig cha de las rdzas bskur bar bya ba de 'das pa gang zhig cha gang yang rung bas ma yin no //
translated: The part of the base, etc. is the part that is the nature of the location of that. The side of that part that is to be moved by the substance is the side that is past, not any other part.

original: 'on kyang ngos gzhan gyis te ngos gang zhig gi gzhi 'di ste mtshams brjod pa de'i rjes su gyur pa'i ngos kyi bshal ba la gzhi'i steng gi cha la gzhi'i steng gi chas nye bar khrid pa la rku ba'o //üîΩgal @73a * //
analyzed: 'on kyang ngos gzhan gyis te ngos gang zhig gi gzhi 'di ste mtshams brjod pa de'i rjes su gyur pa'i ngos kyi bshal ba la gzhi'i steng gi cha la gzhi'i steng gi chas nye bar khrid pa la rku ba'o // gal @73a * //
translated: But by the other side, the side that is the basis of this side, the side that is expressed as the side, the side that is subsequent to that is the side that is in front. The part of the base that is moved by the part of the base is the part of the base that is brought near.üîΩIf it has passed that place,

original: te des sa de 'das par gyur na zhes bya ba ni bye brag med par smos pas phyogs las phyi rol tu rdzas kyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: te des sa de 'das par gyur na zhes bya ba ni bye brag med par smos pas phyogs las phyi rol tu rdzas kyis ni ma yin no //
translated: since it is stated without distinction, it is not by substance outside the direction.

original: gal te das sa de 'das par gyur na zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gal te das sa de 'das par gyur na zhes bya ba ste /
translated: If it has passed that place,

original: de bas na 'dir bskur ba gdags par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na 'dir bskur ba gdags par bya'o //
translated: therefore, the movement should be designated here.

original: khyab pa'i khongs su gtogs pa'i de dang ldan pa nyid la bskur bar bya ba'i rdzas de phyogs ci tsam khyab pa de'i khongs su bsdus pa'i mtshams kyi cha la ngos gzhan gyis bshal nas 'das pa ni brkus pa ma yin zhes ston pa khyab pa'i khongs suüîΩgtogs pa'i de dang ldan pa nyid la ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni rku bzhin pa'i rdzas des phyogs ji tsam khyab pa de'i khongs su gtogs pa'i cha'i mtha' dang ldan pa nyid du gyur pa la gang zhig khyab pa'i khongs su gtogs pa'i cha'i mtshams
analyzed: khyab pa'i khongs su gtogs pa'i de dang ldan pa nyid la bskur bar bya ba'i rdzas de phyogs ci tsam khyab pa de'i khongs su bsdus pa'i mtshams kyi cha la ngos gzhan gyis bshal nas 'das pa ni brkus pa ma yin zhes ston pa khyab pa'i khongs su gtogs pa'i de dang ldan pa nyid la ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni rku bzhin pa'i rdzas des phyogs ji tsam khyab pa de'i khongs su gtogs pa'i cha'i mtha' dang ldan pa nyid du gyur pa la gang zhig khyab pa'i khongs su gtogs pa'i cha'i mtshams
translated: The object to be stolen is the substance that is possessed by the pervader. The part of the boundary that is included within the extent pervaded by that substance is not stolen if it is passed beyond by the other side. This shows that it is not the possession of the object to be stolen that is included within the pervader.

original: de las ngos gzhan gyis 'das nas bshal bas brkus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de las ngos gzhan gyis 'das nas bshal bas brkus pa ma yin no //
translated: The substance that is being stolen pervades a certain extent. The boundary of the part that is included within that extent is possessed. If it is passed beyond by the other side, it is not stolen.

original: gang gi phyir 'di ltar ma lus pa la rku ba bsgrub pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'di ltar ma lus pa la rku ba bsgrub pa ma yin te /
translated: Because the act of stealing is not established in all parts.

original: 'on kyang dum bu phyi ma las phrad pa bsgrub ba'i cha shas 'dod par gyur pa nyid kyis rku bar gyur pa rnams la tshogs pa'i ngo bo la so so nyid kyis rku ba bskyed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang dum bu phyi ma las phrad pa bsgrub ba'i cha shas 'dod par gyur pa nyid kyis rku bar gyur pa rnams la tshogs pa'i ngo bo la so so nyid kyis rku ba bskyed pa ma yin te /
translated: However, in the latter part of the verse, it is said that the thief does not generate the individual parts of the collection, because the thief desires only the part that is established as the collection.

original: tshogs pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis brten pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: tshogs pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis brten pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because the collection itself is dependent.

original: de ltar yang dge slong gis yo byad lci ba shin tu thag ring por bshal te brkus kyang mtha'i ltung bar mi 'gyur ba mchis sam yod de /
analyzed: de ltar yang dge slong gis yo byad lci ba shin tu thag ring por bshal te brkus kyang mtha'i ltung bar mi 'gyur ba mchis sam yod de /
translated: Thus, if a monk steals a heavy object that is far away, is it the case that he does not commit a heinous offense?

original: dge slong gis yo byad lci ba'i ngos gcig kho na nas bzung ste shin tu thag ring por bshal kyang ngos cig shos gnas de nas ma 'das na nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: dge slong gis yo byad lci ba'i ngos gcig kho na nas bzung ste shin tu thag ring por bshal kyang ngos cig shos gnas de nas ma 'das na nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
translated: If a monk seizes only one side of a heavy object and drags it a long distance, but the other side does not pass beyond its original location, then he commits a serious violation.

original: de'i mtshan nyid ni gyong grugs dang gas pa dang bris pa dang / kha dog gzhan dang bar mtshams dang bar chad dag go zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de'i mtshan nyid ni gyong grugs dang gas pa dang bris pa dang / kha dog gzhan dang bar mtshams dang bar chad dag go zhes bya ba la /
translated: Its characteristics are loss, damage, writing, another color, and interruption.

original: mtshams de'i mtshan nyid ni bdag nyid de'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: mtshams de'i mtshan nyid ni bdag nyid de'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The characteristic of the boundary is the characteristic of that self.

original: gang du bcad pa brjod par bya ba'o //üîΩgyong drugs zhes bya ba ni gyong ba bzung ba'o //
analyzed: gang du bcad pa brjod par bya ba'o // gyong drugs zhes bya ba ni gyong ba bzung ba'o //
translated: Where the boundary is described.üîΩThe word broken means that which is broken is taken as the boundary.

original: gas pa zhes bya ba ni gas pa bzung ba'o //
analyzed: gas pa zhes bya ba ni gas pa bzung ba'o //
translated: The word cut means that which is cut is taken as the boundary.

original: bris pa zhes bya ba ni yi ge bris pa bzung ba'o //
analyzed: bris pa zhes bya ba ni yi ge bris pa bzung ba'o //
translated: The word written means that which is written in letters is taken as the boundary.

original: kha dog gzhan bya ba ni kha dog gcig las gzhan pa gang yin pa de ni kha dog gzhan te de ni mtshams gzhan pa'o //
analyzed: kha dog gzhan bya ba ni kha dog gcig las gzhan pa gang yin pa de ni kha dog gzhan te de ni mtshams gzhan pa'o //
translated: The word another color means that which is different from one color is another color, and that is another boundary.

original: bar mtshams kyi tshig gi ni re lde la sogs pa rab tu shes par gyur pa'i bar mtshams bzung ba'o //
analyzed: bar mtshams kyi tshig gi ni re lde la sogs pa rab tu shes par gyur pa'i bar mtshams bzung ba'o //
translated: The word interval means that which is known as a fence, etc. is taken as the interval.

original: bar chad ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: bar chad ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: There are two kinds of interruptions:

original: @73b shin tu gyur pa dang / sa phyogs gzhan la rtsom par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: @73b shin tu gyur pa dang / sa phyogs gzhan la rtsom par gyur pa'o //
translated: change and beginning in another place.

original: sa phyogs gzhan de las mthong ba nyid du de rtsom par gyur pa gang gis 'di rtsom par 'gyur pa'i sa phyogs gzhan de na zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: sa phyogs gzhan de las mthong ba nyid du de rtsom par gyur pa gang gis 'di rtsom par 'gyur pa'i sa phyogs gzhan de na zhugs pa'o //
translated: That other place is seen from that place, where it is begun. That other place where this is begun is entered.

original: shin tu gyur pa ni shin tu'am /
analyzed: shin tu gyur pa ni shin tu'am /
translated: The very much transformed is the very much or the other side of the field, etc.

original: gzhan zhing la sogs pa ngos gcig tu gyur pa'i sa phyogs la zhugs pa ma yin pa dang / ngos gzhan du gyur pa la ni gsum pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan zhing la sogs pa ngos gcig tu gyur pa'i sa phyogs la zhugs pa ma yin pa dang / ngos gzhan du gyur pa la ni gsum pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: The middle is not in the place of the side, and the third is not in the place of the other side.

original: de bas na de dag gis dbus su brkos pa'i sa la dbyig gus bzhag pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na de dag gis dbus su brkos pa'i sa la dbyig gus bzhag pa'o //
translated: Therefore, they are placed with the stick in the earth dug up in the middle by them.

original: 'dir bar chad kyi tshig gis ni bsdus par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir bar chad kyi tshig gis ni bsdus par rig par bya'o //
translated: Here, the word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù should be understood as inclusive.

original: re lde la sogs pas bar du bcad pa rnams la bar mtshams kyi chig gis ni kha dog gzhan dang ldan pa 'am gzhan la kha dog gzhan gyi tshig gis te /
analyzed: re lde la sogs pas bar du bcad pa rnams la bar mtshams kyi chig gis ni kha dog gzhan dang ldan pa 'am gzhan la kha dog gzhan gyi tshig gis te /
translated: In those cut off by fences, etc., the word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù refers to another color or another place with another color.

original: gang du chad pa brjod par bya ba de tsam gyi dgongs pa ni mdo 'di yin gyi /
analyzed: gang du chad pa brjod par bya ba de tsam gyi dgongs pa ni mdo 'di yin gyi /
translated: The intention of this s≈´tra is that it is just the expression of the interruption.

original: ma lus pa'i dgongs pa can ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ma lus pa'i dgongs pa can ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not the intention of the whole.

original: 'di la brjod par bya ba nyid ni gzhan du yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'di la brjod par bya ba nyid ni gzhan du yin zhe na /
translated: If it is said that the expression itself is elsewhere,

original: dbus su gnas pa'i skye ba'i rgyun la'o //
analyzed: dbus su gnas pa'i skye ba'i rgyun la'o //
translated: it is in the stream of birth that abides in the middle.

original: der ni de nyid da ltar yang gnas 'di zhes bya ba blo'i skabs yod de /
analyzed: der ni de nyid da ltar yang gnas 'di zhes bya ba blo'i skabs yod de /
translated: There, the present existence is located in that very place, as is the case, for example, with the mind.

original: bzlog pa'i don du gnas de la gnas kyi skye ba'i rgyun la yod pa nyid de gang gi phyir da ltar yang gnas de nyid ces bya ba'i blo'i skabs yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bzlog pa'i don du gnas de la gnas kyi skye ba'i rgyun la yod pa nyid de gang gi phyir da ltar yang gnas de nyid ces bya ba'i blo'i skabs yod pa ma yin no //
translated: But the opposite is the case for the stream of birth, because the present existence is not located in that very place, as is the case, for example, with the mind.üîΩFor living beings, the ribs, etc., are the obstacles, since they are suitable to be separated.

original: srog chags la ni rtsib ma la sogs pa tha dad ba btag tu rung ba rnams bar chad yin no zhes bya ba ni srog chags la ni rtsib ma la sogs pa gang rnams la tha dad par rtag tu rung ba rtsib ma la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: srog chags la ni rtsib ma la sogs pa tha dad ba btag tu rung ba rnams bar chad yin no zhes bya ba ni srog chags la ni rtsib ma la sogs pa gang rnams la tha dad par rtag tu rung ba rtsib ma la sogs pa'o //
translated: The ribs, etc., of living beings are the obstacles, since they are suitable to be separated as different things.

original: de rnams kyi bar nyid de bar chad ni nges pa ste /
analyzed: de rnams kyi bar nyid de bar chad ni nges pa ste /
translated: The obstacles are the intervals between them.

original: 'di rnams la so sor gnas pa nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'di rnams la so sor gnas pa nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that they are located separately.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni so dang snas bar du bcad pa bzung ba'o //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni so dang snas bar du bcad pa bzung ba'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù includes the teeth and nose.

original: sog chags la gcig pa nyid kyi phyir srog chags kyi lus kyi bdag nyid la gcig pa nyid kyi phyir du gnas kyang gcig pa nyid ces bya ba'i dogs pa bzlog pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: sog chags la gcig pa nyid kyi phyir srog chags kyi lus kyi bdag nyid la gcig pa nyid kyi phyir du gnas kyang gcig pa nyid ces bya ba'i dogs pa bzlog pa'i don du'o //
translated: because of the unity of the animal, the unity of the body of the animal, the doubt is removed that it is the same.

original: sha dang khrag nyid nye bar brtags pa nyid la 'di'i tha dad par brtag tu rung ba nyid kyi phyir rtsib ma la sogs pa rnams nyid la gnas pa nyid yin te stobs chung ba nyid la ma yin no //
analyzed: sha dang khrag nyid nye bar brtags pa nyid la 'di'i tha dad par brtag tu rung ba nyid kyi phyir rtsib ma la sogs pa rnams nyid la gnas pa nyid yin te stobs chung ba nyid la ma yin no //
translated: It is the ribs, etc., that are the abode, not the weak parts, because it is proper to conceive of a difference in the mere designation of flesh and blood.

original: 'di rnams kyi lus kyi bdag nyid kyi gnas la cha shas nyid kyi phyir so sor gnas pa nyid shes par bya ba ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'di rnams kyi lus kyi bdag nyid kyi gnas la cha shas nyid kyi phyir so sor gnas pa nyid shes par bya ba ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is not to be understood that they are separate abodes in the body.

original: des na rtsib ma zhig gcig gi phyogs nas @74a * //
analyzed: des na rtsib ma zhig gcig gi phyogs nas @74a * //
translated: Therefore, if one moves a rib from one place

original: rtsib ma tha dad par brtag tu rung ba nyid gzhan gyi bar du spos na brkus pa nyid du brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: rtsib ma tha dad par brtag tu rung ba nyid gzhan gyi bar du spos na brkus pa nyid du brjod par bya'o //
translated: to another, where it is proper to conceive of a different rib, it should be called stolen.

original: gding ba bting ba nyid gnas nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni sa la sogs pa gzhir rtsva la sogs pa'i gding ba bting ba nyid yod na gding ba de nyid kyis de la gnas pa'i rdzas la gnas pa nyid de sa la sogs pa de la niüîΩma yin no //
analyzed: gding ba bting ba nyid gnas nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni sa la sogs pa gzhir rtsva la sogs pa'i gding ba bting ba nyid yod na gding ba de nyid kyis de la gnas pa'i rdzas la gnas pa nyid de sa la sogs pa de la ni ma yin no //
translated: The very spreading of the mat is the very place. If there is the very spreading of the mat of grass, etc. on the ground, etc. which is the basis, then the very substance which is placed on that is the very place. It is not the ground, etc.

original: gding ba bting ba'i sgra dag la yang dag pa'i sgra thog mar ldan pa ma byas so //
analyzed: gding ba bting ba'i sgra dag la yang dag pa'i sgra thog mar ldan pa ma byas so //
translated: The word ‚Äúvery‚Äù is not placed at the beginning of the word ‚Äúspreading‚Äù in the expression ‚Äúthe very spreading of the mat.‚Äù

original: brag la sogs pa gding ba thams cad la gding ba khongs su bsdus pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: brag la sogs pa gding ba thams cad la gding ba khongs su bsdus pa'i don du'o //
translated: The meaning is that the spreading of the mat is included in all the spreadings on rock, etc.

original: yang dag par gding ba bting ba zhes bya ba brjod par gyur na rtsva dang shing lo la sogs pa'i rang bzhin nyid kyi gding ba nyid la go bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang dag par gding ba bting ba zhes bya ba brjod par gyur na rtsva dang shing lo la sogs pa'i rang bzhin nyid kyi gding ba nyid la go bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If the expression ‚Äúthe very spreading of the mat‚Äù is used, it is understood that the very spreading of the mat is of the nature of grass, leaves, etc.

original: skye ba ni bzhag pa dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba ni rtsva dang gel ba dang rtsi dang nags tshal la sogs pa 'byung ba'i skye ba ni dper na rdzas bzhag pa brkus pa dang 'dra bas de bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: skye ba ni bzhag pa dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba ni rtsva dang gel ba dang rtsi dang nags tshal la sogs pa 'byung ba'i skye ba ni dper na rdzas bzhag pa brkus pa dang 'dra bas de bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
translated: The arising of grass, bushes, herbs, and forests is like the theft of a placed substance.

original: gnas nas spo ba ni 'di la rku ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gnas nas spo ba ni 'di la rku ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äútheft‚Äù here is the removal from the place.

original: 'brel pa sel ba tsam ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'brel pa sel ba tsam ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not merely the removal of the connection,

original: gang zhig 'di la sa la sogs pa bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: gang zhig 'di la sa la sogs pa bsdu ba'o //
translated: because the earth and so on are included in that.

original: 'dir gzhung ni /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni /
translated: Here is the text:

original: dge slong gis me tog gi shing ljon pa phyung ste /
analyzed: dge slong gis me tog gi shing ljon pa phyung ste /
translated: If a monk digs up a flowering tree,

original: rku na ji srid du nom par mi byed pa'i bar du ni nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rku na ji srid du nom par mi byed pa'i bar du ni nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: as long as he does not appraise it, it is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: nom pa nas gnas dang spo ba'i bar gyis ni brkus pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: nom pa nas gnas dang spo ba'i bar gyis ni brkus pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: From the appraisal up to the removal from the place, it is called theft.

original: me tog gi shing gi rin thang brtsi bar bya'o zhes bya ba gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: me tog gi shing gi rin thang brtsi bar bya'o zhes bya ba gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The value of the flowering tree should be assessed.

original: kha cig ni me tog gi shing phyung ste /
analyzed: kha cig ni me tog gi shing phyung ste /
translated: Some say: If a monk digs up a flowering tree,

original: rku na me tog gi shing gi rin thang bgrang bar byed ces bya ba 'di tsam 'don pa yin te lhag ma ni ma yin no //üîΩ'don pa 'di la yang gnas nas spo ba las cho ga gzhan la ldang ba dogs par bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: rku na me tog gi shing gi rin thang bgrang bar byed ces bya ba 'di tsam 'don pa yin te lhag ma ni ma yin no // 'don pa 'di la yang gnas nas spo ba las cho ga gzhan la ldang ba dogs par bya ba ma yin te /
translated: The text should be understood as meaning: ‚ÄúIf one steals a flower tree, one is to be fined the value of the tree.‚ÄùüîΩThe rest of the text is not to be taken literally.

original: 'dir phyung ba nyid rku bar brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dir phyung ba nyid rku bar brjod pa yin te /
translated: And in this interpretation, the penance is not to be taken as a substitute for the penance of banishment.üîΩFor the text says that the flower tree is to be taken out, that is, stolen.

original: 'dir rku ba'i khyad par ni 'dod pa zhes bya bar rnam par gnas te phyung nas rku ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir rku ba'i khyad par ni 'dod pa zhes bya bar rnam par gnas te phyung nas rku ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúdesire‚Äù is to be supplied in the text.

original: ji ltar kha phye nas nyal ba dang phye ba'i khas nyal bar byed pa zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: ji ltar kha phye nas nyal ba dang phye ba'i khas nyal bar byed pa zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: Just as one says, ‚ÄúHe sleeps with his mouth open‚Äù and ‚ÄúHe sleeps with his mouth closed.‚Äù

original: phyung ba yang gnas nyid nas spos pa yin te sa dang 'brel pa bsal ba'i 'og tu rku ba 'di yin no //
analyzed: phyung ba yang gnas nyid nas spos pa yin te sa dang 'brel pa bsal ba'i 'og tu rku ba 'di yin no //
translated: The tree is to be taken out from its place, that is, stolen, after the earth connected with it has been removed.

original: gang du thams cad rdul phra rab tsam yang 'gro ba ni 'pho ba gnas las so //
analyzed: gang du thams cad rdul phra rab tsam yang 'gro ba ni 'pho ba gnas las so //
translated: For it is said that one commits theft when one moves something, even to the extent of an atom, from its place.

original: bskon pa ni bud na'o zhes bya ba brkus pa zhes bya ba dang rjes su 'brel lo //
analyzed: bskon pa ni bud na'o zhes bya ba brkus pa zhes bya ba dang rjes su 'brel lo //
translated: The word ‚Äúif‚Äù is to be supplied in the text.

original: phud na'o zhes bya ba ni phud pa dang @74b bkrol ba ste de la gang du yongs su bsal ba'o //
analyzed: phud na'o zhes bya ba ni phud pa dang @74b bkrol ba ste de la gang du yongs su bsal ba'o //
translated: If it is asked, What is the difference between the two? the answer is: The former is the act of stealing, the latter is the act of taking away.

original: de la bskon pa gang yin pa de ni brkus pa'o //
analyzed: de la bskon pa gang yin pa de ni brkus pa'o //
translated: The act of taking away is the act of stealing.

original: 'dir gzhung ni /üîΩde dag rgyan sna tshogs dag gis brgyan par gyur pa dge slong gis brgyan par gyur pa de'i sbyor bas khri las ldang ba nas /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni / de dag rgyan sna tshogs dag gis brgyan par gyur pa dge slong gis brgyan par gyur pa de'i sbyor bas khri las ldang ba nas /
translated: Here is the text:

original: nom nyug mi byed pa'i sbyor ba'i sbyor ba ji srid du nom nyug byed pa nas gnas nas gnas gzhan du ma spos pa'i bar du byed na sbyor ba gnas nas spo ba'i tshe brkus par brjod par bya zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no
analyzed: nom nyug mi byed pa'i sbyor ba'i sbyor ba ji srid du nom nyug byed pa nas gnas nas gnas gzhan du ma spos pa'i bar du byed na sbyor ba gnas nas spo ba'i tshe brkus par brjod par bya zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no
translated: The monk, having adorned them with various ornaments, by the act of rising from the seat, up to the act of not touching, as long as he does not move them from their place, when the act of moving them from their place is performed, it is called the act of stealing.

original: // 'dir bskon pa ni gnas gzhan du 'pho ba la mngon par 'dod pas rnam par gnas pa ste /
analyzed: // 'dir bskon pa ni gnas gzhan du 'pho ba la mngon par 'dod pas rnam par gnas pa ste /
translated: Here, the act of taking away is the act of moving them from their place, with the desire to move them to another place.

original: de'i phyir 'di ltar nye bar brtags pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di ltar nye bar brtags pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is examined in this way.

original: ji ltar yang rnam par dben par gnas gzhan nas 'pho ba ste gang gi phyir phyung ba ni bton pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar yang rnam par dben par gnas gzhan nas 'pho ba ste gang gi phyir phyung ba ni bton pa'o //
translated: In any case, having been removed means having been transferred from one place to another, because it is removed from where it was.

original: de bas na phyung bar byed pa ni 'dir ma chad pa ste /
analyzed: de bas na phyung bar byed pa ni 'dir ma chad pa ste /
translated: Therefore, having been removed here means having been taken away,

original: gzhan pa'i gnas dor ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan pa'i gnas dor ba ni ma yin no //
translated: not having been left in another place.

original: phral ba'i skabs bshal ba ni phyung bar byed pa'i tshul ma yin pa zhes bya ba'o ;
analyzed: phral ba'i skabs bshal ba ni phyung bar byed pa'i tshul ma yin pa zhes bya ba'o ;
translated: The context of having been removed is not the manner of having been taken away.

original: / sho gam ni sa 'das na'o zhes bya ba ni rku ba zhes bya ba dang rjes su 'brel to //
analyzed: / sho gam ni sa 'das na'o zhes bya ba ni rku ba zhes bya ba dang rjes su 'brel to //
translated: A toll is a tax on passing through a place. Having been stolen is connected to this.

original: 'dir sho gam gyi gnas ni sa'o //
analyzed: 'dir sho gam gyi gnas ni sa'o //
translated: Here, a toll station is a place.

original: de yang gang du ji tsam zhugs pa la sho gam pa la sbyin par bya ba nyid de /
analyzed: de yang gang du ji tsam zhugs pa la sho gam pa la sbyin par bya ba nyid de /
translated: And it is a place where a toll is to be paid for however much one enters.

original: de tsam du sa de las 'das pa ni 'das pa'o //
analyzed: de tsam du sa de las 'das pa ni 'das pa'o //
translated: Having passed that much, having passed through means that place.

original: gang zhig sho gam bya ba nyid kyis sho gam gyi sa las 'das pa ni sho gam gyi sa de nyid kyis yin gyi phyogs gzhan gyis ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig sho gam bya ba nyid kyis sho gam gyi sa las 'das pa ni sho gam gyi sa de nyid kyis yin gyi phyogs gzhan gyis ni ma yin te /
translated: One who has passed through a toll station by the very fact of paying the toll, not by another means,

original: 'das pa de na sho gam rku ba'o //
analyzed: 'das pa de na sho gam rku ba'o //
translated: has stolen that toll station.

original: sho gam nyid la ni de 'da' bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: sho gam nyid la ni de 'da' bar byed pa ste /
translated: The passage of the tax-collector is in regard to the tax itself.

original: gang zhig sho gam bya ba la sho gam bya ba'i char gyur pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: gang zhig sho gam bya ba la sho gam bya ba'i char gyur pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because the tax-collector is the one who is engaged in the activity of collecting the tax.

original: rgyud pas kyang sa la brten pa nyid kyis dgos pa ni ma yin te /üîΩde bas na khur bas sam rang gi lus kyis sam /
analyzed: rgyud pas kyang sa la brten pa nyid kyis dgos pa ni ma yin te / de bas na khur bas sam rang gi lus kyis sam /
translated: The passage of the caravan is not for the sake of the land, because it is based on the land.üîΩTherefore, the passage of the tax-collector is not by the land, whether it is the passage of the burden, the passage of the body,

original: zla la sogs pas sam rang gi lus kyi khur ba dang 'brel pas sho gam gyi bya ba 'das bar byed pa ni gang zhig sho gam 'da' bar byed pa 'di la sa yis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: zla la sogs pas sam rang gi lus kyi khur ba dang 'brel pas sho gam gyi bya ba 'das bar byed pa ni gang zhig sho gam 'da' bar byed pa 'di la sa yis ni ma yin no //
translated: the passage of the month, etc., or the passage of the connection of the burden with the body.

original: de bas na 'dir 'di yang dag par bsdus nas 'da' bar byed pa bzung ba ma yin pa shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na 'dir 'di yang dag par bsdus nas 'da' bar byed pa bzung ba ma yin pa shes par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it should be understood that in this case, the passage of the tax-collector is not included in the correct enumeration of the passage of the tax.

original: sho gam gyi gnas su zhugs pa la gang zhig chu zheng du 'jug pas 'da' bar byed pa de la re zhig the tshom med pa nyid du des sa las 'da' bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: sho gam gyi gnas su zhugs pa la gang zhig chu zheng du 'jug pas 'da' bar byed pa de la re zhig the tshom med pa nyid du des sa las 'da' bar byed pa'o //
translated: When one enters the place of the tax and passes by it with the body, then the passage of the tax is by the land, without a doubt.

original: log nas gnas gzhan du 'go ba la gal te zhugs pa las sa la sogs pa yang @75a * //üîΩsbyin par bya ba nyid yod pa 'di ni 'da' bar byed pa'o //üîΩde yang log pa gang zhig 'di de nyid yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin zhes bya ba'o //üîΩ'o na sbyin par bya ba nyid ma yin na log pa la 'da' bar byed pa 'di yod pa ma yin zhes bya bar rig par bya'o //üîΩrnam par gzhag pa'i dbang gis 'di sbyin pa nyid do //
analyzed: log nas gnas gzhan du 'go ba la gal te zhugs pa las sa la sogs pa yang @75a * // sbyin par bya ba nyid yod pa 'di ni 'da' bar byed pa'o // de yang log pa gang zhig 'di de nyid yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin zhes bya ba'o // 'o na sbyin par bya ba nyid ma yin na log pa la 'da' bar byed pa 'di yod pa ma yin zhes bya bar rig par bya'o // rnam par gzhag pa'i dbang gis 'di sbyin pa nyid do //

original: mi la gal te brdas ni de grub pa na'o zhes bya ba la mi rku ba ni rnam pa mang du 'gyur te mi 'dod bzhin du dkris pa dang gzhag pa dag gis so //
analyzed: mi la gal te brdas ni de grub pa na'o zhes bya ba la mi rku ba ni rnam pa mang du 'gyur te mi 'dod bzhin du dkris pa dang gzhag pa dag gis so //
translated: If a man is to be freed by a sign, then there are many kinds of non-stealing: by not wanting, by being bound, by being placed.üîΩBy the cause of destruction, or by wandering, one is confused, even by spells and medicines.üîΩOne is bound, even by being released.üîΩOne is asleep, even by the projection of unconsciousness.

analyzed: 'jig pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis sam kun du rgyu bas rnam par rmongs par gyur pa la yang sngags dang sman dag gis so //
translated: One is killed, even by the exertion of the lord of death, or by the lord of death. This is the difference.üîΩIf a man is to be freed by a sign, then there are many kinds of non-stealing: by not wanting, by being bound, by being placed.üîΩBy the cause of destruction, or by wandering, one is confused, even by spells and medicines.

original: bcings pa la yang bkrol bas so //
analyzed: bcings pa la yang bkrol bas so //

original: gnyid kyis log pa la yang ma tshor ba'i 'phen pas so //
analyzed: gnyid kyis log pa la yang ma tshor ba'i 'phen pas so //

analyzed: gsod pa nye bar rtsol ba yang 'chi bdag dang lhan cig tu'am 'chi bdag gis zhes bya ba khyad par 'di'o //
translated: One is killed, even by the exertion of the lord of death, or by the lord of death. This is the difference.

original: mi la ni gal te brdas bkru pa'o //
analyzed: mi la ni gal te brdas bkru pa'o //
translated: If a man is to be freed by a sign, then there are many kinds of non-stealing: by not wanting, by being bound, by being placed.üîΩBy the cause of destruction, or by wandering, one is confused, even by spells and medicines.üîΩOne is bound, even by being released.
