analyzed: de grub pa ni brda grub pa nyid rku ba'o // 'di ltar gzhung las /
translated: One is asleep, even by the projection of unconsciousness.üîΩOne is killed, even by the exertion of the lord of death, or by the lord of death. This is the difference.üîΩIf a man is to be freed by a sign, then there are many kinds of non-stealing: by not wanting, by being bound, by being placed.

original: mi rku ba rnam pa gsum po yul phyogs dang / mtshan ma dang ; brdas so //
analyzed: mi rku ba rnam pa gsum po yul phyogs dang / mtshan ma dang ; brdas so //
translated: By the cause of destruction, or by wandering, one is confused, even by spells and medicines.üîΩOne is bound, even by being released.üîΩOne is asleep, even by the projection of unconsciousness.üîΩOne is killed, even by the exertion of

original: rang gi 'dod pas rab tu rgyu ba grol ba phrad pa ni de 'dir rku ba nyid kyis mngon par 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi 'dod pas rab tu rgyu ba grol ba phrad pa ni de 'dir rku ba nyid kyis mngon par 'dod pa'o //
translated: The meeting of the one who is set free with the one who is set free by his own desire is the one who is here desired by the thief.

original: 'dir 'dun sal sogs pa'i yul phyogs brjod do //
analyzed: 'dir 'dun sal sogs pa'i yul phyogs brjod do //
translated: Here, the place is indicated by the word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù

original: mtshan ma ni rtags te skra dang kha spu bregs te ring po ma lon pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan ma ni rtags te skra dang kha spu bregs te ring po ma lon pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The sign is the mark, such as ‚Äúhaving hair and a beard that are not long.‚Äù

original: brda ni snga dro la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: brda ni snga dro la sogs pa'o //
translated: The signal is the morning, etc.

original: yul phyogs la sogs pa gsum po 'di rnams la don tha dad pa nyid yod kyang /
analyzed: yul phyogs la sogs pa gsum po 'di rnams la don tha dad pa nyid yod kyang /
translated: Although these three, the place, etc., have different meanings,

original: snga dro la sogs pa'i khyad par mngon par mtshon par dka' bas te /
analyzed: snga dro la sogs pa'i khyad par mngon par mtshon par dka' bas te /
translated: the distinction of the morning, etc., is difficult to indicate.

original: de bas na spyir brda'i sgras brjod pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na spyir brda'i sgras brjod pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the general term ‚Äúsignal‚Äù is used.

original: brda gang yin pa 'di byas pa gang gi tshe khyod kyi kho bo 'di dang 'di lta bur mthong ba de'i tshe khyod kho bo'i gan du shog ces bya ba lta bu ste /
analyzed: brda gang yin pa 'di byas pa gang gi tshe khyod kyi kho bo 'di dang 'di lta bur mthong ba de'i tshe khyod kho bo'i gan du shog ces bya ba lta bu ste /
translated: The signal is the one who has done this, at the time when you see me in such and such a place, then you should come to me.

original: gang gi tshe brda de grub pa de'i tshe mi de brkus par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe brda de grub pa de'i tshe mi de brkus par rig par bya'o //
translated: When that signal is accomplished, then that man should be known as the thief.

original: 'di dang rnam pa gzhan rnams la yang mtshan nyid kyi rjes su 'brang bas rku ba rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di dang rnam pa gzhan rnams la yang mtshan nyid kyi rjes su 'brang bas rku ba rtogs par bya'o //
translated: And in other cases, one should understand stealing by following the definition.

original: gter bzhin du gsang sngags kyis drang bar bya ba @75b la snang bar gyur na'o //
analyzed: gter bzhin du gsang sngags kyis drang bar bya ba @75b la snang bar gyur na'o //
translated: If one steals a treasure, it is like stealing a treasure.

original: phyi bzhin du 'brang ba dang nang byan byed pa med pa ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: phyi bzhin du 'brang ba dang nang byan byed pa med pa ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: It is not that there is no following or service.

original: gal te de ltar na bya spar ba na'o zhes bya ba ni 'dir gal te bya spar te brku bar byed na'o //
analyzed: gal te de ltar na bya spar ba na'o zhes bya ba ni 'dir gal te bya spar te brku bar byed na'o //
translated: If it is like that, then it is like stealing a bird. Here, if one steals a bird, then it is like stealing a bird.

original: de'i tshe bya spar na brkus pa khon yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe bya spar na brkus pa khon yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: At that time, if it is a bird, it should be understood as stealing.

original: 'dir gzhung ni /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni /
translated: Here is the text:

original: dge slong bya spar te rku bar byed na bya'i rin thang brtsi bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: dge slong bya spar te rku bar byed na bya'i rin thang brtsi bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: If a monk steals a bird, he should calculate the value of the bird.

original: spar ba na zhes bya 'di ni rku ba'i khyad par te /
analyzed: spar ba na zhes bya 'di ni rku ba'i khyad par te /
translated: This if it is a bird is a special case of stealing.

original: de ltar spar nas rku bar byed ces bya ba'i don 'di 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar spar nas rku bar byed ces bya ba'i don 'di 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: The meaning of if it is like that, then it is like stealing a bird is established.

original: spar ba thams cad ni mtshams gzhan du 'gro ba ste /
analyzed: spar ba thams cad ni mtshams gzhan du 'gro ba ste /
translated: All the other cases are similar.

original: de bas na de'i rku ba nyid ni 'dir dpe yin no ;
analyzed: de bas na de'i rku ba nyid ni 'dir dpe yin no ;
translated: Therefore, the example here is the stealing of that.

original: / bya'i tshig ni rdzas rnams thams cad la cho ga 'di rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: / bya'i tshig ni rdzas rnams thams cad la cho ga 'di rtogs par bya'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù should be understood to apply to all the substances.

original: dud 'gro btags pa ni bkrol na'o zhes bya ba ni dud 'gro btags pa rku ba ni bkrol ba na brkus pa yin no //üîΩ'dis ni dge slong gis ri dags rlubs su chud pa phyung na ri dags kyi rin thang brtsi bar bya'o //
analyzed: dud 'gro btags pa ni bkrol na'o zhes bya ba ni dud 'gro btags pa rku ba ni bkrol ba na brkus pa yin no // 'dis ni dge slong gis ri dags rlubs su chud pa phyung na ri dags kyi rin thang brtsi bar bya'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe liberation of the bound animal‚Äù means that the stealing of the bound animal is the liberation.üîΩThis includes the statement: ‚ÄúIf a monk rescues a deer that has fallen into a pit, he should be assessed the value of the deer.‚Äù

original: dge slong gis nya dol la thogs pa phyung na nya'i rin thang brtsi bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa rnams ni de la 'di bsdus pa yin no //
analyzed: dge slong gis nya dol la thogs pa phyung na nya'i rin thang brtsi bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa rnams ni de la 'di bsdus pa yin no //
translated: This also includes the statement: ‚ÄúIf a monk rescues a fish that is caught on a hook, he should be assessed the value of the fish.‚Äù

original: bkrol ba nyid las rin thang brtsi ba la rim pa yongs su bzung bas bkrol ba nyid 'dir rku ba mngon par 'dod pa zhes bya ba shes par bya'o //
analyzed: bkrol ba nyid las rin thang brtsi ba la rim pa yongs su bzung bas bkrol ba nyid 'dir rku ba mngon par 'dod pa zhes bya ba shes par bya'o //
translated: The liberation is included here because the assessment of the value is based on the liberation.

original: brtod pa dang khyu las bkar ba gnyis ni mi snang bar gyur pa nyid na'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: brtod pa dang khyu las bkar ba gnyis ni mi snang bar gyur pa nyid na'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: The two, being untied and being led away from the herd, are when it is no longer visible.

original: brtod pa dang khyu las bkar bas dud 'gro'i bya ba ni mi snang ba nyid 'di la brkus pa'o //
analyzed: brtod pa dang khyu las bkar bas dud 'gro'i bya ba ni mi snang ba nyid 'di la brkus pa'o //
translated: The animal activity of being untied and being led away from the herd is when it is no longer visible.

original: gal te 'di la der bdag po 'am de dang 'dra ba yod na phyi bzhin 'brang ba 'phrog bzhin pa 'di la'am /
analyzed: gal te 'di la der bdag po 'am de dang 'dra ba yod na phyi bzhin 'brang ba 'phrog bzhin pa 'di la'am /
translated: If there is an owner or someone like him there, then it is stealing when the animal is being led away.

original: phyir 'gro bzhin pa ma yin pa de la rtse gcig de'i gnas las mi snang ba nyid do //
analyzed: phyir 'gro bzhin pa ma yin pa de la rtse gcig de'i gnas las mi snang ba nyid do //
translated: Or, if it is not being led away, then it is when it is no longer visible at its place.üîΩBut if it is not there, then it is when it is no longer visible at the place where it was tied or at the place where it was being led.

original: 'on ta yod pa ma yin na ma bkrol ba la'am de la rtsi gcig pa la gal te khyu gnas pa la brtod pa dang khyu las bkar bas khyu'i mtha' ma tshang bas mi snang ba nyid do //
analyzed: 'on ta yod pa ma yin na ma bkrol ba la'am de la rtsi gcig pa la gal te khyu gnas pa la brtod pa dang khyu las bkar bas khyu'i mtha' ma tshang bas mi snang ba nyid do //
translated: If it is not alone, then it is when it does not move from its place.

original: gal te gcig pu ma yin na gnas de las mi bskyod na de nas mi snang ba nyid ni rku ba zhes bya ba 'di rigs par rtogs par bya'o ;
analyzed: gal te gcig pu ma yin na gnas de las mi bskyod na de nas mi snang ba nyid ni rku ba zhes bya ba 'di rigs par rtogs par bya'o ;
translated: Then it is when it is no longer visible. This is how the reasoning should be understood.

original: / gnas ma nges pa nyid kyi phyir dang rab tu rgyu ba mi gnas pa nyid kyis grol ba'i dud 'gro la gnas kyi tha ma 'di la spo ba rnam par gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: / gnas ma nges pa nyid kyi phyir dang rab tu rgyu ba mi gnas pa nyid kyis grol ba'i dud 'gro la gnas kyi tha ma 'di la spo ba rnam par gnas pa yin no //
translated: Because the place is not fixed and because the movement is not fixed, the animal is liberated.

original: de yang 'di la 'di rnam par gnas nas te gang zhig stobs kyi bdag nyid brtan pa'i phyir de'i tshe mi nus pa'am /
analyzed: de yang 'di la 'di rnam par gnas nas te gang zhig stobs kyi bdag nyid brtan pa'i phyir de'i tshe mi nus pa'am /
translated: And that is established here, because it is firm by the power of itself.

original: 'jigs pas kyang 'jug pa de @76a * //
analyzed: 'jigs pas kyang 'jug pa de @76a * //
translated: At that time, it is not able to enter, even out of fear.

original: bas na de lta bur gyur pa'i dud 'gro'i 'di la bzung bar rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: bas na de lta bur gyur pa'i dud 'gro'i 'di la bzung bar rtogs par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one should understand that this animal is like that.

original: de bas na gzhan du yang 'di lta bur gyur pa'i srog chags la rnam par gzhag pas 'di la dpe nyid do //
analyzed: de bas na gzhan du yang 'di lta bur gyur pa'i srog chags la rnam par gzhag pas 'di la dpe nyid do //
translated: Therefore, in other cases also, this is the example, because it is established as an animal like that.

original: 'dir gzhung ni /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni /
translated: Here is the text:

original: mig lam du snang bar ma gyur na brkus zhas bya ba'o //
analyzed: mig lam du snang bar ma gyur na brkus zhas bya ba'o //
translated: If it does not appear in the range of vision, it is called stolen.

original: zhes gsungs pa yin no ;
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa yin no ;
translated: This is what is said.

original: / gsang sngags dag gis 'dren pa ni snang ba na'o zhes bya ba ni gsang sngags rnams kyis gter la sogs pa 'dren pa na gter la sogs pa snang ba na brkus pa yin no //
analyzed: / gsang sngags dag gis 'dren pa ni snang ba na'o zhes bya ba ni gsang sngags rnams kyis gter la sogs pa 'dren pa na gter la sogs pa snang ba na brkus pa yin no //
translated: The phrase when they are brought forth by the spells means that when treasures and so on are brought forth by spells, and they appear, they are stolen.

original: yul de na gnas pa na yang kha bye ba nyid bsgrubs pas snang bar gyur na 'dir bsgrub pa'i blor 'gro ba ma yin te /
analyzed: yul de na gnas pa na yang kha bye ba nyid bsgrubs pas snang bar gyur na 'dir bsgrub pa'i blor 'gro ba ma yin te /
translated: Even if one is standing in the place where the treasure is, if one does not establish the appearance of the treasure, one does not get the idea that it is to be accomplished.

original: ci ste shin tu thag ring po nas drangs te rkang pa'i drung du bkug cing 'brel ba la yang rkang pa'i drung du snang bar ma gyur pa la grub pa'i blo skye ba ma yin te /
analyzed: ci ste shin tu thag ring po nas drangs te rkang pa'i drung du bkug cing 'brel ba la yang rkang pa'i drung du snang bar ma gyur pa la grub pa'i blo skye ba ma yin te /
translated: If one brings it from a great distance, and it is brought to one's feet, and one does not see it, one does not get the idea that it is to be accomplished.

original: de bas na snang ba la rku ba nyid du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na snang ba la rku ba nyid du shes par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one should understand that the appearance is the theft.

original: mang po zhig yod pa la gcig kho na zhig gis 'jug pa la yang snang bar sgrub pa la thams cad bsgrub pa nyid ces bya ba rku ba'i cho ga dang bcas par rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: mang po zhig yod pa la gcig kho na zhig gis 'jug pa la yang snang bar sgrub pa la thams cad bsgrub pa nyid ces bya ba rku ba'i cho ga dang bcas par rtogs par bya'o //
translated: If there are many treasures, and one enters only one, and one establishes the appearance of one, one should understand that the accomplishment of all is the rule for the theft of all.üîΩ

original: gter la ni 'di bshad pa yin te thams cad du 'di sbyar ba zhes bya ba dpe nyid du rnam par shes pa khyad par du sngar nye bar brtags pa bstan pa'i phyir phyi bzhin 'brang ba dang nang byan byed pa gnyis nur ba dang 'byangs pa dang
analyzed: gter la ni 'di bshad pa yin te thams cad du 'di sbyar ba zhes bya ba dpe nyid du rnam par shes pa khyad par du sngar nye bar brtags pa bstan pa'i phyir phyi bzhin 'brang ba dang nang byan byed pa gnyis nur ba dang 'byangs pa dang
translated: In order to demonstrate that consciousness is distinguished as previously imagined, the two, following and internalizing, are taught.üîΩThe two, retreating and mastering, the two, spreading and engaging, and the two, climbing and descending, are like the former, but they are not taken up by those two.

original: 'byam pa dang 'jug pa dang 'dzeg pa rnams kyis snga ma ltar yin kyi de gnyis kyis blangs pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni de'i tshe de la sngar mi snang ba nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: 'byam pa dang 'jug pa dang 'dzeg pa rnams kyis snga ma ltar yin kyi de gnyis kyis blangs pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni de'i tshe de la sngar mi snang ba nyid ma yin no //
translated: At that time, it is not that they do not appear to him.

original: su la mi snang ba nyid ce na /
analyzed: su la mi snang ba nyid ce na /
translated: To whom do they not appear?

original: de'i phyir phyi bzhin 'brang ba dang nang byan byed pa zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir phyi bzhin 'brang ba dang nang byan byed pa zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said that they are following and internalizing.

original: rgyab nas 'gro zhing chos gos nye bar khyer bar byed pa po zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rgyab nas 'gro zhing chos gos nye bar khyer bar byed pa po zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that they go behind him and carry his Dharma robes.

original: gzung ba ma yin pa de dag gis bzung ba la rku ba'i dngos po nyid du khas blangs pa'i rdzas la mi snang ba nyid ni brkus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gzung ba ma yin pa de dag gis bzung ba la rku ba'i dngos po nyid du khas blangs pa'i rdzas la mi snang ba nyid ni brkus pa ma yin no //
translated: Those who are not apprehended do not appear in the substance that is accepted as the object of theft.

original: gang gi phyir de brku bzhin pa nyid kyis kyang cung zad mi snang bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de brku bzhin pa nyid kyis kyang cung zad mi snang bar 'gyur te /
translated: Because of that, while being stolen, it does not appear in the slightest.

original: de la gang zhig ma nyams pa tsam la yang brkus par thal ba'o /
analyzed: de la gang zhig ma nyams pa tsam la yang brkus par thal ba'o /
translated: Therefore, it follows that even in the mere non-deterioration of that, there is theft.

original: phyi bzhin 'gro ba dang nang byan byed cing snang bar gyur pa dang mi snang bar gyur pa'i rdzas la yang ma bcad pa'i blo ma yin pa la gnas nas spo ba dag la mi snang bar gyur pa nyid la ma chad pa'i blo yod par 'gyur ro
analyzed: phyi bzhin 'gro ba dang nang byan byed cing snang bar gyur pa dang mi snang bar gyur pa'i rdzas la yang ma bcad pa'i blo ma yin pa la gnas nas spo ba dag la mi snang bar gyur pa nyid la ma chad pa'i blo yod par 'gyur ro
translated: In the case of moving and carrying substances that appear and disappear, without the mind of cutting off, the mind of non-cutting off would exist in the disappearance itself.

original: // rnam pa gang gis mi snang bar gyur pa nyid ce na /
analyzed: // rnam pa gang gis mi snang bar gyur pa nyid ce na /
translated: By what aspect does it not appear?

original: de'i phyir nur ba dang 'byangs pa dang 'byam pa @76b dang 'jug pa dang 'dzeg pa rnams kyis zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir nur ba dang 'byangs pa dang 'byam pa @76b dang 'jug pa dang 'dzeg pa rnams kyis zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said by means of stepping back, bending, stretching, entering, and climbing.

original: nur ba ni gang zhig ma nyams pa nyid kyis 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: nur ba ni gang zhig ma nyams pa nyid kyis 'gro ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúTo move‚Äù means to go without falling down.

original: 'byangs pa ni phyir nur te song ba'o //
analyzed: 'byangs pa ni phyir nur te song ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúTo slide‚Äù means to go back.

original: ma brjod pa'i don rnams la 'di bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: ma brjod pa'i don rnams la 'di bsdus pa'o //
translated: These are the meanings of the words that are not explained.

original: de rnams kyang 'da' bar byas nas 'gro ba dang mi snang ba dang gsang sngags dang sman dag gis gzugs gzhan du bsgyur ba dang / 'di dag gis ni lus gzhan rnam par bkab pas nus pa nges par gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyang 'da' bar byas nas 'gro ba dang mi snang ba dang gsang sngags dang sman dag gis gzugs gzhan du bsgyur ba dang / 'di dag gis ni lus gzhan rnam par bkab pas nus pa nges par gnas pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúTo go beyond‚Äù means to go beyond them. ‚ÄúTo disappear‚Äù means to become invisible. ‚ÄúTo change one‚Äôs form‚Äù means to change one‚Äôs form by means of spells and herbs. ‚ÄúTo remain in one‚Äôs own place‚Äù means to remain in one‚Äôs own place, having concealed one‚Äôs body by some means.

original: 'jug pa zhes bya ba ni gnas khang du'o //
analyzed: 'jug pa zhes bya ba ni gnas khang du'o //
translated: ‚ÄúTo enter‚Äù means to enter a house.

original: 'dzeg pa zhes bya ba ni yang thog gzhan du 'dzeg pa'o //
analyzed: 'dzeg pa zhes bya ba ni yang thog gzhan du 'dzeg pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúTo climb‚Äù means to climb to another story.

original: 'byam pa zhes bya ba ni gnas gtang ba ste /
analyzed: 'byam pa zhes bya ba ni gnas gtang ba ste /
translated: ‚ÄúTo move‚Äù means to leave one‚Äôs place.

original: dper na gshong nas thang la 'byung ba dang thang las gshong du 'bab pa dang / mngon par skabs yod pa nas thibs por 'jug pa dang / thibs po nas mngon par skabs yod par 'gro ba dang / gnas khang nas khyams su dang khyams nas gnas khang du dang /
analyzed: dper na gshong nas thang la 'byung ba dang thang las gshong du 'bab pa dang / mngon par skabs yod pa nas thibs por 'jug pa dang / thibs po nas mngon par skabs yod par 'gro ba dang / gnas khang nas khyams su dang khyams nas gnas khang du dang /
translated: For example, it is like going from a valley to a plain, from a plain to a valley, from an open place to a dense place, from a dense place to an open place, from a house to a courtyard, from a courtyard to a house,

original: yang thog nas yang thog gzhan du 'dzeg pa dang yang thog nas yang thog gzhan du 'bab pa dang / khyams nas sgo khang du 'jug pa dang / sgo khang nas dang ra khyad khyud du 'gro ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: yang thog nas yang thog gzhan du 'dzeg pa dang yang thog nas yang thog gzhan du 'bab pa dang / khyams nas sgo khang du 'jug pa dang / sgo khang nas dang ra khyad khyud du 'gro ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: from one roof to another roof, from one roof to another roof, from a courtyard to a porch, from a porch to a courtyard, and so on.

original: nur ba la sogs pa 'di rnams kyis phyi bzhin 'brang ba dang nang byan byed pa dag mi snang bar gyur pa nyid gang yin pa de brkus pa yin par rig bar bya'o //
analyzed: nur ba la sogs pa 'di rnams kyis phyi bzhin 'brang ba dang nang byan byed pa dag mi snang bar gyur pa nyid gang yin pa de brkus pa yin par rig bar bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that these evasive actions and so on are theft when they are done in order to conceal the fact that one is being followed or is hiding something.

original: ji ltar yang 'gro bar bya ba nyid la yang gnas khang du zhugs pa dang / yang thog gzhan du 'dzeg pa dang khyams nas gnas khang la sogs pa byas pa nyid dam ma mthong ba'i mtha' ma nyid ni chom rkun pa la zhes bya ba byas nas so //
analyzed: ji ltar yang 'gro bar bya ba nyid la yang gnas khang du zhugs pa dang / yang thog gzhan du 'dzeg pa dang khyams nas gnas khang la sogs pa byas pa nyid dam ma mthong ba'i mtha' ma nyid ni chom rkun pa la zhes bya ba byas nas so //
translated: In the same way, one who is going to a place, having entered a house, or having climbed to another floor, or having gone from a courtyard to a house, and so on, is a thief if he does not see the boundary.

original: 'dir gzhung ni /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni /
translated: Here is the text:

original: ji ltar yang mkhan po dang slob dpon dag lam du zhugs par gyur pa de dag gis lhan cig gnas pa dang nye gnas dag gi lag tu chos gos dag gtad pa na de la de dag rku sems nye bar gnas par gyur cing de dag gom pa
analyzed: ji ltar yang mkhan po dang slob dpon dag lam du zhugs par gyur pa de dag gis lhan cig gnas pa dang nye gnas dag gi lag tu chos gos dag gtad pa na de la de dag rku sems nye bar gnas par gyur cing de dag gom pa
translated: ‚ÄúWhen preceptors and teachers who have set out on the road entrust their robes to their attendants and disciples, if the latter have a thieving attitude, then for each step they take

original: bsri bas 'gro zhing dal bus 'gron na gom pa re re la nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bsri bas 'gro zhing dal bus 'gron na gom pa re re la nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: to carry them off, they commit an offense of wrong conduct.

original: ji srid du mig sngar snang bar gyur pa de srid du nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji srid du mig sngar snang bar gyur pa de srid du nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro //
translated: As long as they are in sight, they commit a serious offense.

original: mig sngar snang bar ma gyur na brkus par brjod par bya ste rin thang brtsi bar bya'o //
analyzed: mig sngar snang bar ma gyur na brkus par brjod par bya ste rin thang brtsi bar bya'o //
translated: If they are no longer in sight, it is called theft and the value of the robes should be assessed.‚Äù

original: de rnams ni gshong nas thang la 'byung bar byed pa dang / thang las gshong du 'jug par byed pa dang / mngon par skabs yod pa nas thibs por 'jug pa dang / thibs po nas mngon par skabs yod par 'gro ba dang ji srid du mig @77a * //üîΩsngar snang bar gyur pa de srid du snga ma bzhin du ji ltar yang de rnams dang lhan cig gnas pa dang / nye gnas dag la mkhan po dang slob dpon rnams kyi chos gos dag khur bar byed pa der de la rku sems nye bar gnas par gyur cing /
analyzed: de rnams ni gshong nas thang la 'byung bar byed pa dang / thang las gshong du 'jug par byed pa dang / mngon par skabs yod pa nas thibs por 'jug pa dang / thibs po nas mngon par skabs yod par 'gro ba dang ji srid du mig @77a * // sngar snang bar gyur pa de srid du snga ma bzhin du ji ltar yang de rnams dang lhan cig gnas pa dang / nye gnas dag la mkhan po dang slob dpon rnams kyi chos gos dag khur bar byed pa der de la rku sems nye bar gnas par gyur cing /
translated: They are: taking from a depression to a plain, taking from a plain to a depression, taking from an open place to a concealed place, taking from a concealed place to an open place, and taking from where it was previously seen to where it was not previously seen.üîΩAs before, they take the robes of the preceptors and instructors from where they were previously seen to where they were not previously seen.

original: de rnams gnas khang nas khyams su 'gro zhing /
analyzed: de rnams gnas khang nas khyams su 'gro zhing /
translated: They take the robes from where they were previously seen to where they were not previously seen.

original: khyams nas gnas khang du zhugs par byed pa dang / 'og khang nas yang thog du 'dzeg par byed pa dang / yang thog nas 'og du 'jug par byed pa dang / khyams nas sgo khang du 'jug pa dang / sgo khang nas dang ra khyad khyud du 'byung ba dang /
analyzed: khyams nas gnas khang du zhugs par byed pa dang / 'og khang nas yang thog du 'dzeg par byed pa dang / yang thog nas 'og du 'jug par byed pa dang / khyams nas sgo khang du 'jug pa dang / sgo khang nas dang ra khyad khyud du 'byung ba dang /
translated: Entering a house from a courtyard, climbing to an upper floor from the ground floor, descending from an upper floor, entering a doorway from a courtyard, emerging from a doorway into a courtyard,

original: ji srid du mig sngar snang bar gyur pa de srid du snga ma bzhin du 'dir gang zhig nur ba dang / 'byangs pa dang 'byam pa dang / 'jug pa dang / gnas gzhan du 'dzeg pa las gzhan 'byam pa zhes bya ba gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: ji srid du mig sngar snang bar gyur pa de srid du snga ma bzhin du 'dir gang zhig nur ba dang / 'byangs pa dang 'byam pa dang / 'jug pa dang / gnas gzhan du 'dzeg pa las gzhan 'byam pa zhes bya ba gsungs pa yin no //
translated: and as long as it is visible, moving, running, and entering, and moving elsewhere, which is called ‚Äúmoving.‚Äù

original: rku bar byed ces bya ba 'dir rku ba ni nye bar rku ba'o //
analyzed: rku bar byed ces bya ba 'dir rku ba ni nye bar rku ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúStealing‚Äù means appropriating.

original: gru ni skams dang yur po che dang chu 'dal ba dag gis zhes bya ba ni gru ni skams la sogs pa rnams kyis rku ba la mi snang ba nyid ni rku ba ste /
analyzed: gru ni skams dang yur po che dang chu 'dal ba dag gis zhes bya ba ni gru ni skams la sogs pa rnams kyis rku ba la mi snang ba nyid ni rku ba ste /
translated: ‚ÄúA boat‚Äù means on dry land, in a canal, or in a river. ‚ÄúStealing‚Äù means appropriating a boat on dry land, etc., without being seen.

original: rnam par mi gnas pa'i rgyu ba rigs su 'byung ba nyid kyi phyir gru la 'di gnas gzhan du 'pho ba rnam par gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par mi gnas pa'i rgyu ba rigs su 'byung ba nyid kyi phyir gru la 'di gnas gzhan du 'pho ba rnam par gnas pa yin no //
translated: Because of the non-fixed movement of the current, the boat is said to be ‚Äúmoving in a stream.‚Äù

original: 'dir gru ni dpe tsam ste /
analyzed: 'dir gru ni dpe tsam ste /
translated: Here, the boat is merely an example.

original: sems med pa chu la rgyu ba'i gzings la yang cho ga 'di ni shing dang snod la sogs pa'i rang bzhin thams cad la'o //
analyzed: sems med pa chu la rgyu ba'i gzings la yang cho ga 'di ni shing dang snod la sogs pa'i rang bzhin thams cad la'o //
translated: This rule applies to all things that are carried by the current, such as wood, pots, and so on.

original: rgyun phyogs kyis so zhes bya ba ni de ltar yang rku ba nyid ni 'dir rku ba'o //
analyzed: rgyun phyogs kyis so zhes bya ba ni de ltar yang rku ba nyid ni 'dir rku ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn the direction of the current‚Äù means that the current is moving in that direction.

original: thad kar yang pha rol gyi 'gram du mi snang bar gyur na'o zhes bya ba ni thad ka'i pha rol gyi 'gram de mi snang bar gyur na /
analyzed: thad kar yang pha rol gyi 'gram du mi snang bar gyur na'o zhes bya ba ni thad ka'i pha rol gyi 'gram de mi snang bar gyur na /
translated: ‚ÄúEven if it does not appear at the other shore‚Äù means that if the other shore does not appear,

original: de'i tshe mi snang ba 'di nyid rku ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i tshe mi snang ba 'di nyid rku ba yin no //
translated: at that time, the non-appearance itself is the theft.

original: de las gzhan pa nyid la ni der phyin na'o zhes bya ba ni pha rol gyi 'gram de mi snang ba nyid la pha rol gyi 'gram thob pa ni brkus pa'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa nyid la ni der phyin na'o zhes bya ba ni pha rol gyi 'gram de mi snang ba nyid la pha rol gyi 'gram thob pa ni brkus pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIf it is different from that, then it is when it reaches there‚Äù means that if the other shore does not appear, and the other shore is reached, then the other shore is stolen.

original: rgyun las bzlog pa la ni gru tshugs las 'das na'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rgyun las bzlog pa la ni gru tshugs las 'das na'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: When the current is reversed, it is when the boat is stopped.

original: rgyun las bzlog pa brkus pa la ni gru tshugs las 'das pa na brkus pa'o //
analyzed: rgyun las bzlog pa brkus pa la ni gru tshugs las 'das pa na brkus pa'o //
translated: When the current is reversed, the stealing is when the boat is stopped.

original: rgyun las bzlog pa'i phyir 'di la rgyu ba nyid yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rgyun las bzlog pa'i phyir 'di la rgyu ba nyid yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Because the current is reversed, there is no movement here.

original: gru'i 'gro ba'i rkyen las bzlog pa la mthun par mi 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gru'i 'gro ba'i rkyen las bzlog pa la mthun par mi 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the condition for the boat's movement is reversed, it does not move in accordance with the current.

original: thang la rgyu ba'i 'gram gyi rnam par yang dag par rgyu ba nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: thang la rgyu ba'i 'gram gyi rnam par yang dag par rgyu ba nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: It does not move on the shore like something moving on land.

original: de bas na gnas gzhan du 'pho ba'i bdag nyid can la 'dir rku ba'i rnam par gzhag @77b pa'o ;
analyzed: de bas na gnas gzhan du 'pho ba'i bdag nyid can la 'dir rku ba'i rnam par gzhag @77b pa'o ;
translated: Therefore, it is established here as stealing when it has the nature of moving to another place.

original: / gru tshugs las gnas pa nyid la'o //üîΩ'di la yongs su 'gro bar byed pa'i spyod yul du ma gyur pa nyid kyis ma lus pa'i gnas de zhes bya ba 'di shes pa'o //
analyzed: / gru tshugs las gnas pa nyid la'o // 'di la yongs su 'gro bar byed pa'i spyod yul du ma gyur pa nyid kyis ma lus pa'i gnas de zhes bya ba 'di shes pa'o //
translated: When the boat is stopped, it is when the boat is stopped.üîΩHere, it is understood that the place is called that place because it is not the domain of those who go all around.

original: gra tshugs pa med pa la 'di'i gnas bzung ba tsam yin te zhes bya ba rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: gra tshugs pa med pa la 'di'i gnas bzung ba tsam yin te zhes bya ba rtogs par bya'o //
translated: When there is no stopping of the boat, it is understood that the place is merely occupied by it.

original: gzhan gyi las kyi mtha' dag la chu gtong ba'am 'gog pa la ni rang gi las kyi mtha' grub pa'i skyed ma gtogs pa de'i ched du der 'dun pas gzhan du gyur na'o zhes bya ba ni gtong ba'am 'gog pa la'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi las kyi mtha' dag la chu gtong ba'am 'gog pa la ni rang gi las kyi mtha' grub pa'i skyed ma gtogs pa de'i ched du der 'dun pas gzhan du gyur na'o zhes bya ba ni gtong ba'am 'gog pa la'o //
translated: As for the other's entire action, the giving of water or the stopping of it, it is the other's action for the sake of one's own action, except for the mother's production, when one has the intention to go there.

original: de'i ched du zhes bya ba ni rang gi las kyi mtha' grub pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: de'i ched du zhes bya ba ni rang gi las kyi mtha' grub pa'i don du'o //
translated: For the sake of that means for the sake of accomplishing one's own action.

original: skyed ma gtogs pa zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i khyad par ro //
analyzed: skyed ma gtogs pa zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i khyad par ro //
translated: Except for the mother's production is a special accomplishment.

original: skyed ma gtogs pa'i grub pa ni rku ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: skyed ma gtogs pa'i grub pa ni rku ba zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The accomplishment except for the mother's production is called stealing.

original: ci'i phyir skyed ma gtogs pa zhes bya ba'i khyad par bstan pa'i don du cig shos zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: ci'i phyir skyed ma gtogs pa zhes bya ba'i khyad par bstan pa'i don du cig shos zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Why is the distinction except for the mother's production taught? For the sake of the meaning of the term the other.

original: grub pa las cig shos gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: grub pa las cig shos gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is that which is other than the accomplishment.

original: pham pa 'di ci yin pa dang pham pa 'di gang yin pa ste zhes bya ba'i rten 'di la brten pa'i don du gzhan gyi las kyi mtha' zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: pham pa 'di ci yin pa dang pham pa 'di gang yin pa ste zhes bya ba'i rten 'di la brten pa'i don du gzhan gyi las kyi mtha' zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: What is this defeat? What is this defeat? For the sake of the meaning of this basis, the other's action is mentioned.

original: dgos pa ci lta bus gzhan gyi las kyi mtha' la pham pa yod pa la rang gi las kyi mtha' grub pa rku ba zhes bya ba der 'dun pas zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: dgos pa ci lta bus gzhan gyi las kyi mtha' la pham pa yod pa la rang gi las kyi mtha' grub pa rku ba zhes bya ba der 'dun pas zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: What is the purpose? When the livelihood of others is ruined, one‚Äôs own livelihood is established. ‚ÄúWith the intention of stealing‚Äù refers to the thought:

original: gzhan gyi phung bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi phung bya'o //
translated: ‚ÄúI will destroy the livelihood of others.

original: bdag gi grub par bya'o snyam pas bsam pa 'dis so //üîΩbsam pa tsam nyid kyis gzhan gyi phung bar yod par gyur pa dang rang la grub pa rku ba chu btang ba 'am 'gags pa las zhes bya ba smos te /üîΩgal te rang gi las rnams 'jug pa dgag pa la chu yod par 'gyur ba dang / gzhan gyi las kyi mtha' rnams la chu gtong ba la chu yod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag gi grub par bya'o snyam pas bsam pa 'dis so // bsam pa tsam nyid kyis gzhan gyi phung bar yod par gyur pa dang rang la grub pa rku ba chu btang ba 'am 'gags pa las zhes bya ba smos te / gal te rang gi las rnams 'jug pa dgag pa la chu yod par 'gyur ba dang / gzhan gyi las kyi mtha' rnams la chu gtong ba la chu yod par 'gyur ro //
translated: I will establish my own livelihood.‚ÄùüîΩ‚ÄúMerely by the intention‚Äù means that the livelihood of others is ruined and one‚Äôs own livelihood is established by that thought alone. ‚ÄúBy diverting water or obstructing it‚Äù means:üîΩIf one‚Äôs own livelihood is established by diverting water to it, and the livelihood of others is ruined by obstructing water from it,

original: 'on te chu dkon par gyur na rang gi las kyi mtha' rnams la chu btang ba dang / gzhan gyi las kyi mtha' rnams las 'gog par byas pa la gzhan gyis phung bar byas pa'i bsam pas byed la /
analyzed: 'on te chu dkon par gyur na rang gi las kyi mtha' rnams la chu btang ba dang / gzhan gyi las kyi mtha' rnams las 'gog par byas pa la gzhan gyis phung bar byas pa'i bsam pas byed la /
translated: or if one‚Äôs own livelihood is established by obstructing water from it, and the livelihood of others is ruined by diverting water to it,

original: gang gi las kyi mtha' grub cing brkus pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang gi las kyi mtha' grub cing brkus pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúhaving completed the action‚Äù is having stolen.

original: rgyun phyogs su 'gro ba la yang chu btang ba dang bkag pa 'di dag las kyi mthar 'gro ba la gtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: rgyun phyogs su 'gro ba la yang chu btang ba dang bkag pa 'di dag las kyi mthar 'gro ba la gtogs par bya'o //
translated: This rule about releasing water and stopping one‚Äôs own work applies to going with the flow of a river.

original: 'dir 'bru phun sum tshogs pa la rku bar gyur pa nyid du gnas pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir 'bru phun sum tshogs pa la rku bar gyur pa nyid du gnas pa'o //
translated: Here, the perfection of grain is the basis of the offense of stealing.

original: chu gtong bar byed pa'am rang gi las kyi mtha' 'gog pa la rku bar mi byed par thal ba ma yin no //
analyzed: chu gtong bar byed pa'am rang gi las kyi mtha' 'gog pa la rku bar mi byed par thal ba ma yin no //
translated: It is not the case that releasing water or stopping one‚Äôs own work is not stealing.

original: rang 'dod pa dang gzhan la nyams pa med par gyur pa la cung zad @78a * //
analyzed: rang 'dod pa dang gzhan la nyams pa med par gyur pa la cung zad @78a * //
translated: If one does not steal, there is no loss to oneself or to others.üîΩHaving ascertained this, one should not steal.

original: brkus par 'gyur ba ma yin zhes bya ba rnam par nges nas de la grub pa dang gzhan la phung ba zhes bya ba yang gzhan phung ba la yang dag par brtan pa'i gzhung la brten nas cig shos zhes bya ba byas te chad pa'i sems med par
analyzed: brkus par 'gyur ba ma yin zhes bya ba rnam par nges nas de la grub pa dang gzhan la phung ba zhes bya ba yang gzhan phung ba la yang dag par brtan pa'i gzhung la brten nas cig shos zhes bya ba byas te chad pa'i sems med par
translated: One should not steal with the thought of punishment or with the thought of the other, that is, with the thought of the other‚Äôs loss.

original: rku ba bskyed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rku ba bskyed pa ma yin no //
translated: One should not steal without the thought of punishment.

original: 'di yang 'di la chad pa gang zhig nyams pa zhes bya ba rnam par nges nas bdag la grub par gyur cig / gzhan la ni phung bar gyur cig ces bya ba gzhan par 'dod pa'i tshig la brten nas der 'dun pas zhes bya ba byas so //
analyzed: 'di yang 'di la chad pa gang zhig nyams pa zhes bya ba rnam par nges nas bdag la grub par gyur cig / gzhan la ni phung bar gyur cig ces bya ba gzhan par 'dod pa'i tshig la brten nas der 'dun pas zhes bya ba byas so //
translated: This is also a case of ‚Äúcutting off‚Äù and ‚Äúloss‚Äù that is determined, thinking, ‚ÄúMay I be successful and may others be ruined.‚ÄùüîΩ‚ÄúExcept for the one who is producing‚Äù is stated based on the statement of another who asserts, ‚ÄúI will do it.‚Äù

original: ji tsam du gzhan las gcod pa de tsam las rku ba nyid ces bya ba lta bar byas nas skyed ma gtogs zhes bya ba byas so //
analyzed: ji tsam du gzhan las gcod pa de tsam las rku ba nyid ces bya ba lta bar byas nas skyed ma gtogs zhes bya ba byas so //
translated: ‚ÄúExcept for the one who is producing‚Äù is stated because it is like the statement, ‚ÄúTo the extent that there is cutting off from another, to that extent there is stealing.‚Äù

original: gang zhig gzhan phung ba mi skyed pa'i zhing gi yon tan la sogs pas bsgrub par gyur pa de la rku ba nyid ma yin pa gtogs par bya'o //üîΩrkun po rnams la de'i ched du lam rgyus go bar byed pa la ni shas thob par byed na'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gang zhig gzhan phung ba mi skyed pa'i zhing gi yon tan la sogs pas bsgrub par gyur pa de la rku ba nyid ma yin pa gtogs par bya'o // rkun po rnams la de'i ched du lam rgyus go bar byed pa la ni shas thob par byed na'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: ‚ÄúExcept for the one who is producing‚Äù is stated because there is no stealing in the field of one who is not producing ruin for another, but who is producing virtue and so on.üîΩ‚ÄúExcept for the one who is giving a share‚Äù is stated because there is no stealing when one is giving a share to thieves for the purpose of that.

original: rku ba'i lam la brten pa'i lo rgyus ni lam rgyus te lam ga ge mo nas der 'gro bar bya'o //
analyzed: rku ba'i lam la brten pa'i lo rgyus ni lam rgyus te lam ga ge mo nas der 'gro bar bya'o //
translated: ‚ÄúPath of thieves‚Äù is the story of the path, the path by which one goes there.

original: de ltar 'jug par bya ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar 'jug par bya ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Thus, ‚Äúone should engage in this way‚Äù and so on.

original: de'i ched du zhes bya ba ni shas thob par bya ba'i ched du'o //
analyzed: de'i ched du zhes bya ba ni shas thob par bya ba'i ched du'o //
translated: ‚ÄúFor that purpose‚Äù means for the purpose of obtaining a share.

original: rkun po rnams la zhes bya ba ni chom rkun pa rnams la gal te rku ba'i don du lam rgyus go par byed pa'i las byas pa la de rnams kyi drung nas thob pa gang yin pa de ni shas brkus pa yin no //
analyzed: rkun po rnams la zhes bya ba ni chom rkun pa rnams la gal te rku ba'i don du lam rgyus go par byed pa'i las byas pa la de rnams kyi drung nas thob pa gang yin pa de ni shas brkus pa yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúFrom thieves‚Äù means that if one performs the action of inquiring about the road for the purpose of stealing, then whatever one obtains from them is a stolen share.

original: 'di ni rkun po las shas thob par bya ba'i phyir khas len pa yin te //
analyzed: 'di ni rkun po las shas thob par bya ba'i phyir khas len pa yin te //
translated: This is an admission of stealing a share from thieves.

original: rkun po rnams las brkus pa so sor bzung ba nyid do //
analyzed: rkun po rnams las brkus pa so sor bzung ba nyid do //
translated: It is the very act of stealing from thieves.

original: de'i phyir rkun po'i tshogs kyi khongs su gtogs pa nyid kyi phyir brkus pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i phyir rkun po'i tshogs kyi khongs su gtogs pa nyid kyi phyir brkus pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, it is stealing because it is included among the group of thieves.

original: bdag gi don du yang de las cha shas brku bar bya ba 'di la de'i don du rku ba'o //
analyzed: bdag gi don du yang de las cha shas brku bar bya ba 'di la de'i don du rku ba'o //
translated: Even for one‚Äôs own sake, one should not steal a share from them. This is stealing for one‚Äôs own sake.

original: thob pa 'di la bran gyis las dang 'dra ba nyid de 'dir ni mnyam por bya ba byed pa nyid kyis de las gzhan pa'i chom rkun bzhin du cha shas dang ldan pa nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: thob pa 'di la bran gyis las dang 'dra ba nyid de 'dir ni mnyam por bya ba byed pa nyid kyis de las gzhan pa'i chom rkun bzhin du cha shas dang ldan pa nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: The ground and the house are surrounded, and the boundary is crossed when the ground is stolen, etc.üîΩThe mind that is fixed on the idea of taking what is not given is the knowledge of stealing.üîΩIt is not the time of going.üîΩThe ground and the house are surrounded, and the boundary is crossed when the ground is stolen, etc.üîΩThe mind that is fixed on the idea of taking what is not given is the knowledge of stealing.üîΩIt is not the time of going.üîΩThe ground and the house are surrounded, and the boundary is crossed when the ground is stolen, etc.

original: nges par sbyor ba po nyid dang gtong ba po nyid kyi blo yang dag par gnas pa zhes bya ba thob pa la rku ba nyid shes pa yin te /
analyzed: nges par sbyor ba po nyid dang gtong ba po nyid kyi blo yang dag par gnas pa zhes bya ba thob pa la rku ba nyid shes pa yin te /
translated: The mind that is fixed on the idea of taking what is not given is the knowledge of stealing.

original: 'gro ba'i dus la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'gro ba'i dus la ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not the time of going.üîΩThe ground and the house are surrounded, and the boundary is crossed when the ground is stolen, etc.üîΩThe mind that is fixed on the idea of taking what is not given is the knowledge of stealing.üîΩIt is not the time of going.üîΩThe ground and the house are surrounded, and the boundary is crossed when the ground is stolen, etc.üîΩThe mind that is fixed on the idea of taking what is not given is the knowledge of stealing.üîΩIt is not the time of going.üîΩThe ground and the house are surrounded, and the boundary is crossed when the ground is stolen, etc.üîΩThe mind that is fixed on the idea of taking what is not given is the knowledge of stealing.üîΩIt is not the time of going.üîΩThe ground and the house are surrounded, and the boundary is crossed when the ground is stolen, etc.üîΩThe mind that is fixed on the idea of taking what is not given is the knowledge of stealing.üîΩIt is not the time of going.üîΩThe ground and the house are surrounded, and the boundary is crossed when the ground is stolen, etc.

original: sa gzhi dang khang khyim dag yongs su bskor bas ni mtshams 'byor na'o zhes bya ba ni rib ma dang rtsig pa la sogs pas yongs su bskor bas sa gzhi la sogs pa rku ba rib ma la sogs pa de las mtshams @78b 'byor na ni rku ba'o
analyzed: sa gzhi dang khang khyim dag yongs su bskor bas ni mtshams 'byor na'o zhes bya ba ni rib ma dang rtsig pa la sogs pas yongs su bskor bas sa gzhi la sogs pa rku ba rib ma la sogs pa de las mtshams @78b 'byor na ni rku ba'o
translated: The mind that is fixed on the idea of taking what is not given is the knowledge of stealing.üîΩIt is not the time of going.üîΩThe ground and the house are surrounded, and the boundary is crossed when the ground is stolen, etc.üîΩThe mind that is fixed on the idea of taking what is not given is the knowledge of stealing.

original: // 'dir nges par de'i tshe na nye bar bzung ba nyid kyi blo la yang dag par bstan pa la de rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: // 'dir nges par de'i tshe na nye bar bzung ba nyid kyi blo la yang dag par bstan pa la de rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: Here, the cognition that is definitely apprehended at that time is also correctly indicated as that consciousness.üîΩ

original: shags kyis gal te bla'i grar rgyal na'o //
analyzed: shags kyis gal te bla'i grar rgyal na'o //
translated: If he wins the lawsuit,

original: gal te 'og zur na pha rol po'i sbyor ba nyid btang na'o //
analyzed: gal te 'og zur na pha rol po'i sbyor ba nyid btang na'o //
translated: if the opponent abandons the suit.

original: de ni sbyor ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni gal te bla'i grar shags bkye ba ni shags kyis rku ba la rgyal ba ni brkus pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni sbyor ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni gal te bla'i grar shags bkye ba ni shags kyis rku ba la rgyal ba ni brkus pa yin no //
translated: This is the application: if he wins the lawsuit, he has stolen by means of the lawsuit.

original: gal te 'og zur na pha rol po'i sbyor ba pa nyid btang ba ni brkus pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te 'og zur na pha rol po'i sbyor ba pa nyid btang ba ni brkus pa yin no //
translated: If the opponent abandons the suit, he has stolen.

original: rgyal ba 'di la sbyor ba nyid yongs su rdzogs par gyur pa'i dngos po can la nyes pa sbom po'o //
analyzed: rgyal ba 'di la sbyor ba nyid yongs su rdzogs par gyur pa'i dngos po can la nyes pa sbom po'o //
translated: If the application is completed in this victory, the offense is a serious transgression.

original: gzhan du nyes byas zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzhan du nyes byas zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Otherwise, it is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: nges par 'dir so sor gsal ba nyid la gzhan la grub pa'i blo yang dag par gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: nges par 'dir so sor gsal ba nyid la gzhan la grub pa'i blo yang dag par gnas pa yin no //
translated: Certainly, here the individual is clearly understood, and the mind of another is not ascertained.

original: bla'i gral du gzhan la gsal ba nyid yod kyang mnga' bdag nyid kyi phyir rgyal po rten gyi ma nges pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bla'i gral du gzhan la gsal ba nyid yod kyang mnga' bdag nyid kyi phyir rgyal po rten gyi ma nges pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Even if the individual is clearly understood in the presence of another, the king is not the basis because he is the lord.

original: grub pa'i blo yang dag par gnas pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa yin no //
analyzed: grub pa'i blo yang dag par gnas pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa yin no //

The words ‚Äúwith basis‚Äù and ‚Äúwith origination‚Äù are added to the words ‚Äútransgression‚Äù and ‚Äúnon-transgression‚Äù in order to indicate that the transgression of stealing customs duties is a transgression that has a basis and origination.üîΩThe words ‚Äúwith basis‚Äù and ‚Äúwith origination‚Äù are added to the words ‚Äútransgression‚Äù and ‚Äúnon-transgression‚Äù in order to indicate that the transgression of stealing customs duties is a transgression that has a basis and origination.
