original: yin pa der tshong pa rnams 'dir rku ba byed pa nyid ma yin te sho gam pa'i sems bzung bar byas ba'i tshong pa de rnams las 'da' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yin pa der tshong pa rnams 'dir rku ba byed pa nyid ma yin te sho gam pa'i sems bzung bar byas ba'i tshong pa de rnams las 'da' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not that the merchants here are thieves, because they are merchants who have been allowed to pass by the customs officials.

original: gang gi phyir dge slong rnams la brkus pa nyid du mi 'gyur ba de'i phyir ltung ba med pa'i tshig rigs pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir dge slong rnams la brkus pa nyid du mi 'gyur ba de'i phyir ltung ba med pa'i tshig rigs pa yin no //
translated: Since the monks are not thieves, it is reasonable that there is no offense.

original: gang zhig yongs su spang ba ma thob pa'i dge slong gis dge slong gzhan la 'da' ba'i phyir snod sbyin pa der yang dge slong 'di yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig yongs su spang ba ma thob pa'i dge slong gis dge slong gzhan la 'da' ba'i phyir snod sbyin pa der yang dge slong 'di yin te /
translated: Also, when a monk who has not attained the abandonment of stealing gives a vessel to another monk in order to pass it on to him, that monk is not a thief.

original: 'di ni da ltar 'da' bar gyur pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni da ltar 'da' bar gyur pa ma yin te /
translated: He is not one who is passing it on at present.

original: ji ltar 'di la rku ba nyid 'byung par 'gyur zhes bya ba ltung ba ma yin pa'i rigs par gyur ba nyid de nges par 'dir 'di'i blo zhes bya brku ba nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji ltar 'di la rku ba nyid 'byung par 'gyur zhes bya ba ltung ba ma yin pa'i rigs par gyur ba nyid de nges par 'dir 'di'i blo zhes bya brku ba nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: How could there be stealing in this case? This is the reasoning that there is no offense. It is certain that in this case there is no stealing because of the absence of the intention to steal.

original: gang zhig spong ba thob pa rnams tshong pa rnams dang 'brel pa @79a * //
analyzed: gang zhig spong ba thob pa rnams tshong pa rnams dang 'brel pa @79a * //
translated: When those who have attained the abandonment of stealing are connected with merchants,

original: las 'da' bar byed pa der 'di rnams la gzhan gyi don du brkus pa nyid yod pa der rang gi spong ba thob pa 'di zhes bya ba rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: las 'da' bar byed pa der 'di rnams la gzhan gyi don du brkus pa nyid yod pa der rang gi spong ba thob pa 'di zhes bya ba rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is established that for those who do not transgress, there is no stealing for the sake of others, and they obtain their own abandonment.

original: de la 'di rnams la gang zhig ltung ba med par brjod pa der rku sems med par rgyu rnam par gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: de la 'di rnams la gang zhig ltung ba med par brjod pa der rku sems med par rgyu rnam par gnas pa yin te /
translated: In that case, for those who are said to be without downfalls, the cause of stealing is not present, because there is no thought of stealing.

original: 'di la 'di bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: 'di la 'di bsdus pa'o //
translated: This is included in that.

original: 'di ni bdag cag la gzhan gyi spong ba'i cha shas pas 'di rnams la rku sems kyis skabs ma gyur cig ces bya ba 'dir rig par bya'o //üîΩgang gis blangs pa nyid kyi snod las spyin par bya ba nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni gang gis blangs pa ni gang gis blangs pa ste /üîΩde'i dngos po ni gang gis blangs pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'di ni bdag cag la gzhan gyi spong ba'i cha shas pas 'di rnams la rku sems kyis skabs ma gyur cig ces bya ba 'dir rig par bya'o // gang gis blangs pa nyid kyi snod las spyin par bya ba nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni gang gis blangs pa ni gang gis blangs pa ste / de'i dngos po ni gang gis blangs pa nyid do //
translated: This should be understood here: ‚ÄúWe should not give an opportunity for a thought of stealing to arise for those who are part of our own abandonment.‚ÄùüîΩ‚ÄúIt is only the recipient who should pay the tax‚Äù means that the recipient should pay the tax.üîΩThe state of being a recipient is the state of being a recipient.

original: gang gis dngos po bzung ba sho gam de la sbyin pa nyid do //
analyzed: gang gis dngos po bzung ba sho gam de la sbyin pa nyid do //
translated: The tax is paid to the one who takes the goods.

original: gang zhig 'dir 'da' bar byed pa gnyis ni skyon med pa dang ldan pa gang gis dngos po blangs pa de sho gam ma sbyin pa nyid du gyur pa la /
analyzed: gang zhig 'dir 'da' bar byed pa gnyis ni skyon med pa dang ldan pa gang gis dngos po blangs pa de sho gam ma sbyin pa nyid du gyur pa la /
translated: The two who do this are the one who is without fault and the one who is not without fault. The one who is without fault takes possession of the object without paying the toll.

original: 'di gnyis la skyon med pa nyid du rigs pa yin te zhes bya ba 'di shes pa'o //
analyzed: 'di gnyis la skyon med pa nyid du rigs pa yin te zhes bya ba 'di shes pa'o //
translated: It is understood that it is reasonable that these two are without fault.

original: gnang ba las gzhan gyis bzlas na ma brkus pa yin no zhes bya ba la //
analyzed: gnang ba las gzhan gyis bzlas na ma brkus pa yin no zhes bya ba la //
translated: If one steals by other means than permission, it is not stealing.

original: gnang ba ni spong ba thob pa'o //
analyzed: gnang ba ni spong ba thob pa'o //
translated: Permission is the attainment of the relinquishment of stealing.

original: de la gzhan gyi nor la de byas pa'i 'da' bar byed pa gang yin pa 'di ni de'i cha'i phyir ma ba rkus pa yin no //
analyzed: de la gzhan gyi nor la de byas pa'i 'da' bar byed pa gang yin pa 'di ni de'i cha'i phyir ma ba rkus pa yin no //
translated: If one steals another's property by other means than permission, it is stealing because it is a part of that.

original: gang zhig 'di sho gam ma byin pa zhes bya ba spang ba sbyin pa rang gi cha so sor thob pa ste gzhan gyi ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang zhig 'di sho gam ma byin pa zhes bya ba spang ba sbyin pa rang gi cha so sor thob pa ste gzhan gyi ni ma yin no //
translated: If one steals by other means than permission, it is not stealing.

original: de bas na skyon 'di 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: de bas na skyon 'di 'byung ba ste /
translated: Therefore, this fault arises.

original: tshong pa dang 'brel pa'i 'da' bar byed pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: tshong pa dang 'brel pa'i 'da' bar byed pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the one who steals by other means than permission who is related to the merchant.

original: slar dge slong gis sa la rnyed pa'i sho gam 'da' bar byed pa ste dge slong gis sa la rnyed pa'i sho gam 'da' bar byed na 'gal tshabs can du 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa la bsdu ba ni 'di yin no //
analyzed: slar dge slong gis sa la rnyed pa'i sho gam 'da' bar byed pa ste dge slong gis sa la rnyed pa'i sho gam 'da' bar byed na 'gal tshabs can du 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa la bsdu ba ni 'di yin no //
translated: If a monk passes through a tollgate with goods found on the ground, he commits an offense.üîΩ The summary is this:

original: dngos po ji ltar ltung ba la 'gal tshabs can zhes bya ba gsungs pa'i tshig kyang gzhi ji lta ba las 'byung ba yin gyi nyes byas nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po ji ltar ltung ba la 'gal tshabs can zhes bya ba gsungs pa'i tshig kyang gzhi ji lta ba las 'byung ba yin gyi nyes byas nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: It is said, If an object falls, it is called an offense, and the words that appear in the text are not just a minor offense.

original: 'di ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: 'di ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: nye ba 'khor gyis zhus pa las 'dir sbom po'i ltung ba la brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nye ba 'khor gyis zhus pa las 'dir sbom po'i ltung ba la brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because in the UpƒÅliparip·πõcchƒÅ, it is stated as a serious downfall here.

original: btsun pa re zhig tshong pa rnams sho gam gyi phyir sho gam la nye bar brten pa'i dngos bo ni sa la yang dag par rnyed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: btsun pa re zhig tshong pa rnams sho gam gyi phyir sho gam la nye bar brten pa'i dngos bo ni sa la yang dag par rnyed par 'gyur te /
translated: Venerable, if merchants are paying a toll, the goods that are placed on the ground for the toll

original: dge slong la tshong pas 'di skad ces smras te /
analyzed: dge slong la tshong pas 'di skad ces smras te /
translated: are said by the merchants to the monk, This is not ours.

original: 'phags pa byin cig sho gam gyi sa las 'da' bar byas nas dge slong gis de las 'da' bar byed na sho gam @79b 'joms pa ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa byin cig sho gam gyi sa las 'da' bar byas nas dge slong gis de las 'da' bar byed na sho gam @79b 'joms pa ste /
translated: If a monk causes a noble one to pass beyond the tollgate without paying the toll, he commits a defeat.

original: de la ma sha ka lnga'i rin thang 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la ma sha ka lnga'i rin thang 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: The value of five mƒÅsakas is to be paid in this case.

original: spom po'i ltung ba la ltung pa bar 'gyur zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: spom po'i ltung ba la ltung pa bar 'gyur zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is the downfall that is a serious violation.

original: spang ba thob ba'i dge slong gi dbang du mdzad nas 'di gsungs pa rnam par gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: spang ba thob ba'i dge slong gi dbang du mdzad nas 'di gsungs pa rnam par gnas pa yin te /
translated: This is stated from the perspective of a monk who has obtained renunciation.

original: gzhan gyis rig pa sho ga pa rnams kyis 'da' bar bya ba'i phyir mi nus pa nyid kyis brku ba nyid tshong pa rnams nyid la shin tu bya sla ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyis rig pa sho ga pa rnams kyis 'da' bar bya ba'i phyir mi nus pa nyid kyis brku ba nyid tshong pa rnams nyid la shin tu bya sla ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: It is not possible for others to pass beyond the tollgate without paying the toll, and stealing is very easy for merchants to do.

original: rang gi bya ba ma yin pa'i dbang du byas nas spom po 'di brjod par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rang gi bya ba ma yin pa'i dbang du byas nas spom po 'di brjod par rig par bya'o //
translated: This serious violation should be understood to be stated from the perspective of not doing one‚Äôs own work.

original: ma gnang bas gzhan gyis 'da' bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni cho ga yang dag par byas pa gzhan gyis sho gam rang gis sho gam gyi bya ba las 'da' bar bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: ma gnang bas gzhan gyis 'da' bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni cho ga yang dag par byas pa gzhan gyis sho gam rang gis sho gam gyi bya ba las 'da' bar bya ba ma yin no //
translated: This means that others who have properly performed the rite should not transgress the duty of paying the toll.

original: tshong pa rnams kyis 'da' bar byed pas kyang slar dge slong gi sar phyin pa'i sho gam 'da' bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: tshong pa rnams kyis 'da' bar byed pas kyang slar dge slong gi sar phyin pa'i sho gam 'da' bar byed pa ste /
translated: But if the merchants do transgress, then the duty of paying the toll is transgressed by the monks.

original: dge slong gi sar phyin pa'i sho gam 'da' bar byed na 'gal tshabs can du 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa de'i don bsdu ba'i phyir mdo 'di byas so ;
analyzed: dge slong gi sar phyin pa'i sho gam 'da' bar byed na 'gal tshabs can du 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa de'i don bsdu ba'i phyir mdo 'di byas so ;
translated: This s≈´tra is composed in order to summarize the statement: ‚ÄúIf the duty of paying the toll is transgressed by the monks, they become guilty of an offense.‚Äù

original: / rku ba la gnas pa'i skyon gyis skyon dang bral ba nyid du gyur pa la 'di yin te /
analyzed: / rku ba la gnas pa'i skyon gyis skyon dang bral ba nyid du gyur pa la 'di yin te /
translated: This is the fault of the monk who is guilty of theft, because he is not free from that fault.

original: de bas na bslab pa gzhan la 'di rab tu btags pa nyid do //
analyzed: de bas na bslab pa gzhan la 'di rab tu btags pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, this is the most serious of the other precepts.

original: rab tu btags pa 'di na slar ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: rab tu btags pa 'di na slar ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this precept the most serious?

original: rku ba'i rnam pa nyid kyis 'di 'jig rten na kha zer bar 'gyur ba'i skyon nyid kyis gzhan du yang gzhan gyis 'da' bar bya ba ma yin zhes bya ba 'di'i rjes su 'brang bas rtogs par bya'o //üîΩma tshor bar 'da' bar byed pa mi grub par bya ba'i phyir mi 'bad par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni 'da' bar bya ba grub pa nyid kyis 'di ni gzhan gyis sam bdag nyid rang nyid kyis sam /
analyzed: rku ba'i rnam pa nyid kyis 'di 'jig rten na kha zer bar 'gyur ba'i skyon nyid kyis gzhan du yang gzhan gyis 'da' bar bya ba ma yin zhes bya ba 'di'i rjes su 'brang bas rtogs par bya'o // ma tshor bar 'da' bar byed pa mi grub par bya ba'i phyir mi 'bad par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni 'da' bar bya ba grub pa nyid kyis 'di ni gzhan gyis sam bdag nyid rang nyid kyis sam /
translated: The fault of being criticized in the world by the very form of stealing is the reason why it should not be transgressed by others is understood by implication.

original: gzhan gyi yang dag par rig pa las 'da' bar byed pa ser sna la sogs pa zhes bya ba 'di'i don tu mi 'bad par mi bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi yang dag par rig pa las 'da' bar byed pa ser sna la sogs pa zhes bya ba 'di'i don tu mi 'bad par mi bya'o //
translated: In order to establish that it is not to be transgressed without effort, one should not be without effort means that by the very establishment of the transgression, this is understood by implication as the meaning of it should not be transgressed by others or by oneself, or it should not be transgressed by the correct knowledge of others, or it should not be transgressed by stinginess and so on.

original: 'di ltar 'da' bar byed pa la rku ba'i rnam pa nyid dang / skyon nyid kyis srid pa'i skabs yod pa yin te zhes bya ba 'di rnams ni btags pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'da' bar byed pa la rku ba'i rnam pa nyid dang / skyon nyid kyis srid pa'i skabs yod pa yin te zhes bya ba 'di rnams ni btags pa'o //
translated: Thus, it is possible that there is an occasion for the transgression by the very form of stealing and the fault are the imputations.

original: ji ltar yang mi 'bad par mi bya zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar yang mi 'bad par mi bya zhe na /
translated: How is it that one should not be without effort?

original: de'i phyir srung ma dge slong du ma gzhag par bya'o zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir srung ma dge slong du ma gzhag par bya'o zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, it is said: ‚ÄúOne should not appoint many monks as protectors.‚Äù

original: srung ma ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: srung ma ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What kind of protectors?

original: dge slong zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: dge slong zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: It says: ‚Äúmonks.‚Äù

original: grangs ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: grangs ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: How many?

original: de'i phyir du ma zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir du ma zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it says: ‚Äúmany.‚Äù

original: gnyis yan chad nas brtsams te bsrungs pa'i phyir ji snyed kyis don grub pa de snyed gzhag go zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gnyis yan chad nas brtsams te bsrungs pa'i phyir ji snyed kyis don grub pa de snyed gzhag go zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that one should appoint as many as are necessary to accomplish the purpose, beginning with two or more, because they are appointed as protectors.

original: @80a * // de'i zan bskyal bar bya ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni srung bar byed pa de'i zan ni de'i zan te de'o //
analyzed: @80a * // de'i zan bskyal bar bya ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni srung bar byed pa de'i zan ni de'i zan te de'o //
translated: It is said: ‚ÄúOne should deliver food to him.‚Äù The food of that protector is his food.

original: de'i bskyal bar bya ba nyid de 'di ni nges pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i bskyal bar bya ba nyid de 'di ni nges pa ma yin no //
translated: It is to be delivered to him. This is not definite.

original: des na 'dir 'jug pa gang yin pa de la rtogs pa nyid ma yin pa shes par bya zhes bya ba'i don du 'di brjod pa'o //
analyzed: des na 'dir 'jug pa gang yin pa de la rtogs pa nyid ma yin pa shes par bya zhes bya ba'i don du 'di brjod pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is said here: ‚ÄúOne should understand that whatever is engaged in by him is not to be understood.‚Äù

original: des bzlog par bya'o zhes bya ba ni srung ba'i dge slong gzhag pas so //
analyzed: des bzlog par bya'o zhes bya ba ni srung ba'i dge slong gzhag pas so //
translated: It is said: ‚ÄúOne should turn him back.‚Äù By appointing a monk as a protector.

original: bcug pa nyid brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni des zhes bya bar rjes su 'brel to //
analyzed: bcug pa nyid brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni des zhes bya bar rjes su 'brel to //
translated: The one who is to be placed should be mentioned.

original: gang rnams kyis gzhag pa de rnams la zhes bya ba don gyis grub pa ste gzhag pa la de'i don nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: gang rnams kyis gzhag pa de rnams la zhes bya ba don gyis grub pa ste gzhag pa la de'i don nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: By whom they are placed, they are to be placed by those who are to be placed.

original: med na mtshan ma gdab po zhes bya ba ni srung ma med na bsod snyoms la sogs pa la yang 'gro ba'i don du 'gro bar byed cing rang gi snod dag la mtshan ma gdab par bya'o //
analyzed: med na mtshan ma gdab po zhes bya ba ni srung ma med na bsod snyoms la sogs pa la yang 'gro ba'i don du 'gro bar byed cing rang gi snod dag la mtshan ma gdab par bya'o //
translated: If there is none, a sign should be made. If there is no protector, one should go for the sake of going for alms, etc., and make a sign on one‚Äôs own vessels.

original: bsod snyoms kyi phyir zhugs pa la sho gam gzhal dogs pa la las mi phyung ba mi bcug par bya zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bsod snyoms kyi phyir zhugs pa la sho gam gzhal dogs pa la las mi phyung ba mi bcug par bya zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: One should not make a person who is suspected of being charged a duty on entering for alms, etc., go out.

original: khyer te 'ongs ba la dri bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyis gang yang rung ba sho gam du bya ba ma yin pa'i dngos po la sho gam gyi gnas nas 'da' bar byed pa'i don du khyer te 'ongs pa la sho gam gzhal dgos pa'i rdzas
analyzed: khyer te 'ongs ba la dri bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyis gang yang rung ba sho gam du bya ba ma yin pa'i dngos po la sho gam gyi gnas nas 'da' bar byed pa'i don du khyer te 'ongs pa la sho gam gzhal dgos pa'i rdzas
translated: One should ask about what is brought in. If another person is bringing in some object that is not to be charged a duty, for the sake of passing through the place where duties are collected, one should ask about the object that is to be charged a duty.

original: cung zad med dam zhes bya ba 'di dri bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩgzhan gyis dor ba mi 'grub na reg pa nyid du bya'o zhes bya ba ni gser la sogs pa reg par bya ba ma yin pa la gzhan gyis de'i gtur bu la sogs pa'i nang du bcug pa la rang gis rig par ma byas na dor ba dbyung
analyzed: cung zad med dam zhes bya ba 'di dri bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to // gzhan gyis dor ba mi 'grub na reg pa nyid du bya'o zhes bya ba ni gser la sogs pa reg par bya ba ma yin pa la gzhan gyis de'i gtur bu la sogs pa'i nang du bcug pa la rang gis rig par ma byas na dor ba dbyung
translated: One should ask, Is it nothing at all?üîΩ If it is not established that it is discarded by another, it should be touched.

original: bar mi 'grub na de'i tshe dbyung ba'i ched du rang nyid kyis reg pa nyid du byas te de la ni ltung bar byed pa 'ga' zhig tu 'gyur ba bag yongs su gnang ngo //üîΩma phul yang nges pa skyes na phul ba nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni ma la sogs pa rnams la bdag gis 'di sbyin pa zhes bya ba gang zhig 'di rdzas nges par byas nas bzung ba ma phul ba'i rdzas de la yang phul ba nyid kho
analyzed: bar mi 'grub na de'i tshe dbyung ba'i ched du rang nyid kyis reg pa nyid du byas te de la ni ltung bar byed pa 'ga' zhig tu 'gyur ba bag yongs su gnang ngo // ma phul yang nges pa skyes na phul ba nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni ma la sogs pa rnams la bdag gis 'di sbyin pa zhes bya ba gang zhig 'di rdzas nges par byas nas bzung ba ma phul ba'i rdzas de la yang phul ba nyid kho
translated: If it is not established that it is discarded by another, then for the purpose of discarding it, one should touch it oneself. In this case, one is permitted to be negligent about any fall.üîΩIf it is not given, but certainty arises, it is considered given.

original: na shes par bya'o //
analyzed: na shes par bya'o //
translated: If it is not given to one's mother and so on, thinking 'I give this to them,' then even that substance which is not given, having been determined and taken by them, should be known as given.

original: gang la phul ba yin pa des ma bzung ba zhes bya ba byas te /
analyzed: gang la phul ba yin pa des ma bzung ba zhes bya ba byas te /
translated: It is called ‚Äúnot taken by the one to whom it is offered.‚Äù

original: gang gis de'i lag pa la de dang 'brel ba nyid shes par bya ba'i don dang de dang 'dra ba'i sho gam gyi bya ba 'da' bar byed pa la gzhan gyi don du rku ba la skyon te de ltung ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang gis de'i lag pa la de dang 'brel ba nyid shes par bya ba'i don dang de dang 'dra ba'i sho gam gyi bya ba 'da' bar byed pa la gzhan gyi don du rku ba la skyon te de ltung ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúthat which is to be known by the one whose hand is connected with it‚Äù is the act of passing the duty of the customs fee, which is like that. The fault in stealing for the sake of another is called ‚Äúa downfall.‚Äù

original: de dag gis rdzas gnang bar bya ba'i phyir pha ma'i bsngags pa @80b brjod do zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de dag gis rdzas gnang bar bya ba'i phyir pha ma'i bsngags pa @80b brjod do zhes bya ba la /
translated: They praise their parents in order to obtain goods.

original: pha ma zhes bya ba ni pha ma dag la'o //
analyzed: pha ma zhes bya ba ni pha ma dag la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúParents‚Äù refers to one‚Äôs own parents.

original: pha ma dag gi ched du bkur ba'i rdzas ni pha ma dag la bsngags pa brjod par bya ba ste /
analyzed: pha ma dag gi ched du bkur ba'i rdzas ni pha ma dag la bsngags pa brjod par bya ba ste /
translated: Goods that are to be honored for the sake of one‚Äôs parents are to be praised in front of one‚Äôs parents.

original: 'di'i don du sho gam pa rnams kyi drung du 'di dag gi yon tan brjod pa gang yin pa de ni brjod ba tsam don du gnyer ba zhes bya ba yongs su brtags nas skyon dang ldan pa shes par bya zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'di'i don du sho gam pa rnams kyi drung du 'di dag gi yon tan brjod pa gang yin pa de ni brjod ba tsam don du gnyer ba zhes bya ba yongs su brtags nas skyon dang ldan pa shes par bya zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of this is that the praise of their good qualities in front of the customs officials for their sake is called ‚Äúseeking praise for the sake of this.‚Äù It is to be understood that this is faulty, having been imagined.

original: dkon mchog rnams kyi yang ngo zhas bya ba ni sangs rgyas dang chos dang / dge 'dun rnams la de dag gis rdzas gnang bar bya ba'i phyir yang dag par bsngags pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dkon mchog rnams kyi yang ngo zhas bya ba ni sangs rgyas dang chos dang / dge 'dun rnams la de dag gis rdzas gnang bar bya ba'i phyir yang dag par bsngags pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The honorable ones are the Buddha, Dharma, and Sa·πÖgha. The meaning of they are praised is that they are praised in order to give them material things.

original: don du gang yang rung ba'i dkor gang yang rung ba las skyin por blang pa'i chos su sbyin par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gang yang rung ba'i rdzas las skyin po blang ba'i chos kyis sangs rgyas la sogs pa rnams la gang yang rung ba'i don du sho
analyzed: don du gang yang rung ba'i dkor gang yang rung ba las skyin por blang pa'i chos su sbyin par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gang yang rung ba'i rdzas las skyin po blang ba'i chos kyis sangs rgyas la sogs pa rnams la gang yang rung ba'i don du sho
translated: The meaning of one should give a tax that is a religious donation from any kind of wealth for any kind of purpose is that one should give a religious donation that is a tax from any kind of wealth for any kind of purpose of the Buddha and so on.

original: gam gyi bya ba gang yin pa de'i don du dkon mchog gzhan gyi don du sho gam sbyin pa skyon med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gam gyi bya ba gang yin pa de'i don du dkon mchog gzhan gyi don du sho gam sbyin pa skyon med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of there is no fault in giving a tax for the sake of another precious one is that there is no fault in giving a tax for the sake of another precious one for the sake of any kind of activity of a document.

original: skyin po blang ba'i chos kyis zhes bya ba de gang las bzung ba slar sbyin pa nyid do //
analyzed: skyin po blang ba'i chos kyis zhes bya ba de gang las bzung ba slar sbyin pa nyid do //
translated: The meaning of a religious donation that is a tax is that it is a donation that is a tax from a religious donation.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na gang gi ched du bzung ba de'i don gyis zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na gang gi ched du bzung ba de'i don gyis zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Why? Because the meaning of that for which it is held is the meaning of ‚Äúfor the sake of that.‚Äù

original: sho gam gzhal dgos pa dang bcas par 'gro bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni 'dir rgyang grags kyi lam du song ba la bdag nyid ces bya ba 'di las rgyang grags 'di la dngos gzhir gyur pa'i nyes byas rgyang grags phyed phyed cing de'i sbyor bar 'gyurüîΩba'i zhes bya ba 'di rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: sho gam gzhal dgos pa dang bcas par 'gro bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni 'dir rgyang grags kyi lam du song ba la bdag nyid ces bya ba 'di las rgyang grags 'di la dngos gzhir gyur pa'i nyes byas rgyang grags phyed phyed cing de'i sbyor bar 'gyur ba'i zhes bya ba 'di rtogs par bya'o //
translated: One should not go with a tax that must be paid, because in this case, one should understand that in a path of one kro≈õa, there is a root downfall, and in half a kro≈õa, there is a preparation for that.

original: 'gro ba ni 'da' bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: 'gro ba ni 'da' bar byed pa ste /
translated: Going is passing beyond.

original: sho ga ma dang lhan cig tu tha snyad la glags lta ba'i phyir btags pa'o //
analyzed: sho ga ma dang lhan cig tu tha snyad la glags lta ba'i phyir btags pa'o //
translated: It is a designation because it is a pretext for conventional transactions together with a tax.

original: mthun par byed pa dka' ba ma yin par 'gyur ba yang sho gam la brten pa'i tha snyad de dka' bar gyur pa ni lta smos kyang ci dgos te /
analyzed: mthun par byed pa dka' ba ma yin par 'gyur ba yang sho gam la brten pa'i tha snyad de dka' bar gyur pa ni lta smos kyang ci dgos te /
translated: It is difficult to do what is suitable, so what need is there to mention that which is difficult to do, which is a conventional transaction based on a tax?

original: de ma yin pa nyid la ni lang gi lci ba btsir bas kyang kha bsgyur ba dang / kha tshar dang phun tshar bcad pa yang ngo zhes bya ba la de ma yin pa nyid ces bya ba ni sho gam gzhal dgos pa ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: de ma yin pa nyid la ni lang gi lci ba btsir bas kyang kha bsgyur ba dang / kha tshar dang phun tshar bcad pa yang ngo zhes bya ba la de ma yin pa nyid ces bya ba ni sho gam gzhal dgos pa ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: But in the case of what is not subject to the tax, even if the cow's hide is pressed, it does not change color, and even if the fringe and the tip are cut off, it is not subject to the tax.üîΩWhat is not subject to the tax means that which is not subject to the tax.

original: re re nyid kyis kyang 'di dag la bcad pa dang kha bsgyur ba dag la sho gam gzhal ba nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: re re nyid kyis kyang 'di dag la bcad pa dang kha bsgyur ba dag la sho gam gzhal ba nyid ma yin no //
translated: Even if each of these is cut or changed in color, it is not subject to the tax.

original: de bas na so so 'di dag la sho gam gzhal dgos pa ma yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na so so 'di dag la sho gam gzhal dgos pa ma yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it should be understood that each of these is not subject to the tax.

original: ma mthong ba la blo de mi 'chags so zhes bya ba ni 'di ni kha bsgyur ba'am chad pa zhes bya ba'i blo la ma mthong ba'i dngos po la de mi @81a * //
analyzed: ma mthong ba la blo de mi 'chags so zhes bya ba ni 'di ni kha bsgyur ba'am chad pa zhes bya ba'i blo la ma mthong ba'i dngos po la de mi @81a * //
translated: The cognition of this is cut or this is changed in color does not arise in the absence of seeing.

original: mi 'chags so //
analyzed: mi 'chags so //
translated: It does not arise.

original: mthong ba med par 'dir ltung ba dang rtogs pa'i nges pa med pa'i phyogs pa'o //
analyzed: mthong ba med par 'dir ltung ba dang rtogs pa'i nges pa med pa'i phyogs pa'o //
translated: In the absence of seeing, there is no certainty of falling into this or that.

original: de'i dbang gis sho gam gzhal dgos pa dang bcas pa nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i dbang gis sho gam gzhal dgos pa dang bcas pa nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: By that power, it is not subject to the tax.

original: mi 'chags so zhes bya ba ni ltung ba mi ldang ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mi 'chags so zhes bya ba ni ltung ba mi ldang ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The phrase I will not confess means I will not rise up from the downfall.

original: 'dir gzhung ni rang gi mig gis blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni rang gi mig gis blta bar bya'o //
translated: Here, the text should be read as I will look with my own eyes.

original: ma bltas na 'gal tshabs can du 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: ma bltas na 'gal tshabs can du 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: If you do not look, you will be in violation of the rule.

original: gzhan gyi spyod pa brtol bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gzhan gyi spyod pa brtol bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: You should not expose the faults of others.

original: rang gi 'am gzhan gyi sho gam gzhal dgos pa'i rdzas rang ngam gzhan gyis sho gam gyi gnas nas 'da' bar byed pa gang yin pa de dgag par mdzad pa nyid kyi phyir gzhan gyi spyod pa brtol bar byed pa 'di yang bkag par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rang gi 'am gzhan gyi sho gam gzhal dgos pa'i rdzas rang ngam gzhan gyis sho gam gyi gnas nas 'da' bar byed pa gang yin pa de dgag par mdzad pa nyid kyi phyir gzhan gyi spyod pa brtol bar byed pa 'di yang bkag par rig par bya'o //
translated: You should not pass beyond the border of the country with goods on which you have not paid the duty, either by yourself or through others.

original: yid gcugs pa ma yin pa la gcugs pa nyid du mi bya'o //
analyzed: yid gcugs pa ma yin pa la gcugs pa nyid du mi bya'o //
translated: You should not create a false sense of intimacy with someone who is not a close friend.

original: 'di la gsum nyid do //
analyzed: 'di la gsum nyid do //
translated: This has three parts:

original: de nyid ni 'og ma la gong ma'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de nyid ni 'og ma la gong ma'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: The same person is both the superior and the inferior.

original: de nyid ces bya ba ni yid gcugs pa nyid do //
analyzed: de nyid ces bya ba ni yid gcugs pa nyid do //
translated: The same person is the one who is not a close friend.

original: 'og ma la zhes bya ba ni yid gcugs pa'o //
analyzed: 'og ma la zhes bya ba ni yid gcugs pa'o //
translated: The inferior is the one who is not a close friend.

original: gong ma'o zhes bya ba ni yid gcugs pa nyid la'o //
analyzed: gong ma'o zhes bya ba ni yid gcugs pa nyid la'o //
translated: The term ‚Äúsuperior‚Äù refers to one who is trustworthy.

original: chung du dang / 'bring dang / chen po nyid kyis gong ma dang / 'og ma nyid 'di zhes bya ba'i rnam pa 'dis sbyar ba nyid kyi phyir rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: chung du dang / 'bring dang / chen po nyid kyis gong ma dang / 'og ma nyid 'di zhes bya ba'i rnam pa 'dis sbyar ba nyid kyi phyir rtogs par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that the inferior, middling, and superior are respectively inferior, middling, and superior in terms of the degree of trust one places in them.

original: yid gcugs pa ma yin pa la yid gcugs pa nyid du brten par mi bya'o ;
analyzed: yid gcugs pa ma yin pa la yid gcugs pa nyid du brten par mi bya'o ;
translated: One should not place trust in one who is not trustworthy.

original: /'di skad bstan pa mdza' bshes tha ma la yid gcugs pa 'bring dang chen po mi bya'o //
analyzed: /'di skad bstan pa mdza' bshes tha ma la yid gcugs pa 'bring dang chen po mi bya'o //
translated: This is the meaning of the statement: ‚ÄúOne should not place trust in a bad friend, even if he is trustworthy.‚ÄùüîΩOne should not place trust in a middling friend, even if he is trustworthy.

original: 'bring la ni chen po brten bzhin pa yid gcugs par mi bya ba brten par 'gyur gyi yid gcugs par bya ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'bring la ni chen po brten bzhin pa yid gcugs par mi bya ba brten par 'gyur gyi yid gcugs par bya ba ni ma yin no //
translated: One should not place trust in a superior friend, even if he is trustworthy.

original: gang zhig gang la yid gcugs nas snod yin pa de ni de'i don yid gcugs par bya ba ma yin zhes bya ba byas te zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang zhig gang la yid gcugs nas snod yin pa de ni de'i don yid gcugs par bya ba ma yin zhes bya ba byas te zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: One should not place trust in a friend, even if he is trustworthy, if he is not a suitable vessel for the teaching.

original: slar su zhig la yid gcugs par bya zhe na /
analyzed: slar su zhig la yid gcugs par bya zhe na /
translated: In whom should one place trust?

original: de'i phyir de ni sdug pa dang / yid du 'thad pa dang / bla ma dang / bsgrub par 'os pa dang / mchod par 'os pa dang / bstod par 'os pa dang / blangs na dga' ba'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ni sdug pa dang / yid du 'thad pa dang / bla ma dang / bsgrub par 'os pa dang / mchod par 'os pa dang / bstod par 'os pa dang / blangs na dga' ba'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: Therefore, he is dear, agreeable, a guru, worthy of practice, worthy of worship, worthy of praise, and delightful to take up.

original: 'dir ni mnyes gshin pa dang bcas pa ni dga' bar brjod do //
analyzed: 'dir ni mnyes gshin pa dang bcas pa ni dga' bar brjod do //
translated: Here, one who is affectionate is called ‚Äúdelightful.‚Äù

original: bstod par 'os pa ni yid du 'ong ba'o //
analyzed: bstod par 'os pa ni yid du 'ong ba'o //
translated: One who is worthy of praise is agreeable.

original: bla ma zhes bya ba ni slob dpon dang mkhan po'o //
analyzed: bla ma zhes bya ba ni slob dpon dang mkhan po'o //
translated: A guru is a master and preceptor.

original: rjes su byed pa sgrub pa'i don du dge ba'i bshes gnyen nyid kyis gang zhig nye bar bsten la gnas pa de ni @81b bsgrub par 'os pa'o //
analyzed: rjes su byed pa sgrub pa'i don du dge ba'i bshes gnyen nyid kyis gang zhig nye bar bsten la gnas pa de ni @81b bsgrub par 'os pa'o //
translated: One who is worthy of practice is the spiritual teacher who is to be relied upon and attended upon for the sake of accomplishing the practice.

original: mchod par 'os pa zhes bya ba ni gang sbyin pa dang bsnyen bkur ba la sogs pa'i mchod pas gang zhig la dus dus su bsnyen bkur bar bya ba de ni mchod par bya ba'o //
analyzed: mchod par 'os pa zhes bya ba ni gang sbyin pa dang bsnyen bkur ba la sogs pa'i mchod pas gang zhig la dus dus su bsnyen bkur bar bya ba de ni mchod par bya ba'o //
translated: One who is worthy of worship is the one who is to be attended upon from time to time with the worship of gifts, respect, and so on.

original: bstod par 'os pa zhes bya ba ni gang gang la dus dus su nye bar gnas nas tshul khrims dang thos pa dang gtong ba la sogs pa'i yid bzung ba nyid kyis yang dag par mthong ba de ni bstod par bya ba'o //
analyzed: bstod par 'os pa zhes bya ba ni gang gang la dus dus su nye bar gnas nas tshul khrims dang thos pa dang gtong ba la sogs pa'i yid bzung ba nyid kyis yang dag par mthong ba de ni bstod par bya ba'o //
translated: Worthy of praise means that which is to be praised by those who, at the appropriate time, abide in the correct view through the mere retention of morality, learning, generosity, etc.

original: blangs na dga' ba zhes bya ba ni bdag gis bzung ba la dga' ba'i phyir gang du yid ches pa 'di skyes pa'o //
analyzed: blangs na dga' ba zhes bya ba ni bdag gis bzung ba la dga' ba'i phyir gang du yid ches pa 'di skyes pa'o //
translated: Delightful to take up means that which gives rise to confidence in those who have taken it up.

original: lag spod kyi las kyis las bya zhing bsod nams kyi blos kyang ste gla rngan gyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: lag spod kyi las kyis las bya zhing bsod nams kyi blos kyang ste gla rngan gyis ni ma yin no //
translated: One should perform one's duties with the attitude of a servant and with the attitude of merit, not with the attitude of wages.

original: yul gyi nges pa'i tshig ni 'drid pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni de ltar yang rnam par 'byed pa las bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong ma'i gnas su khyod kyis ci zhig byas zhes bya ba gang brjod pa ci'i tha tshig ces smras pa dang /
analyzed: yul gyi nges pa'i tshig ni 'drid pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni de ltar yang rnam par 'byed pa las bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong ma'i gnas su khyod kyis ci zhig byas zhes bya ba gang brjod pa ci'i tha tshig ces smras pa dang /
translated: The definition of object is not deceptive. Thus, in the Exposition, the BhagavƒÅn said to the nun, ‚ÄúWhat have you done?‚Äù She said, ‚ÄúWhat is the meaning of that?‚Äù

original: gsol ba btsun pa 'jig rten na ltung ngo zhes bya ba gang lags pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gsol ba btsun pa 'jig rten na ltung ngo zhes bya ba gang lags pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: He said, Venerable One, the meaning of 'falling' in the world is this.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: dge slong dag yul gyi nges pa'i tshig gis ltung bar mi 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: dge slong dag yul gyi nges pa'i tshig gis ltung bar mi 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Monks, it is not a downfall by the definition of the country.

original: 'di ltar brjod par gyur pa 'di sdug bsngal du rtogs par bya ba ma yin te zhes bya ba 'di bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar brjod par gyur pa 'di sdug bsngal du rtogs par bya ba ma yin te zhes bya ba 'di bstan pa'o //
translated: This is taught: It is not that this which has become thus is to be realized as suffering.üîΩOne should not keep the taking of a downfall secret for a long time.

original: ltung ba blangs pa yun ring du mi bsrel lo zhes bya ba ni dus ji srid kyis na 'dis bcabs so snyam du dogs pa skye ba'i dus de srid na 'dir yun shin tu ring ba nyid du rig par byas te de srid du bsrel bar mi bya'o
analyzed: ltung ba blangs pa yun ring du mi bsrel lo zhes bya ba ni dus ji srid kyis na 'dis bcabs so snyam du dogs pa skye ba'i dus de srid na 'dir yun shin tu ring ba nyid du rig par byas te de srid du bsrel bar mi bya'o
translated: For as long as one suspects that this will be kept secret, for that long it should be understood as a very long time here, and for that long it should not be kept secret.

original: // de dge skos la gtad pa nyid du bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: // de dge skos la gtad pa nyid du bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: One should turn it over to the virtuous ones.

original: de zhes bya ba ni ltung ba blangs pa la'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni ltung ba blangs pa la'o //
translated: This refers to the taking of a downfall.

original: des rab tu byung ba yin par dogs na dge 'dun la bstan par bya'o zhes bya ba ni dge skos de rab tu byung ba la 'di dang 'brel pa la zhes bya ba dogs pa 'di yod pa la de'i tshe rdzas de'i bdag po nges par shes par
analyzed: des rab tu byung ba yin par dogs na dge 'dun la bstan par bya'o zhes bya ba ni dge skos de rab tu byung ba la 'di dang 'brel pa la zhes bya ba dogs pa 'di yod pa la de'i tshe rdzas de'i bdag po nges par shes par
translated: If there is doubt that it belongs to a renunciate, it should be shown to the Sa·πÖgha.

original: bya ba'i phyir dge 'dun la bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: bya ba'i phyir dge 'dun la bstan par bya'o //
translated: This means that if there is doubt that the monk is related to this object, then at that time, in order to ascertain the owner of that object, it should be shown to the Sa·πÖgha.üîΩIf the owner does not appear, it should be tied to a hook and kept.

original: bdag po ma byung na gzar thag la btags te gzhag go zhes bya ba ni gal te de ltar na 'di nye bar bstan pa rab tu byung ba'am gzhan 'ga' zhig bdag po byung ste /
analyzed: bdag po ma byung na gzar thag la btags te gzhag go zhes bya ba ni gal te de ltar na 'di nye bar bstan pa rab tu byung ba'am gzhan 'ga' zhig bdag po byung ste /
translated: This means that if in that way, the renunciate who showed this, or someone else becomes the owner,

translated: It is impossible for a non-saint to have a true arising in the presence of a great many people.

original: 'dir gzhung ni phag gi mgo bcad pa zhes bya ba gsungs pa yin no //üîΩro'i rdzas mi ma yin pas blangs pa nyid ni yongs su ma bzung ba nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba ni ro'i rgyud du gtogs pa'i rdzas gang yin pa de gal te mi ma yin pas blangs par gyur na de yongs su ma bzung ba'o snyam du
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni phag gi mgo bcad pa zhes bya ba gsungs pa yin no // ro'i rdzas mi ma yin pas blangs pa nyid ni yongs su ma bzung ba nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba ni ro'i rgyud du gtogs pa'i rdzas gang yin pa de gal te mi ma yin pas blangs par gyur na de yongs su ma bzung ba'o snyam du
translated: Here, the text states: ‚ÄúThe head of a pig is cut off.‚ÄùüîΩThe substance of a corpse is not considered to be unowned if it is taken by a non-human being.

original: shes par mi bya ste /
analyzed: shes par mi bya ste /
translated: If a substance belonging to the continuum of a corpse is taken by a non-human being, it should not be considered to be unowned.

analyzed: de brkus na nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ba nyid la 'di brjod pa'o //

original: rab tu gtum pa de'i phyi bzhin du 'gro bar bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rab tu gtum pa de'i phyi bzhin du 'gro bar bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: One should follow closely behind that very fierce one.

original: de'i zhes bya ba ni mi ma yin pa des gnod par byed pa spang ba'i phyir rab tu gtum pa de'i phyi bzhin du 'gro bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i zhes bya ba ni mi ma yin pa des gnod par byed pa spang ba'i phyir rab tu gtum pa de'i phyi bzhin du 'gro bar bya'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to a non-human being. In order to avoid being harmed by that non-human being, one should follow closely behind that very fierce one.

original: khas bub tu bsnyal ba la rkang pa'i mtha' nas brtsams te g-yogs par bya'o zhes bya ba la bsnyal ba zhes bya ba ni ro la'o //
analyzed: khas bub tu bsnyal ba la rkang pa'i mtha' nas brtsams te g-yogs par bya'o zhes bya ba la bsnyal ba zhes bya ba ni ro la'o //
translated: One should cover the corpse from the feet upward, means that one should cover the corpse from the feet upward.

original: 'di yang rab tu 'gro ba yongs su spang pa'i don du ro ma rmas pa las gos blang bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: 'di yang rab tu 'gro ba yongs su spang pa'i don du ro ma rmas pa las gos blang bar mi bya'o //
translated: One should not take cloth from an undamaged corpse, for the purpose of avoiding the appearance of being a thief.

original: rang gis rmas pa dang @83a * //
analyzed: rang gis rmas pa dang @83a * //
translated: One should not damage it oneself, means that one should not damage the corpse oneself.

original: rmas par byed du gzhug par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni 'dir ro zhes bya ba mtha' gnyis kar sbyar ro //
analyzed: rmas par byed du gzhug par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni 'dir ro zhes bya ba mtha' gnyis kar sbyar ro //
translated: One should not have it damaged, means that one should not have another person damage the corpse.

original: thams cad du bsti gnas dang so shing dang chu dang 'dag rdzas dang lci ba dang sa ci bder bya'o zhes bya ba ni 'dir byug pa la sogs pa'i don du ba lang gi lci ba bzung ba yin te /

translated: One should use a cemetery, tooth cleaner, water for washing, cleansing substance, cow dung, and earth as is convenient. Here, cow dung is meant for the purpose of anointing, etc.

original: 'dag rdzas su gyur pa la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dag rdzas su gyur pa la ni ma yin no //

analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong gang du bsti ba der rnam pa lnga po ci bder brjod par bya ste /

analyzed: so shing dang chu dang 'dag rdzas dang lci ba dang sa'o zhes gsungs pa yin no // dge slong dang dge tshul mi 'dod bzhin du 'brel bas khrid pa na gzung bar bya'o zhes bya ba la ;
translated: Tooth wood, water, cleansing material, cow dung, and earth.üîΩIf a monk or novice is led unwillingly by relatives, he should be held.

analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni de la lag pa gang shos na zhes dri'o //
