analyzed: pham pa yang ma yin la sbom po yang ma yin no ;
translated: It is not a defeating offense, nor is it a grave offense.

original: /'dir gzhung ni ji ste mchod pa'i don du 'di bdag gi ston pa'o //
analyzed: /'dir gzhung ni ji ste mchod pa'i don du 'di bdag gi ston pa'o //
translated: Here, the text says, ‚ÄúIf one steals with the thought, ‚ÄòThis is my teacher‚Äôs image,‚Äô

original: bdag gis 'di la bkur sti bya'o snyam du rku bar byed na nyes byas kyi ltung bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: bdag gis 'di la bkur sti bya'o snyam du rku bar byed na nyes byas kyi ltung bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: or ‚ÄòI will honor this,‚Äô it is an offense of wrong conduct.‚ÄùüîΩThere is no offense if one draws a picture.

original: dpe bri ba la ni nyes pa med pa yin no zhes bya ba ni gang zhig mthong nas gzhan du 'dri ba ni de'i yi ge la sogs pa 'dir bar bya ste /
analyzed: dpe bri ba la ni nyes pa med pa yin no zhes bya ba ni gang zhig mthong nas gzhan du 'dri ba ni de'i yi ge la sogs pa 'dir bar bya ste /
translated: If one sees a picture and draws it elsewhere, one should draw its letters, etc.

original: yi ge la sogs pa'i mtshan ma de bskus pas blangs pa la skyon med pa nyid de ltung ba mi byed pa nyid do //
analyzed: yi ge la sogs pa'i mtshan ma de bskus pas blangs pa la skyon med pa nyid de ltung ba mi byed pa nyid do //
translated: There is no offense if one takes it after anointing the letters, etc., with a sign.

original: gzhan du 'dir ba mthong nas 'di la bzung ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan du 'dir ba mthong nas 'di la bzung ba'o //
translated: If one sees it elsewhere and takes it, it is an offense.

original: 'dir ni cung zad gzhan la chad par 'gyur ba ma yin te /üîΩ'dri ba'i snod bskus pa la ni rin thang ji lta bar ltung ba'o //
analyzed: 'dir ni cung zad gzhan la chad par 'gyur ba ma yin te / 'dri ba'i snod bskus pa la ni rin thang ji lta bar ltung ba'o //
translated: But here, it is not a little different.üîΩIf the vessel is baked, the offense is according to the value of the vessel.

original: bshig ste rku ba la ni de'i gnas skabs rku ba'i dngos po nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni gser la sogs pa'i rdzas gang zhig bshig pa de'i gnas skabs rku ba'i dngos po nyid do //
analyzed: bshig ste rku ba la ni de'i gnas skabs rku ba'i dngos po nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni gser la sogs pa'i rdzas gang zhig bshig pa de'i gnas skabs rku ba'i dngos po nyid do //
translated: If it is destroyed and stolen, the offense is according to the value of the substance, such as gold, in that condition.

original: de'i gnas skabs zhes bya ba 'di la rku ba'i bdag nyid can gyi sbyor ba bdun du des sbyor ba dang bral bar gyur pa zhes bya ba'i don @85a * //
analyzed: de'i gnas skabs zhes bya ba 'di la rku ba'i bdag nyid can gyi sbyor ba bdun du des sbyor ba dang bral bar gyur pa zhes bya ba'i don @85a * //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúin that condition‚Äù is that the action of stealing is completed when the thief is free from the action of taking it.

original: to ; /'jig pa la ni sbom po ste /
analyzed: to ; /'jig pa la ni sbom po ste /
translated: If it is destroyed, the offense is grave.

original: 'jig pa'i rnam par 'gyur pa'i gnas skabs la rin thang gang yin pa de'i dbang gis ltung ba zhes bya ba de la 'di brjod pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig pa'i rnam par 'gyur pa'i gnas skabs la rin thang gang yin pa de'i dbang gis ltung ba zhes bya ba de la 'di brjod pa'o //
translated: The offense is according to the value of the substance in the condition of its destruction. This is what is meant here.

original: 'dir gzhung ni btsun pa dge slong gis mi rnams kyi rin po che'am rin po cher smos pa'am gser bshig ste rku na ltung ba cir 'gyur /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni btsun pa dge slong gis mi rnams kyi rin po che'am rin po cher smos pa'am gser bshig ste rku na ltung ba cir 'gyur /
translated: Here the text is: ‚ÄúIf a monk steals precious things or things said to be precious or gold dust from humans, what is the downfall?‚Äù

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: He replied:

original: rin thang brtsi bar bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: rin thang brtsi bar bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúThe value should be assessed.‚Äù

original: de dang gnas skabs can nyid la rin thang brtsi bar bya'o zhes bya ba gsungs pa'i phyir don 'di mngon par 'dod ces bya ba 'di ltar don byas so //
analyzed: de dang gnas skabs can nyid la rin thang brtsi bar bya'o zhes bya ba gsungs pa'i phyir don 'di mngon par 'dod ces bya ba 'di ltar don byas so //
translated: Since it is said that the value should be assessed in the case of that and other things, this meaning is clearly intended, and so this meaning is established.

original: byang gi sgra mi snyan na ni yongs su 'dzin pa med pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni yongs su 'dzin pa med pa'i dngos po ni rang gi bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: byang gi sgra mi snyan na ni yongs su 'dzin pa med pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni yongs su 'dzin pa med pa'i dngos po ni rang gi bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
translated: In Uttarakuru, there is no ownership.üîΩThat is like one‚Äôs own.

original: de ni rang gi dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba ni ji ltar rang gi rdzas rku sems kyis brkus na nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ba bzhin du 'di yang de bzhin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de ni rang gi dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba ni ji ltar rang gi rdzas rku sems kyis brkus na nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ba bzhin du 'di yang de bzhin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means that just as stealing one‚Äôs own property with the intention to steal is a serious offense, so too is this.

original: zhu ba'i skabs 'dis dngos po'i skabs dang / bdag po'i skabs dang / rjes su sgrub pa'i skabs dang / mthar thug pa'i skabs zhes bya ba'i rnam pa bzhi bsdus pa de rnams las de yan chad du dngos po'i skabs bshad zin to //
analyzed: zhu ba'i skabs 'dis dngos po'i skabs dang / bdag po'i skabs dang / rjes su sgrub pa'i skabs dang / mthar thug pa'i skabs zhes bya ba'i rnam pa bzhi bsdus pa de rnams las de yan chad du dngos po'i skabs bshad zin to //
translated: The topic of the thing has been explained up to this point.

original: da ni bdag po'i skabs brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni bdag po'i skabs brjod par bya ste /
translated: Now the topic of the master will be explained.

original: de'i dus na bdag nyid yod pa bdag po nyid do zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de'i dus na bdag nyid yod pa bdag po nyid do zhes bya ba la /
translated: At that time, the master is the one who is present.

original: de'i dus kyi zhes bya ba ni rku ba'i dus kyi'o //
analyzed: de'i dus kyi zhes bya ba ni rku ba'i dus kyi'o //
translated: At that time means at the time of the theft.

original: mchod rten las bskus pa yang mi'i rgyud kyis yongs su bzung ba med pa'i phyir yan lag ma yin pa nyid la dngos po tshang na nyes pa sbom por 'gyur te 'di ni bsdus pa yin no //
analyzed: mchod rten las bskus pa yang mi'i rgyud kyis yongs su bzung ba med pa'i phyir yan lag ma yin pa nyid la dngos po tshang na nyes pa sbom por 'gyur te 'di ni bsdus pa yin no //
translated: Even if it is anointed for a stupa, if it is not held in the continuum of a human, it is not a limb. If the thing is complete, there is a serious offense. This is the summary.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa ni lha nyid do zhes bya ba ni slar 'di rnam par nges par phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa ni rnam par dag pa'i lha nyid du bzhed do //üîΩmya ngan las 'das pa 'byung ba'i dbang gis der phung po spangs pa la phung po lhag ma med pa la rnam par dag pa'i lha nyid du skyes pa nyid do //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa ni lha nyid do zhes bya ba ni slar 'di rnam par nges par phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa ni rnam par dag pa'i lha nyid du bzhed do // mya ngan las 'das pa 'byung ba'i dbang gis der phung po spangs pa la phung po lhag ma med pa la rnam par dag pa'i lha nyid du skyes pa nyid do //
translated: Nirvana is the very godhead. This is to say, he is considered to be the very pure godhead in the realm of nirvana without remainder of aggregates, having passed into final nirvana.üîΩBy the power of the arising of nirvana, the abandonment of the aggregates there is the very birth in the pure godhead of nirvana without remainder of aggregates.

original: mchog tu bde ba'i bdag nyid can nyid kyi phyir mya ngan las 'das pa la yang lha nyid kho nar rnam par gnas pa yin zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mchog tu bde ba'i bdag nyid can nyid kyi phyir mya ngan las 'das pa la yang lha nyid kho nar rnam par gnas pa yin zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Nirvana is the very godhead, because it is the nature of supreme bliss.

original: brnyan pa nges par sbyin pa nyid bzhin du nye bar spyod na sbyor ba bzhin no zhes bya ba ni gzhan du ni rku sems med pa zhes bya ba bstan pa'i phyir rku ba'i sems kyis zhes bya ba 'dir rjes su chags par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: brnyan pa nges par sbyin pa nyid bzhin du nye bar spyod na sbyor ba bzhin no zhes bya ba ni gzhan du ni rku sems med pa zhes bya ba bstan pa'i phyir rku ba'i sems kyis zhes bya ba 'dir rjes su chags par rig par bya'o //
translated: The phrase with a mind to steal should be understood as referring to attachment, because it is taught that if one has no mind to steal, there is no offense.

original: dngos po mchog pa nyid la sbom po'i @85b ltung ba la dngos gzhir brjod pa'i phyir yongs su rdzogs pa la sbyor ba nyid shes par bya'o //
analyzed: dngos po mchog pa nyid la sbom po'i @85b ltung ba la dngos gzhir brjod pa'i phyir yongs su rdzogs pa la sbyor ba nyid shes par bya'o //
translated: The phrase if one has completed the act should be understood as referring to the preparatory stage, because the actual basis is said to be the grave downfall of taking what is not given.

original: don ci zhig gis dngos po gang zhig gnang ba de yang ji ltar bsri ba med par thams cad nyid kyis bstan pa la sbyin par bya ba ma yin pa nyid kyis longs spyod pa de ni sbyor ba bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: don ci zhig gis dngos po gang zhig gnang ba de yang ji ltar bsri ba med par thams cad nyid kyis bstan pa la sbyin par bya ba ma yin pa nyid kyis longs spyod pa de ni sbyor ba bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
translated: One should understand that the meaning of as if one were to commit the act oneself is that one should not use the property of the Sangha without permission, and that one should not use it without having given it back, even if one has been given permission.

original: de lta bu'i nye bar longs spyod pa la sbom po'i ltung ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de lta bu'i nye bar longs spyod pa la sbom po'i ltung ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the phrase a grave downfall is that such usage is a grave downfall.

original: nye bar spyod na sbyor ba bzhin no zhes bya ba ni ma chad pa'i rnam pa yang nye bar spyod par bya ba gzung ba dang bcas par bya ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: nye bar spyod na sbyor ba bzhin no zhes bya ba ni ma chad pa'i rnam pa yang nye bar spyod par bya ba gzung ba dang bcas par bya ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: If one uses it, it is like the preparation. This is because the form of not cutting off is also to be used and to be taken up.

original: de bas na 'dir sbom po'i ltung ba'o //
analyzed: de bas na 'dir sbom po'i ltung ba'o //
translated: Therefore, here it is a grave offense.

original: ma gnang ba la bsri ba med pa nye bar longs spyod pa ni shin tu lci ba nyid de de bas na 'dir yang 'dis sbom po'i ltung ba byas pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: ma gnang ba la bsri ba med pa nye bar longs spyod pa ni shin tu lci ba nyid de de bas na 'dir yang 'dis sbom po'i ltung ba byas pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
translated: Using without permission is very heavy. Therefore, here also it should be understood that this is a grave offense.

original: 'dir gzhung ni btsun pa dge slong gis khyim bdag gi gos brnyan pa btags te rku na ltung ba cir 'gyur /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni btsun pa dge slong gis khyim bdag gi gos brnyan pa btags te rku na ltung ba cir 'gyur /
translated: Here is the text: Venerable, if a monk steals a householder's robe, what downfall does he incur?

original: nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro //
translated: He incurs a grave offense.

original: ci ste khyim bdag 'di skad ces 'phags pa bdag nyid 'di khyod la brnyan no zhes zer na dge slong de la bsri ba med pa'i 'du shes can de la yongs su longs spyod par byed na sbom po'i ltung bar 'gyur zhes bya ba 'di'i 'di bsdus pa'o
analyzed: ci ste khyim bdag 'di skad ces 'phags pa bdag nyid 'di khyod la brnyan no zhes zer na dge slong de la bsri ba med pa'i 'du shes can de la yongs su longs spyod par byed na sbom po'i ltung bar 'gyur zhes bya ba 'di'i 'di bsdus pa'o
translated: If the householder says, ‚ÄúNoble one, this is your own fault,‚Äù then if the monk, with the perception of being free from offense, enjoys it, there is a grave offense. This is the summary of that.

original: // 'di las snga rol gyi gzhung las rung ba zhes bya ba'i mdo 'di bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: // 'di las snga rol gyi gzhung las rung ba zhes bya ba'i mdo 'di bsdus pa'o //
translated: This is the summary of the sutra called ‚ÄúThe Appropriate‚Äù from the earlier text.

original: gsang sngags dang sman dag gis 'bul du bcug na yang ngo zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba bzhin no zhes bya ba dang rjes su 'brel to //
analyzed: gsang sngags dang sman dag gis 'bul du bcug na yang ngo zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba bzhin no zhes bya ba dang rjes su 'brel to //
translated: If one is induced to accept through mantras and medicines, it is like the application, it is connected with that.

original: de ni chad pas bcad pa'i rnam pa yin pa ste /
analyzed: de ni chad pas bcad pa'i rnam pa yin pa ste /
translated: That is the form of punishment.

original: de bas na 'dir nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas na 'dir nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, here it becomes a grave fault.

original: 'dir gzhung ni ji ste des gsang sngags kyis sam /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni ji ste des gsang sngags kyis sam /
translated: Here the text is: If he, through a mantra,

original: me tog dang 'bras bu rnams kyis stsal nas khyim bdag des 'di skad ces 'phags pa bdag gis 'di khyod la brnyas pa brnyan no zhes zer nas /
analyzed: me tog dang 'bras bu rnams kyis stsal nas khyim bdag des 'di skad ces 'phags pa bdag gis 'di khyod la brnyas pa brnyan no zhes zer nas /
translated: The householder said, Noble one, I have insulted you, and he gave him flowers and fruit.

original: dge slong de la yang bsri ba med pa'i 'du shes can dang / nges par byin pa nyid kyi 'du shes kyis nye bar spyad na nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: dge slong de la yang bsri ba med pa'i 'du shes can dang / nges par byin pa nyid kyi 'du shes kyis nye bar spyad na nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: If the monk has the idea that he is not to be served, and the idea that he is to be given, then he commits a serious offense by using them.

original: nges par byin pa'i 'du shes can zhes bya ba ni de ltar rnyed pa la bdag tu bya ba bstan par reg par bya'o //
analyzed: nges par byin pa'i 'du shes can zhes bya ba ni de ltar rnyed pa la bdag tu bya ba bstan par reg par bya'o //
translated: The idea that he is to be given means that he has the idea, I will obtain this.

original: yongs su tshim par bya ba'i phyir me tog dang 'bras bu sbyin pa gang yin pa ni ma gtogs pa ste /
analyzed: yongs su tshim par bya ba'i phyir me tog dang 'bras bu sbyin pa gang yin pa ni ma gtogs pa ste /
translated: This is not the case for one who gives flowers and fruit in order to satisfy him.

original: de ni log pa'i 'tsho ba la mtshan ma rnyed pa dang blangs pas bsam pa bral bar gyur pa rku ba la brten pa'i skyon mi skyed pa nyid do //
analyzed: de ni log pa'i 'tsho ba la mtshan ma rnyed pa dang blangs pas bsam pa bral bar gyur pa rku ba la brten pa'i skyon mi skyed pa nyid do //
translated: Because he has obtained the sign of wrong livelihood, and because he has taken it up, he becomes free from the intention, and he does not generate the fault of theft.

original: de bas na dbang du bya ba la mkhas par @86a * //
analyzed: de bas na dbang du bya ba la mkhas par @86a * //
translated: Therefore, he is skilled in controlling himself.

original: gyur pa'i me tog dang 'bras bu rnams la ma bzung ba 'di rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: gyur pa'i me tog dang 'bras bu rnams la ma bzung ba 'di rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: The flowers and fruits that are transformed are consciousness.üîΩEven for the sake of others, the form is that of the actual basis.

original: gzhan gyi don nyid du na yang dngos gzhi'i rnam pa'o zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi don la bdag gi bya ba ma skyes par gang rku bar byed na yang de la dngos gzhi'i rnam pa'o zhes bya ba dngos gzhi'i sbyor ba ste /
analyzed: gzhan gyi don nyid du na yang dngos gzhi'i rnam pa'o zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi don la bdag gi bya ba ma skyes par gang rku bar byed na yang de la dngos gzhi'i rnam pa'o zhes bya ba dngos gzhi'i sbyor ba ste /
translated: If one steals for the sake of others, that is the form of the actual basis.

original: dngos gzhi'i kha na ma tho ba ma tshang ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dngos gzhi'i kha na ma tho ba ma tshang ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the actual basis is incomplete.

original: pham par 'gyur ba'i sbyor ba la dgongs nas dngos gzhi'i rnam pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: pham par 'gyur ba'i sbyor ba la dgongs nas dngos gzhi'i rnam pa zhes brjod do //
translated: With the intention of the preparation for defeat, it is said to be the form of the actual basis.

original: 'dir gzhung ni btsun pa dge slong gis ma bsgo bar gzhan gyi don la rku bar byed na ltung bar cir 'gyur /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni btsun pa dge slong gis ma bsgo bar gzhan gyi don la rku bar byed na ltung bar cir 'gyur /
translated: Here, the text says: Venerable monks, if one steals for the sake of others without permission, what is the downfall?

original: nyes pa sbom bor ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: nyes pa sbom bor ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: It is a grave offense.

original: rtog pas kyang ngo zhes bya ba ni dngos gzhi'i rnam pa'o zhes bya ba dang rjes su 'brel to //
analyzed: rtog pas kyang ngo zhes bya ba ni dngos gzhi'i rnam pa'o zhes bya ba dang rjes su 'brel to //
translated: Even by conception is connected with the form is that of the actual basis.

original: kha bcings pa tsam du gyur pa'i rtog pa gang yin pa de la mi skyed pa 'grib pa la dngos gzhi nyid du rnam par gnas te dngos gzhi'i rnam pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: kha bcings pa tsam du gyur pa'i rtog pa gang yin pa de la mi skyed pa 'grib pa la dngos gzhi nyid du rnam par gnas te dngos gzhi'i rnam pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The state of the actual basis is established for the non-generation of any thought that is merely bound by the mouth, but it is not the form of the actual basis.

original: de bas na yang dag par na skyon med pa'i rnam pa'i gnas dang rjes su 'brel pa de las bzlog pa rnams la rtog pa 'di cis rtogs par bya zhe na /
analyzed: de bas na yang dag par na skyon med pa'i rnam pa'i gnas dang rjes su 'brel pa de las bzlog pa rnams la rtog pa 'di cis rtogs par bya zhe na /
translated: Therefore, how can one understand this thought in the correct manner, which is connected with the state of the faultless aspect?

original: 'di lta ste dper na 'di ni bdag gi yin no snyam pa'am yongs su bzung ba ma yin no snyam pa'am /
analyzed: 'di lta ste dper na 'di ni bdag gi yin no snyam pa'am yongs su bzung ba ma yin no snyam pa'am /
translated: For example, it is like the notion that this is mine, or the notion that it is not taken hold of,

original: de bdag la sbyin no zhes bya ba'i 'du shes sam /
analyzed: de bdag la sbyin no zhes bya ba'i 'du shes sam /
translated: or the notion that it is given to me,

original: dmigs pa med pa'am /
analyzed: dmigs pa med pa'am /
translated: or the notion that it is without objective support,

original: dogs pa dang bcas pa'am /
analyzed: dogs pa dang bcas pa'am /
translated: or the notion that it is accompanied by fear,

original: g-yo ba med pa'am /
analyzed: g-yo ba med pa'am /
translated: or the notion that it is without movement,

original: cig shos kyi 'du shes kyi skyon gyis rjes su 'brel ba'o //
analyzed: cig shos kyi 'du shes kyi skyon gyis rjes su 'brel ba'o //
translated: or the notion that it is the other.

original: 'o na 'di ni the tshom yin na der 'di la skyon gyi 'du shes te the tshom ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'o na 'di ni the tshom yin na der 'di la skyon gyi 'du shes te the tshom ni ma yin no //
translated: But if this is doubt, then here it is the notion of a fault, not doubt.

original: de bas na gzhan nyid du gyur pa la pham pa 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bas na gzhan nyid du gyur pa la pham pa 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, defeat occurs for one who is different.

original: gang yang rung ba'i 'o snyam pa'i bsam pa yang dag par gnas par 'gyur ba la 'di 'byung bar 'gyur ba nyid de /
analyzed: gang yang rung ba'i 'o snyam pa'i bsam pa yang dag par gnas par 'gyur ba la 'di 'byung bar 'gyur ba nyid de /
translated: This occurs for one who has the thought ‚ÄúI will take what is not given,‚Äù and it occurs for one who has the thought ‚ÄúI will take what is given to someone else.‚ÄùüîΩThis is not the case for one who has the thought ‚ÄúI will take what is mine.‚Äù

original: de lta bu ni bdag tu byas pa ma yin no zhes bya ba nges pa la gnas pa'i 'dzin pa la sbom po 'di brjod par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bu ni bdag tu byas pa ma yin no zhes bya ba nges pa la gnas pa'i 'dzin pa la sbom po 'di brjod par rig par bya'o //
translated: This is the gross form of grasping that is based on the certainty that ‚ÄúI will take what is mine.‚ÄùüîΩIt is also the case for one who is told to steal something valuable.

original: gdams te bzang po rku bar 'dod pa la yang ngo zhes bya ba ni dngos gzhi'i rnam pa'o zhes bya ba dang rjes su 'brel to //
analyzed: gdams te bzang po rku bar 'dod pa la yang ngo zhes bya ba ni dngos gzhi'i rnam pa'o zhes bya ba dang rjes su 'brel to //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúit is also the case for one who is told to steal something valuable‚Äù is connected to the phrase ‚Äúit is the form of the actual basis.‚Äù

original: rku bar 'dod pa la zhes bya ba 'di lta bu'i 'dod pa yod pa la /
analyzed: rku bar 'dod pa la zhes bya ba 'di lta bu'i 'dod pa yod pa la /
translated: For one who has the desire to steal something valuable,

original: gang zhig gdams pa dngos gzhi'i rnam pa de la kha na ma tho ba med pa'o //
analyzed: gang zhig gdams pa dngos gzhi'i rnam pa de la kha na ma tho ba med pa'o //
translated: there is no offense for one who is told to steal something valuable and who then steals it.

original: ji lta bu me tog rnams kyi gdams pa de lta bu 'di'o //
analyzed: ji lta bu me tog rnams kyi gdams pa de lta bu 'di'o //
translated: It is like the case of the flowers.

original: 'di ltar gzhan du ni nom pa'i snga rol du zhes bya ba brjod pas 'di'i nom pa snga rol du 'dir de'i dngos po de bas na sbyor ba'i sbyor ba nyid @86b do ;
analyzed: 'di ltar gzhan du ni nom pa'i snga rol du zhes bya ba brjod pas 'di'i nom pa snga rol du 'dir de'i dngos po de bas na sbyor ba'i sbyor ba nyid @86b do ;
translated: Thus, in other s≈´tras, it is said, ‚Äúprior to the theft.‚Äù Here, prior to the theft, that thing is not that thing. Therefore, the application of the term ‚Äútheft‚Äù is appropriate.

original: / nom pa'i snga rol du zhes bya ba nyes byas thob pa la mdo 'di'o //
analyzed: / nom pa'i snga rol du zhes bya ba nyes byas thob pa la mdo 'di'o //
translated: ‚ÄúPrior to the theft‚Äù is a fault in the acquisition of a downfall, according to this s≈´tra.

original: 'dir gzhung ni btsun pa mi rnams kyi gos kyi gdang shing ngam /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni btsun pa mi rnams kyi gos kyi gdang shing ngam /
translated: Here is the text: ‚ÄúVenerable! It is like a rack for clothes,

original: gos kyi snod dam gos kyi za ma tog gam glang po che'i so bzhag par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gos kyi snod dam gos kyi za ma tog gam glang po che'i so bzhag par 'gyur te /
translated: a container for clothes, a bag for clothes, or a tusk of an elephant.

original: der dge slong rku ba'i sems rnam par shes te /
analyzed: der dge slong rku ba'i sems rnam par shes te /
translated: There, a monk with a mind to steal

original: gang 'dod par gyur pa de rku bar byed na ci ltung bar 'gyur ram /
analyzed: gang 'dod par gyur pa de rku bar byed na ci ltung bar 'gyur ram /
translated: steals whatever he wants. What downfall does he commit?

original: nyes pa sbom po'i ltung bar 'gyur zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: nyes pa sbom po'i ltung bar 'gyur zhes bya ba'o //
translated: He commits a serious downfall.‚Äù

original: gang zhig 'dod pa de ni brkus te rin thang brtsi bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gang zhig 'dod pa de ni brkus te rin thang brtsi bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúWhatever he wants‚Äù means he steals it and its value is to be assessed.

original: so sor byed par 'gyur ba la yang gnas nas gdams pa 'di ni nyes pa sbom por rig par bya'o //
analyzed: so sor byed par 'gyur ba la yang gnas nas gdams pa 'di ni nyes pa sbom por rig par bya'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIf he does it individually‚Äù means that this instruction is to be known as a serious downfall.

original: gzhan don dang bcas pa 'dra bar yang dag par 'gro ba la bsdus pa'i blo la der yang dag par gnas pas gdams te /
analyzed: gzhan don dang bcas pa 'dra bar yang dag par 'gro ba la bsdus pa'i blo la der yang dag par gnas pas gdams te /
translated: The thought that is included in the correct going for the sake of others is instructed in that.

original: 'dir sbom po'i ltung ba gcig go //
analyzed: 'dir sbom po'i ltung ba gcig go //
translated: Here there is one downfall through transgression.

original: gdams te rku ba'i don du nom pa la gzhan zhes bya ba rnam par gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: gdams te rku ba'i don du nom pa la gzhan zhes bya ba rnam par gnas pa yin no //
translated: The term ‚Äúanother‚Äù refers to the object of theft.

original: rgyan la dor byed na gal te de rgyal ba nyid du ma gyur ba'i tshe sbyor ba'o zhes bya ba ni rgyan la dor byed na gal te de rgyal ba nyid du ma gyur gyi bar du dor te sbyor bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyan la dor byed na gal te de rgyal ba nyid du ma gyur ba'i tshe sbyor ba'o zhes bya ba ni rgyan la dor byed na gal te de rgyal ba nyid du ma gyur gyi bar du dor te sbyor bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If the gambler does not win, then the one who is playing is the one who is stealing.

original: de la de ni brkus pa yin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de la de ni brkus pa yin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: In that case, it is theft.

original: de la zhes bya ba ni rgyan la'o //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni rgyan la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn that‚Äù refers to the gambling.

original: de ni zhes bya ba rgyal ba nyid na brkus pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba rgyal ba nyid na brkus pa yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúIt‚Äù refers to the winning.

original: gang gi phyir 'dir rku ba nyid ni de bas na 'di la brten pa'i dor byed pa la sbyor ba nyid do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'dir rku ba nyid ni de bas na 'di la brten pa'i dor byed pa la sbyor ba nyid do //
translated: Since it is theft, the one who is playing is engaged in the act of stealing.

original: dngos gzhi la so sor de ma thag pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos gzhi la so sor de ma thag pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: This is because the actual basis is immediately preceded by the preparatory stage.

original: grangs la ni de'i'o zhes bya ba ni grangs ni rtsis las te /
analyzed: grangs la ni de'i'o zhes bya ba ni grangs ni rtsis las te /
translated: The number is from calculation.

original: gang zhig dor byed pa ni rang gi sbyor la de'i sbyor ba nyid dang bcas pa dang // dngos gzhi la nyes byas ma yin pa la /
analyzed: gang zhig dor byed pa ni rang gi sbyor la de'i sbyor ba nyid dang bcas pa dang // dngos gzhi la nyes byas ma yin pa la /
translated: The one who subtracts is the one who has his own application, together with that application itself, and in the main part, it is not a misdeed.

original: grangs kyi skabs su dor byed pa nyid ni nyes byas yin gyi sbom por ni mi 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩmtshan ma phyis pa dang bsnan pa gnyis gnas gzhan du gzhag pa yang de nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni mtshan ma gang zhig gcig la sogs pa shod thabs kyi mtshan nyid byas pa de phyis pa zhes bya ba ni med par byas pa'o //
analyzed: grangs kyi skabs su dor byed pa nyid ni nyes byas yin gyi sbom por ni mi 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to // mtshan ma phyis pa dang bsnan pa gnyis gnas gzhan du gzhag pa yang de nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni mtshan ma gang zhig gcig la sogs pa shod thabs kyi mtshan nyid byas pa de phyis pa zhes bya ba ni med par byas pa'o //
translated: In the context of number, the act of subtracting is a misdeed, but it does not become a serious offense. This is the meaning.üîΩThe two, the removal and addition of signs, are also that very thing when placed in another location. The sign that is made the defining characteristic of the method of counting one and so on, that removal is called making it non-existent.

original: bsnan pa la gang zhig mtshan ma la ji ltar thob pa'i gzhan du gzhag pa yang de nyid do zhes bya ba ni dor byed pa nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bsnan pa la gang zhig mtshan ma la ji ltar thob pa'i gzhan du gzhag pa yang de nyid do zhes bya ba ni dor byed pa nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: In addition, that very thing is also when placed in another location according to the sign. The meaning of that is the act of subtracting.

original: thams cad du dbang byed pa'i mdo yin no //
analyzed: thams cad du dbang byed pa'i mdo yin no //
translated: This is the sutra of complete control.

original: rgyan gyi dbang du byed pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: rgyan gyi dbang du byed pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: It is not the case that the ornament is the object of the action.üîΩIn that, when it is accomplished, it is stealing.

original: de la grub pa na brkus pa yin no zhes bya ba la de la zhes bya ba ni grangs la'o //
analyzed: de la grub pa na brkus pa yin no zhes bya ba la de la zhes bya ba ni grangs la'o //
translated: In that refers to the number.

original: grub pa na zhes bya ba ni thob pa ste nor la brkus pa yin no //
analyzed: grub pa na zhes bya ba ni thob pa ste nor la brkus pa yin no //
translated: When it is accomplished means when it is obtained. It is stealing wealth.

original: @87a * // de bas na 'dir dor byed na sbyor ba'i sbyor ba nyid do //
analyzed: @87a * // de bas na 'dir dor byed na sbyor ba'i sbyor ba nyid do //
translated: Therefore, if it is discarded here, it is the application of the application.

original: thob pa'i phyir de ma thag pa'i bya ba la sbyor ba nyid do //
analyzed: thob pa'i phyir de ma thag pa'i bya ba la sbyor ba nyid do //
translated: For the sake of obtaining, it is the application to the action that immediately follows.

original: slar thob pa ni 'di'i bdag nyid dam de las gzhan pa'i gang zag bstan pa dang / bya ba 'ga' zhig la de'i nges par sbyar bas so //
analyzed: slar thob pa ni 'di'i bdag nyid dam de las gzhan pa'i gang zag bstan pa dang / bya ba 'ga' zhig la de'i nges par sbyar bas so //
translated: Obtaining again is either by the nature of this or by another person being taught, and by applying it to some action.

original: tshoms gzhan du bgrang ba yang de dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba yang rnyed pa'i phyir bdag nyid tshoms gzhan du bgrang ba yang de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: tshoms gzhan du bgrang ba yang de dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba yang rnyed pa'i phyir bdag nyid tshoms gzhan du bgrang ba yang de dang 'dra ste /
translated: Counting in another group is also like that. For the sake of obtaining, counting in another group is also like that.

original: de'i grangs kyi skabs su dor byed pa dang 'dra bar blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i grangs kyi skabs su dor byed pa dang 'dra bar blta bar bya'o //
translated: It should be seen as similar to discarding in the context of its number.

original: 'dir yang bgrang ba ni sbyor ba'i sbyor ba nyid de nyes byas nyid do //
analyzed: 'dir yang bgrang ba ni sbyor ba'i sbyor ba nyid de nyes byas nyid do //
translated: Here, counting is the application of the application itself, which is a minor offense.

original: grub pa'i tshe ni brkus pa nyid do //
analyzed: grub pa'i tshe ni brkus pa nyid do //
translated: When it is completed, it is a theft.

original: 'dir gzhung ni btsun pa dge slong gis re zhig bdag nyid tshoms gnyi gar bgrangs na ltung ba cir 'gyur /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni btsun pa dge slong gis re zhig bdag nyid tshoms gnyi gar bgrangs na ltung ba cir 'gyur /
translated: Here, the text states: ‚ÄúIf a monk first counts himself in both groups, what is the offense?‚Äù

original: nyes pa sbom por sbyor ba'i nyes byas su'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //üîΩsnga ma nyid phyi ma dag la phyi ma nyid snga ma dag la bsnyon pa yang ngo zhes bya ba yang gi sgra ni de dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba rjes su drang ba'i don du'o //
analyzed: nyes pa sbom por sbyor ba'i nyes byas su'o zhes gsungs pa yin no // snga ma nyid phyi ma dag la phyi ma nyid snga ma dag la bsnyon pa yang ngo zhes bya ba yang gi sgra ni de dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba rjes su drang ba'i don du'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIt is a serious offense of the application of a minor offense.‚ÄùüîΩThe word ‚Äúalso‚Äù in the line ‚Äúalso, the former in the latter and the latter in the former‚Äù means that the meaning should be inferred to be like that.üîΩThe former in the latter means that the former group is counted first in the latter groups. The former group is counted first in the latter groups, which are other than the group in which one counts oneself first.

original: snga ma'i grangs la phyi ma dag la ni tshoms dag la thog mar 'dir bdag nyid bgrang bar byas pa'i tshoms de las gzhan de rnams las bsnyon pa'am gzhan grangs gnyis pa gang yin pa de la tshoms snga ma shos gang la dang por de'i grangs byas pa
analyzed: snga ma'i grangs la phyi ma dag la ni tshoms dag la thog mar 'dir bdag nyid bgrang bar byas pa'i tshoms de las gzhan de rnams las bsnyon pa'am gzhan grangs gnyis pa gang yin pa de la tshoms snga ma shos gang la dang por de'i grangs byas pa
translated: The latter in the former means that the latter group is counted first in the former groups. The latter group is counted first in the former groups, which are other than the group in which one counts oneself first.

original: de'i tshoms yongs su thob pa rnams la bsnyon pa gang zhig de yang de dang 'dra bar grangs zin pa dor ba bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i tshoms yongs su thob pa rnams la bsnyon pa gang zhig de yang de dang 'dra bar grangs zin pa dor ba bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
translated: And the one who denies the share of the assembly should be viewed as one who has lost his share, like a count in a reckoning.

original: 'dir yang tshoms la sbyor ba'i sbyor ba nyid de nyes byas so //
analyzed: 'dir yang tshoms la sbyor ba'i sbyor ba nyid de nyes byas so //
translated: Here, too, the application of the assembly is the same as the application of the offense.

original: grub pa'i tshe ni brkus pa nyid do //
analyzed: grub pa'i tshe ni brkus pa nyid do //
translated: When it is accomplished, it is a theft.

original: 'dir gzhung ni btsun pa dge slong gis re zhig bdag nyid bgrang du stsal bas bsnyon ltung ba cir 'gyur /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni btsun pa dge slong gis re zhig bdag nyid bgrang du stsal bas bsnyon ltung ba cir 'gyur /
translated: Here, the text says: ‚ÄúIf a monk, having counted himself, denies, what is the offense?‚Äù

original: nyes pa sbom por sbyor ba'i nyes byas so zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: nyes pa sbom por sbyor ba'i nyes byas so zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúIt is a serious offense of wrongdoing.‚Äù

original: skal ba nyid ni de dag gang du thams cad kyi dang por bgrangs pa der ro zhes bya ba ni gang du de tshoms thams cad kyi dang por bgrangs pa der gtogs so //
analyzed: skal ba nyid ni de dag gang du thams cad kyi dang por bgrangs pa der ro zhes bya ba ni gang du de tshoms thams cad kyi dang por bgrangs pa der gtogs so //
translated: ‚ÄúThe share is in the place where all of them are counted first,‚Äù means that it is in the place where that assembly is counted first.

original: de la skal ba blangs pa la ni ltung ba med do zhes bya ba de la 'di ni byed pa'o //
analyzed: de la skal ba blangs pa la ni ltung ba med do zhes bya ba de la 'di ni byed pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThere is no offense for one who has taken a share,‚Äù means that this is the action.

original: mi dbang ba dbang bar sgrogs pa yang ngo zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mi dbang ba dbang bar sgrogs pa yang ngo zhes bya ba la /
translated: ‚ÄúAlso, one who proclaims what is not allowable as allowable,‚ÄùüîΩmeans that

original: yang gi sgras ni de dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba rjes su drang ba'i don du'o //
analyzed: yang gi sgras ni de dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba rjes su drang ba'i don du'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù is for the purpose of implying ‚Äúlike that.‚Äù

original: 'dir yang dbang bar sgrogs pa ni sbyor ba'i sbyor ba nyid de nyes byas so //
analyzed: 'dir yang dbang bar sgrogs pa ni sbyor ba'i sbyor ba nyid de nyes byas so //
translated: Here, the announcement of ownership is the application of the application, which is a minor offense.

original: grub pa'i tshe na ni brkus pa nyid do //
analyzed: grub pa'i tshe na ni brkus pa nyid do //
translated: When it is accomplished, it is a theft.

original: 'dir gzhung ni btsun pa dge slong gis re zhig rnyed pa glo bur ba mi dbang @87b ba la 'di skad ces bdag kyang dbang ngo zhes dbang bar sgrogs na ltung ba cir 'gyur /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni btsun pa dge slong gis re zhig rnyed pa glo bur ba mi dbang @87b ba la 'di skad ces bdag kyang dbang ngo zhes dbang bar sgrogs na ltung ba cir 'gyur /
translated: Here, the text says, ‚ÄúVenerable monks, if a monk, with regard to a sudden acquisition that is not his, announces, ‚ÄòIt is mine,‚Äô what is the offense?‚Äù

original: nyes pa sbom por sbyor ba'i nyes byas su 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: nyes pa sbom por sbyor ba'i nyes byas su 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúIt is a minor offense that is the application of a serious offense.‚Äù

original: ma bsgo bar slong ba yang ngo zhes bya ba ni grangs kyi skabs su dor byed pa de dang 'dra bar ma bsgo bar slong ba blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: ma bsgo bar slong ba yang ngo zhes bya ba ni grangs kyi skabs su dor byed pa de dang 'dra bar ma bsgo bar slong ba blta bar bya'o //
translated: ‚ÄúAlso, if one asks without permission‚Äù means that, like the one to be rejected in the section on enumeration, one should look at the one who asks without permission.

original: 'dir yang ma bsgo bar slong ba ni sbyor ba'i sbyor ba nyid de nyes byas so //
analyzed: 'dir yang ma bsgo bar slong ba ni sbyor ba'i sbyor ba nyid de nyes byas so //
translated: Here, asking without permission is the application of the application, which is a minor offense.

original: grub pa'i tshe na ni brkus pa nyid do //
analyzed: grub pa'i tshe na ni brkus pa nyid do //
translated: When it is accomplished, it is a theft.

original: 'dir gzhung ni btsun pa dge slong gis re zhig khyim bdag gi khyim du nye bar mchis pas /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni btsun pa dge slong gis re zhig khyim bdag gi khyim du nye bar mchis pas /
translated: Here, the text is: ‚ÄúIf a monk, a reverend, goes to the house of a householder,üîΩand if he goes to the relatives of that householder and says, ‚ÄòGive this and that thing to this person,‚Äô what is the offense?‚Äù

original: de khyim bdag de'i nye du'i thad du mchis nas khyim bdag na re 'di skad ces dngos po che ge mo dang mang ge zhig byin cig ces zer ro zhes bgyis na ltung ba cir 'gyur nyes pa sbom por sbyor ba'i nyes byas su'o zhes gsungs pa yin
analyzed: de khyim bdag de'i nye du'i thad du mchis nas khyim bdag na re 'di skad ces dngos po che ge mo dang mang ge zhig byin cig ces zer ro zhes bgyis na ltung ba cir 'gyur nyes pa sbom por sbyor ba'i nyes byas su'o zhes gsungs pa yin
translated: ‚ÄúIt is a wrong doing that is a serious downfall.‚ÄùüîΩ‚ÄúDenying contempt, deceit, and fraud is the performance.‚Äù

original: no // brnyas pa dang bskyis pa dang gtams pa rnams bsnyon pa ni sbyor ba'o zhes bya ba ni brnyas pa la sogs pa bsnyon pa ni sbyor ba ste /
analyzed: no // brnyas pa dang bskyis pa dang gtams pa rnams bsnyon pa ni sbyor ba'o zhes bya ba ni brnyas pa la sogs pa bsnyon pa ni sbyor ba ste /
translated: The denial of contempt, etc., is the performance.

original: med pa ni sbyor ba ma yin pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: med pa ni sbyor ba ma yin pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the absence of that is not the performance.üîΩ‚ÄúWhen there is denial, there is theft.‚Äù

original: brnogs pa na brkus pa yin no zhes bya ba ni brnyas pa la sogs pa de dag gang gi tshe brnogs shing mi sbyin par nges pa de'i tshe na brkus pa yin no //
analyzed: brnogs pa na brkus pa yin no zhes bya ba ni brnyas pa la sogs pa de dag gang gi tshe brnogs shing mi sbyin par nges pa de'i tshe na brkus pa yin no //
translated: When there is denial of those, contempt, etc., and it is certain that they will not be given, at that time there is theft.

original: de la brnyas nas gzhan la 'dir so sor de ma thag par gyur pa'i bya ba la bya ba med pa zhes bya ba de la brnyas pa nyid la sbyor ba nyid do ;
analyzed: de la brnyas nas gzhan la 'dir so sor de ma thag par gyur pa'i bya ba la bya ba med pa zhes bya ba de la brnyas pa nyid la sbyor ba nyid do ;
translated: Having despised that, he engages in despising the other, saying, ‚ÄúHere, in this action, there is no action.‚Äù

original: / brnogs pa las snga rol du gyur pa'i bsnyon pa gang zhig phyi ma ni ma yin zhing dus mnyam par yang ma yin par 'dir mngon par 'dod pa zhes bya ba 'di shugs kyis rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: / brnogs pa las snga rol du gyur pa'i bsnyon pa gang zhig phyi ma ni ma yin zhing dus mnyam par yang ma yin par 'dir mngon par 'dod pa zhes bya ba 'di shugs kyis rtogs par bya'o //
translated: One should understand by implication that the accusation that precedes the insult is not subsequent and is not simultaneous, as is intended here.

original: de la brnyas nas zhugs pa ni brnyan por zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: de la brnyas nas zhugs pa ni brnyan por zhugs pa'o //
translated: Having despised that, he engages in despising.üîΩHaving despised, he engages in giving individually, saying, ‚ÄúI will give.‚Äù

original: bskyis nas zhugs pa ni so sor sbyin bar bgyi zhes bya bas rnyed pa ni bskyis nas rnyed pa'o //
analyzed: bskyis nas zhugs pa ni so sor sbyin bar bgyi zhes bya bas rnyed pa ni bskyis nas rnyed pa'o //
translated: The acquisition is despised acquisition.

original: rab tu bskyis nas rnyed pa zhes bya ba drang srong gi tshig gang yin pa de la 'di nyams pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu bskyis nas rnyed pa zhes bya ba drang srong gi tshig gang yin pa de la 'di nyams pa'o //
translated: The acquisition that is thoroughly despised is the statement of the sage.

original: yongs su sbyor ba zhes bya ba 'di gzhan zhu ba las 'byung ba yin te /
analyzed: yongs su sbyor ba zhes bya ba 'di gzhan zhu ba las 'byung ba yin te /
translated: This is the thorough application, which arises from another question.

original: nor zad par yongs su sbyar ba'i don du ste /
analyzed: nor zad par yongs su sbyar ba'i don du ste /
translated: For the purpose of thoroughly applying the exhausted wealth,

original: de las nor bzung ba ma btang ba zhes bya ba'i don to ;
analyzed: de las nor bzung ba ma btang ba zhes bya ba'i don to ;
translated: The meaning is: ‚Äúwithout giving up what was wrongly taken.‚Äù

original: / yongs su 'gro bar byed pa zhes bya ba 'di gzhan dag gis brjod pa ste /
analyzed: / yongs su 'gro bar byed pa zhes bya ba 'di gzhan dag gis brjod pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúOne who causes to go‚Äù is the expression of others.

original: 'di dang che ge mo las 'gro ba bsgrub pa'i don du zhes bya ba ni 'di'i don to //
analyzed: 'di dang che ge mo las 'gro ba bsgrub pa'i don du zhes bya ba ni 'di'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: ‚Äúfor the purpose of establishing going from here to there.‚Äù

original: 'di gnyis ka yang tha mi dad par bskyis pa zhig bya ba brnogs pa na brkus pa yin no zhes bya ba'o //üîΩ'dis ni 'dir brku ba'am 'on te ma @88a * //
analyzed: 'di gnyis ka yang tha mi dad par bskyis pa zhig bya ba brnogs pa na brkus pa yin no zhes bya ba'o // 'dis ni 'dir brku ba'am 'on te ma @88a * //
translated: Both of these are combined without distinction. When the act of stealing is completed, it is stealing.

original: yin snyam du yid gnyis za bar gyur pa de'i tshe na gang zhig gnas la 'pho ba der ni nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yin snyam du yid gnyis za bar gyur pa de'i tshe na gang zhig gnas la 'pho ba der ni nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro //
translated: Here, when one is in doubt, thinking ‚ÄúIs this stealing or not?,‚Äù then when one moves from one place to another, there is a serious violation.

original: dngos po yongs su rdzogs pa de la pham pa mi bskyed ces bya ba 'di thal bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: dngos po yongs su rdzogs pa de la pham pa mi bskyed ces bya ba 'di thal bar rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that in that case, a defeat is not created in regard to that complete thing.

original: 'dir gzhung ni btsun pa dge slong gis re zhig bsnyon par byas nas rku na ltung ba cir 'gyur /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni btsun pa dge slong gis re zhig bsnyon par byas nas rku na ltung ba cir 'gyur /
translated: Here is the text: ‚ÄúVenerable, if a monk first denies and then steals, what is the offense?‚Äù

original: g-yar nas bsnyon par byed na nyes pa sbom por ro //
analyzed: g-yar nas bsnyon par byed na nyes pa sbom por ro //
translated: ‚ÄúIf he denies after borrowing, it is a serious violation.‚Äù

original: de gnyis lan 'ga' mthar 'gyur ba yang yod de gang gi tshe brnogs pa na'o //
analyzed: de gnyis lan 'ga' mthar 'gyur ba yang yod de gang gi tshe brnogs pa na'o //
translated: It is also possible that both are not completed, when one is accused.

original: dge slong gi thad du gzhan gyis gtams te gzhag pa de len pa'i tshe bsnyon na ltung ba cir 'gyur /
analyzed: dge slong gi thad du gzhan gyis gtams te gzhag pa de len pa'i tshe bsnyon na ltung ba cir 'gyur /
translated: If one is accused when taking that which another has placed before a bhik·π£u, what is the offense?

original: nyes pa sbom por ro //
analyzed: nyes pa sbom por ro //
translated: It is a serious transgression.

original: lan 'ga' ni mthar 'gyur te /
analyzed: lan 'ga' ni mthar 'gyur te /
translated: It is also possible that both are not completed,

original: gang gi tshe brnogs pa na'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //üîΩgtams pa sbas pa la gal te spo ba dang lhan cig tu dang / spos pa'i 'og tu dang / gal te sngar na ni sbyor ba gzhan nyid do zhes bya ba ni gtams pa yang ba gang yin pa gang zhig gzhag pa gnas gang du gal te spo bas gnas pa dang /
analyzed: gang gi tshe brnogs pa na'o zhes gsungs pa yin no // gtams pa sbas pa la gal te spo ba dang lhan cig tu dang / spos pa'i 'og tu dang / gal te sngar na ni sbyor ba gzhan nyid do zhes bya ba ni gtams pa yang ba gang yin pa gang zhig gzhag pa gnas gang du gal te spo bas gnas pa dang /
translated: when one is accused.üîΩIf that which is hidden is placed, if it is placed together with the one who is to be banished,üîΩif it is placed after the banishment, if it is placed before, the application is different.üîΩIf that which is hidden is light and is placed, if it is placed together with the one who is to be banished,

original: lhan cig tu brnogs na phyir spo ba'i 'og tu de las brnogs pa nyid ni brkus pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: lhan cig tu brnogs na phyir spo ba'i 'og tu de las brnogs pa nyid ni brkus pa nyid yin no //
translated: if it is placed after the banishment, that which is hidden is stolen.

original: 'on te spo ba las snga rol du brnogs na gzhan du bsnyon pa ni sbyor ba ste dngos gzhi'i rnam pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: 'on te spo ba las snga rol du brnogs na gzhan du bsnyon pa ni sbyor ba ste dngos gzhi'i rnam pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: But if the theft is prior to the moving, then the accusation is the preparation, because it is the form of the actual basis.

original: bsnyon pa yod kyang gang du chad pa nyid kyis brnogs na sbyor ba ma yin pa nyid du rtogs par mi bya'o //
analyzed: bsnyon pa yod kyang gang du chad pa nyid kyis brnogs na sbyor ba ma yin pa nyid du rtogs par mi bya'o //
translated: Even if the accusation exists, if it is accused in another place, it should not be understood as not being the preparation.

original: brnogs pa la brnogs pa'i snga rol du bsnyon pa la sbyor ba'i sbyor ba nyid do //
analyzed: brnogs pa la brnogs pa'i snga rol du bsnyon pa la sbyor ba'i sbyor ba nyid do //
translated: The preparation is the accusation prior to the theft.

original: de bas na sbyor ba nyid do //
analyzed: de bas na sbyor ba nyid do //
translated: Therefore, it is the preparation.

original: brnogs pa dang bsnyon pa'o //
analyzed: brnogs pa dang bsnyon pa'o //
translated: The theft and the accusation.

original: 'dir sbas pa ni brkus pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir sbas pa ni brkus pa'o //
translated: Here, the hidden is the stolen.

original: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong gi thad du gzhan gyis gtams te gzhag pa de len pa'i tshe bsnyon na nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong gi thad du gzhan gyis gtams te gzhag pa de len pa'i tshe bsnyon na nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro //
translated: Here, the text says that when one takes what has been entrusted to a monk by another and then accused of it, it becomes a serious offense.

original: lan 'ga' ni mthar 'gyur te gang gi tshe brnogs par byed cing dngos po tshang na ni mthar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lan 'ga' ni mthar 'gyur te gang gi tshe brnogs par byed cing dngos po tshang na ni mthar 'gyur ro //
translated: Sometimes it becomes a root downfall, when one steals and the object is complete, it becomes a root downfall.

original: gal te ma tshang na nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te ma tshang na nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is incomplete, it becomes a serious offense.

original: sngar brnogs par byed cing phyis gnas nas spo bar byed na brnogs pa'i tshe nyid na nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sngar brnogs par byed cing phyis gnas nas spo bar byed na brnogs pa'i tshe nyid na nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro //
translated: If one first insults and then banishes, then at the time of the insult, there is a serious offense.üîΩIf one first banishes and then insults, then at the time of the banishment, there is a serious offense.

original: ci ste sngar gnas nas spo bar byed cing dngos po tshang na mthar 'gyur ro //üîΩdngos po ma tshang na nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: ci ste sngar gnas nas spo bar byed cing dngos po tshang na mthar 'gyur ro // dngos po ma tshang na nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: If one first banishes and then insults, then at the time of the banishment, there is a serious offense.

original: skyid pa gcod pa dang gsod pa ni chud gzon pa yin no zhes bya ba ni glang po che dang rta dang rnga mo dang ba lang dang bsel sogs pa rnams la phan par ma gyur cig ces chu la gcod pa dang / gsong @88b pa ni sbed pa'o //
analyzed: skyid pa gcod pa dang gsod pa ni chud gzon pa yin no zhes bya ba ni glang po che dang rta dang rnga mo dang ba lang dang bsel sogs pa rnams la phan par ma gyur cig ces chu la gcod pa dang / gsong @88b pa ni sbed pa'o //
translated: The text says, The destruction of pleasure and killing are the destruction of what is beneficial. The destruction of pleasure is the destruction of elephants, horses, camels, oxen, and so on, with the thought, May they not be useful to anyone! The killing of what is beneficial is the killing of one's mother, father, or an arhat, with the thought, May they not live!

original: chud gzan pa zhes bya ba 'di la chud gzan pa'i tshig gi khongs su bsdu ba nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: chud gzan pa zhes bya ba 'di la chud gzan pa'i tshig gi khongs su bsdu ba nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The text says, The destruction of what is beneficial is included in the category of destruction, meaning that it is included in the category of destruction.

original: 'dir skyid pa gcod pa ni dpe yin te rnam par 'tshe ba gzhan dag la yang rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir skyid pa gcod pa ni dpe yin te rnam par 'tshe ba gzhan dag la yang rig par bya'o //
translated: Here, the destruction of pleasure is an example, and one should understand that it is the same for other kinds of harm.

original: 'dir gzhung ni ci ste phan par ma gyur cig ces gsod par byed na nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni ci ste phan par ma gyur cig ces gsod par byed na nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro ;
translated: If one kills with the thought, ‚ÄúMay this scripture not be helpful,‚Äù one commits a serious offense.üîΩIf one kills with the thought, ‚ÄúMay this person not be happy,‚Äù one also commits a serious offense.

original: / ci ste phan par ma gyur cig ces skyid pa gcod par byed na yang nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: / ci ste phan par ma gyur cig ces skyid pa gcod par byed na yang nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: If one evades a toll by saying, ‚ÄúI am not going through the tollgate,‚Äù one commits a serious offense.üîΩIf one evades a toll by going through the sky that is connected to the tollgate, one commits a serious offense.üîΩIf one evades a toll by going through the ground that is connected to the tollgate, one commits a serious offense.üîΩIf one evades a toll by going through the water that is connected to the tollgate, one commits a serious offense.üîΩIf one evades a toll by going through the air that is connected to the tollgate, one commits a serious offense.üîΩIf one evades a toll by going through the sky that is connected to the tollgate, one commits a serious offense.üîΩIf one evades a toll by going through the ground that is connected to the tollgate, one commits a serious offense.üîΩIf one evades a toll by going through the water that is connected to the tollgate, one commits a serious offense.üîΩIf one evades a toll by going through the air that is connected to the tollgate, one commits a serious offense.üîΩIf one evades a toll by going through the sky that is connected to the tollgate, one commits a serious offense.

original: mtshams kyi nam mkha' las sho gam 'dral bar byed na yang sbom po'i dbang du byas pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni mtshams dang 'brel ba'i nam mkha' gang yin pa de la sho gam 'dral ba'i sbom po'i dbang du byas pa nyid do //üîΩgang gis mtshams kyi khongs su bsdus pa'i sa la gnas pa lus kyis brtsal ba mtshon cha 'phangs pa la sogs pas sam /
analyzed: mtshams kyi nam mkha' las sho gam 'dral bar byed na yang sbom po'i dbang du byas pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni mtshams dang 'brel ba'i nam mkha' gang yin pa de la sho gam 'dral ba'i sbom po'i dbang du byas pa nyid do // gang gis mtshams kyi khongs su bsdus pa'i sa la gnas pa lus kyis brtsal ba mtshon cha 'phangs pa la sogs pas sam /
translated: If one evades a toll by going through the ground that is connected to the tollgate, one commits a serious offense.üîΩIf one evades a toll by going through the water that is connected to the tollgate, one commits a serious offense.üîΩIf one evades a toll by going through the air that is connected to the tollgate, one commits a serious offense.

original: ngag gis brtsal ba gsang sngags kyi bzlas brjod la sogs pas sam /
analyzed: ngag gis brtsal ba gsang sngags kyi bzlas brjod la sogs pas sam /
translated: If one evades a toll by going through the sky that is connected to the tollgate, one commits a serious offense.üîΩIf one evades a toll by going through the ground that is connected to the tollgate, one commits a serious offense.üîΩIf one evades a toll by going through the water that is connected to the tollgate, one commits a serious offense.üîΩIf one evades a toll by going through the air that is connected to the tollgate, one commits a serious offense.üîΩIf one evades a toll by going through the sky that is connected to the tollgate, one commits a serious offense.

original: yid kyis brtsal ba rdzu 'phrul mngon par 'du byed pa la sogs pa sho gam gyi bya ba ma chags par gyur pa lus dang 'brel ba'i nam mkha' 'ga' zhig la sho gam gyis 'da' bar byed na der ma sha ka lnga la sogs pa'i dngos por tshang
analyzed: yid kyis brtsal ba rdzu 'phrul mngon par 'du byed pa la sogs pa sho gam gyi bya ba ma chags par gyur pa lus dang 'brel ba'i nam mkha' 'ga' zhig la sho gam gyis 'da' bar byed na der ma sha ka lnga la sogs pa'i dngos por tshang
translated: If one who is not a carrier of goods, such as a monk who has attained magical powers, passes through the sky that is connected with the body of a carrier of goods, then he is not guilty of a downfall.

original: ba la yang nyes pa sbom po yin no //
analyzed: ba la yang nyes pa sbom po yin no //
translated: But if he passes through the sky that is not connected with the body of a carrier of goods, then he is guilty of a serious transgression.

original: gang gi tshe dge slong nam mkha' la gnas pa dang phyi rol gyi mtshams kyi sa la gnas pa la ni der ltung ba med ces bya ba 'dir bsdus par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe dge slong nam mkha' la gnas pa dang phyi rol gyi mtshams kyi sa la gnas pa la ni der ltung ba med ces bya ba 'dir bsdus par rig par bya'o //
translated: When a monk is in the sky or on the ground outside the border, there is no downfall for him. This should be understood as a summary.

original: rgyal po ngag ni sa la dbang ba yin gyi /
analyzed: rgyal po ngag ni sa la dbang ba yin gyi /
translated: The king is the lord of the earth,

original: nam mkha' la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: nam mkha' la ni ma yin no //
translated: but not of the sky.

original: de bas na dgongs pa med pa la sa la skyon med pa nyid du rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: de bas na dgongs pa med pa la sa la skyon med pa nyid du rnam par gzhag go //
translated: Therefore, there is no fault in the earth, but not in the sky.

original: rdzu 'phrul gyis khyer ba la ni nyes pa med pa nyid do zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyis khyer ba la ni nyes pa med pa nyid do zhes bya ba la /
translated: There is no fault in carrying by magical power.

original: 'di ni sho gam dral pa la gnas pa nyid de gsang sngags dang sman gyis byas pa dang yang 'dir las las skyes pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi mngon par shes pa yang 'di ltar mngon par shes pa med par zhing nyid ma yin pa'i phyir yid mi ches pa'i
analyzed: 'di ni sho gam dral pa la gnas pa nyid de gsang sngags dang sman gyis byas pa dang yang 'dir las las skyes pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi mngon par shes pa yang 'di ltar mngon par shes pa med par zhing nyid ma yin pa'i phyir yid mi ches pa'i
translated: Here, even if one has supernatural power born from karma, or has supernatural power created by mantra or medicine, if one does not have the supernatural knowledge of knowing the tax is not due, then one incurs a downfall.

original: sems dang ldan pa la thams cad du ltung ba med do ;
analyzed: sems dang ldan pa la thams cad du ltung ba med do ;
translated: But if one has a mind that does not believe in the tax, then one does not incur a downfall.

original: / gsang sngags dang sman gyi las kyis skyes pa gang zhig la /
analyzed: / gsang sngags dang sman gyi las kyis skyes pa gang zhig la /
translated: If one has supernatural power created by the action of mantra or medicine,

original: mtshams kyi khongs su gtogs pa'i sa la gnas pa'i khyer ba po la dgos pa med pa de la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: mtshams kyi khongs su gtogs pa'i sa la gnas pa'i khyer ba po la dgos pa med pa de la ltung ba med do //
translated: and if one is carrying it to a place within the border, and if the border guard has no need for it, then there is no downfall.

original: mtshams kyi khongs su gtogs pa'i sa la gnas pa'i khyer ba po la sbom po nyid do //
analyzed: mtshams kyi khongs su gtogs pa'i sa la gnas pa'i khyer ba po la sbom po nyid do //
translated: But if the border guard has need for it, then it is a serious transgression.

original: 'dir gzhung ni btsun pa dge @89a * //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni btsun pa dge @89a * //
translated: Here is the text:

original: slong gis re zhig nam mkha' las sho gam 'dral bar byed na ltung ba cir 'gyur /
analyzed: slong gis re zhig nam mkha' las sho gam 'dral bar byed na ltung ba cir 'gyur /
translated: ‚ÄúVenerable! If a monk were to violate the border tax in the sky, what downfall would he incur?‚ÄùüîΩ‚ÄúNone at all.‚Äù

original: gal te rdzu 'phrul gyis 'dral bar byed na ni ltung ba med do //
analyzed: gal te rdzu 'phrul gyis 'dral bar byed na ni ltung ba med do //
translated: If one breaks it by supernatural power, there is no offense.

original: ci ste rnam pa gzhan dag gis byed na nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: ci ste rnam pa gzhan dag gis byed na nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: If one does it by other means, there is a serious violation.

original: mtshams gzhan du yang ngo zhes bya ba ni nyes pa med pa nyid do //
analyzed: mtshams gzhan du yang ngo zhes bya ba ni nyes pa med pa nyid do //
translated: If it is in another monastery, there is no offense.

original: sho gam dral ba na yang zhes bya ba dang rjes su sbyar ro //
analyzed: sho gam dral ba na yang zhes bya ba dang rjes su sbyar ro //
translated: If one breaks the toll, it is also like this.üîΩIf it is in another monastery, there is no downfall for one who passes by the toll station.

original: mtshams gzhan du zhes bya ba sho gam gyi bya ba 'da' bar byed pa la ltung ba yod pa ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mtshams gzhan du zhes bya ba sho gam gyi bya ba 'da' bar byed pa la ltung ba yod pa ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is what is meant.

original: sho gam gyi gnas nas thob pa'i spong ba'i bdag nyid can dral ba'i bsam pa med pa la rku ba'i sems zhes bya ba 'di la 'di brjod pa'o //
analyzed: sho gam gyi gnas nas thob pa'i spong ba'i bdag nyid can dral ba'i bsam pa med pa la rku ba'i sems zhes bya ba 'di la 'di brjod pa'o //
translated: If one has obtained it from the toll station, and one has no intention of breaking it, and one has no thought of stealing, this is what is meant here by the thought of stealing.

original: bsgo na nyes byas so zhes bya ba ni sho gam dral na zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: bsgo na nyes byas so zhes bya ba ni sho gam dral na zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: If one is told to pay the toll, there is an offense of wrong conduct.üîΩIf one breaks the toll, it is also like this.

original: sa gang zhig la sho gam la sbyin par bya ba nyid des mi 'gro ba la thad kar de las 'da' bar byed pa'am so sor bzlog pa la sa ma thob pa nyid la gzhan gyis 'gro ba'am bzlog pa zhes shugs kyis rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: sa gang zhig la sho gam la sbyin par bya ba nyid des mi 'gro ba la thad kar de las 'da' bar byed pa'am so sor bzlog pa la sa ma thob pa nyid la gzhan gyis 'gro ba'am bzlog pa zhes shugs kyis rtogs par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that one is not to go directly beyond the border where one must pay the toll, or one should turn back from there, and one should not go beyond the border where one has already paid the toll.

original: lam gzhan ston na yang ngo zhes bya ba sho gam dral ba'i zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: lam gzhan ston na yang ngo zhes bya ba sho gam dral ba'i zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: If one shows another path, one should also pay the toll.üîΩOne should understand that one should pay the toll if one goes by another path to the place where one must pay the toll, or if one turns back from there, or if one goes directly beyond the border, or if one goes by another path beyond the border where one has already paid the toll.üîΩIf one does not do what one is told, one should pay the toll.üîΩIf one does not do what one is told, one should pay the toll.üîΩIf one does not do what one is told, one should pay the toll.

original: sho gam gyi sa la 'gro ba'i lam gzhan nas 'gro ba'am phyir bzlog par bya ba'am thad kar 'gro ba las sam thob pa nyid la sho gam gyi sa la 'gro ba las lam gzhan nas 'gro ba 'am phyir bzlog pa la zhes bya ba 'di 'dir shugs
analyzed: sho gam gyi sa la 'gro ba'i lam gzhan nas 'gro ba'am phyir bzlog par bya ba'am thad kar 'gro ba las sam thob pa nyid la sho gam gyi sa la 'gro ba las lam gzhan nas 'gro ba 'am phyir bzlog pa la zhes bya ba 'di 'dir shugs

original: thabs kyis brjod na phra mor ro zhes bya ba bsgo ba dang lam gzhan ston pa de gnyis ka'i dngos su mi byed par thabs kyis brjod pa yin pa de ni zur gyis smra ba ste /
analyzed: thabs kyis brjod na phra mor ro zhes bya ba bsgo ba dang lam gzhan ston pa de gnyis ka'i dngos su mi byed par thabs kyis brjod pa yin pa de ni zur gyis smra ba ste /
translated: If one does not do what one is told, one should pay the toll.

original: dngos su brjod pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di lta bur gyur pa phra mo ste /
analyzed: dngos su brjod pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di lta bur gyur pa phra mo ste /
translated: It is not directly stated, but this is the subtle point.

original: shin tu yang ba'i nyes byas zhe bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: shin tu yang ba'i nyes byas zhe bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is a very light offense.

original: lam gol ba ni lam dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba ni thams cad du lam ma yin pas brkus pa la sho gam gyi sar 'gro ba'i lam yin pas 'da' bar byed pa la skyon dang bral ba nyid dang 'grib pa yang ma yin zhes bya ba'i don toüîΩ// kha dang tshem bu ni skungs gzhan dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba ni ji ltar sgro ba ngag la sogs pa'i skungs gzhan gyis rku ba'am 'da' bar byed na nyes par 'gyur ba de bzhin du kha dang tshe ma bu'i nang dang bar du bcug ste rku 'am 'da'
analyzed: lam gol ba ni lam dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba ni thams cad du lam ma yin pas brkus pa la sho gam gyi sar 'gro ba'i lam yin pas 'da' bar byed pa la skyon dang bral ba nyid dang 'grib pa yang ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to // kha dang tshem bu ni skungs gzhan dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba ni ji ltar sgro ba ngag la sogs pa'i skungs gzhan gyis rku ba'am 'da' bar byed na nyes par 'gyur ba de bzhin du kha dang tshe ma bu'i nang dang bar du bcug ste rku 'am 'da'
translated: The path is like a path, but it is not a path everywhere. The meaning is that there is no fault or loss in passing through a path that leads to a customs station in order to steal.üîΩThe mouth and the anus are like other hiding places,

original: bar byed na yang nyes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bar byed na yang nyes par 'gyur ro //
translated: just as there is a fault or loss in stealing or passing through other hiding places such as a cave, in the same way, there is a fault or loss in stealing or passing through the mouth or anus.

original: lus kyi @89b khongs su gtogs pa nyid kyi phyir 'di ni lus su gyur pa ste /
analyzed: lus kyi @89b khongs su gtogs pa nyid kyi phyir 'di ni lus su gyur pa ste /
translated: This is a body because it is included in the body.

original: gos kyi khong su gtogs pa nyid kyi phyir gos yin pas shes par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: gos kyi khong su gtogs pa nyid kyi phyir gos yin pas shes par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: It is not to be known because it is clothing, since it belongs to the inside of the clothing.

original: de bas na nyes pa med pa nyid dang 'grib pa ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩ'dir gzhung ni khas rku na mtha'i ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas na nyes pa med pa nyid dang 'grib pa ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to // 'dir gzhung ni khas rku na mtha'i ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, there is no fault, and there is no diminution.üîΩHere, the treatise states:üîΩIf one steals the border, there is a downfall.

original: tshem bus rku na mtha'i ltung bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: tshem bus rku na mtha'i ltung bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: If one steals the border, there is a downfall.üîΩIf one is free from the intention to steal, there is no final limit.

original: rku sems dang bral na mtha'i mthar thug pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba ni gang rku sems kyi sbyor ba dang de med par brnogs pa la sbyor ba'i ltung ba tsam la de bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: rku sems dang bral na mtha'i mthar thug pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba ni gang rku sems kyi sbyor ba dang de med par brnogs pa la sbyor ba'i ltung ba tsam la de bskyed pa'o //
translated: This is the agent in the mere downfall of preparation for the intention to steal and the absence of that.

original: dngos gzhi'i ltung ba tsam ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di la 'di ni byed pa'o //
analyzed: dngos gzhi'i ltung ba tsam ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di la 'di ni byed pa'o //
translated: It is not the mere downfall of the actual basis.

original: yongs su rdzogs pa'i dus su rku sems nyid bsal ba la mthar thug pa dang dngos gzhi la rjes su 'grub pa nyid ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yongs su rdzogs pa'i dus su rku sems nyid bsal ba la mthar thug pa dang dngos gzhi la rjes su 'grub pa nyid ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: At the time of completion, the intention to steal is eliminated, and there is no final limit. It is not established in the actual basis. This is the meaning.

original: sbyor ba la de med na de ma byas pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sbyor ba la de med na de ma byas pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: If it does not exist in the preparatory action, then it is not the case that it is not committed.

original: sbyor ba la zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba'i gnas skabs la'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba la zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba'i gnas skabs la'o //
translated: In the preparatory action refers to the state of the preparatory action.

original: de med na zhes bya ba ni rku sems de med la rdzas bzung ba'i dus su 'di yod pas tha ma dang dngos gzhi la byas pa nyid kho na'o //
analyzed: de med na zhes bya ba ni rku sems de med la rdzas bzung ba'i dus su 'di yod pas tha ma dang dngos gzhi la byas pa nyid kho na'o //
translated: If it does not exist means that if the thought to steal does not exist, but the object is seized, then it is only the final stage and the actual basis.

original: gang du rku sems med par sbyor ba mthar thug pa ni rku sems kyi sbyor ba'i ltung ba nyid la der sgrub pa yin gyi dngos gzhi'i ltung ba ni ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di la 'di brjod pa'o //
analyzed: gang du rku sems med par sbyor ba mthar thug pa ni rku sems kyi sbyor ba'i ltung ba nyid la der sgrub pa yin gyi dngos gzhi'i ltung ba ni ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di la 'di brjod pa'o //
translated: This is said here: Where the thought to steal does not exist, but the culmination of the preparatory action is the downfall of the preparation of the thought to steal, it is established there, but it is not the downfall of the actual basis.

original: 'dir gzhung ni btsun pa dge slong chos gos kyi gdang las chos gos len pa'i snga rol du rku sems byung la phyis ni rang gi 'du shes kyis blangs na ltung ba cir 'gyur /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni btsun pa dge slong chos gos kyi gdang las chos gos len pa'i snga rol du rku sems byung la phyis ni rang gi 'du shes kyis blangs na ltung ba cir 'gyur /
translated: Here the text says: Venerable, if a monk has the thought to steal before taking a Dharma robe from a Dharma robe rack, but later takes it with the perception that it is his own, what downfall does he incur?

original: sngar ni nyes pa sbom por ro //
analyzed: sngar ni nyes pa sbom por ro //
translated: Previously, he incurs a serious offense.

original: phyis ni ltung ba med do //
analyzed: phyis ni ltung ba med do //
translated: Later, there is no downfall.

original: sngar rang gi 'du shes kyis len la phyis rku sems kyis rku na ltung ba ci 'gyur /
analyzed: sngar rang gi 'du shes kyis len la phyis rku sems kyis rku na ltung ba ci 'gyur /
translated: If one first takes something with the perception that it belongs to oneself, but later steals it with the thought to steal, what downfall does one incur?

original: sngar ni ltung ba med do //
analyzed: sngar ni ltung ba med do //
translated: One does not incur a downfall at first,

original: phyis ni nyes pa sbom por ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: phyis ni nyes pa sbom por ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: but later one incurs a serious violation.

original: rang gi 'du shes yod pa la rku sems nye bar gzhag pa'i dbang du mdzad nas 'dir nyes pa sbom por ro zhes gsungs so zhes rnam par gnas so //
analyzed: rang gi 'du shes yod pa la rku sems nye bar gzhag pa'i dbang du mdzad nas 'dir nyes pa sbom por ro zhes gsungs so zhes rnam par gnas so //
translated: This is the settled opinion, since the Buddha spoke from the perspective of one who has the perception of ownership and the thought to steal.üîΩThere is no downfall if one sends a letter, etc.

original: spring yig la sogs pas ni na smad pa med do zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa zhes bya ba nges pa'i tshig las lag yig dang rgya'i yi ge rnams kyis 'grim pa thob pa la 'di ni rtsom pa'o //
analyzed: spring yig la sogs pas ni na smad pa med do zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa zhes bya ba nges pa'i tshig las lag yig dang rgya'i yi ge rnams kyis 'grim pa thob pa la 'di ni rtsom pa'o //
translated: The term ‚Äúdesire‚Äù in the root text is a general term for sexual intercourse.
